loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 36 year old married woman with two children.  Both of them are in school.  She has had a business of selling food in Yambio South Sudan for the past two years.
Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Porn's Group

texts.en:
The head of a big family in a village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Porn is the father of nine children, two of whom are married and the rest of whom work on the farm to support the family. Porn is a farmer who grows maize and beans as his primary business. He has been in this business for 10 years.

This is Porn's sixth loan from VisionFund. He took his first loan five years ago. The loans have helped him better support his family and afford sufficient food. He and his group member, who has been with VisionFund for six years, are applying for another loan. He will use his portion of the loan, US $250, to buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes that he will earn more income from his business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, solicita un nuevo préstamo con la intención de mejorar su negocio de tortillas comprando: maíz, leña, gas, bolsas, asi podrá tener lo necesario para el sostenimiento de su negocio.
Ella considera que los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque el negocio está estable logro tener mejores resultados en sus ganancias y en clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is requesting a new loan because she wants to improve her activity by buying maize, firewood, gas and bags to make tortillas; in this way she will be able to acquire what she needs to support her activity.
She says that the previous loans have been of great helped for her because her activity is now stable and she has succeeded in obtaining better results both with her earning and with her customers.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, gas and bags.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 56, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a construction worker. Her daughter is a garment worker. Now, her son is getting a job in Korea. 

Therefore, Thon is requesting for a loan of USD 300 to pay for her son's medical checkup for his immigration to Korea. 

In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop for her daughter at home and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to pay for her son's medical checkup.

loans.name: Maria Agneli

texts.es:
Maria siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su hijo una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida. Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo, a quien siempre le ha tenido que ofrecer el sustento necesario, pues su padre los abandonó sin contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Maria desde entonces tiene su negocio de venta de fritos, snack y dulces con lo que garantiza los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Maria en su negocio ha podido tener muy buenos clientes, pues principalmente son los estudiantes quienes acceden a su tienda y esto le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Maria presenta al mismo tiempo el inconveniente de la ausencia de ventas cuando los estudiantes se encuentran de vacaciones, por lo que debe generar grandes ventas cuando los estudiantes se encuentran para poder soportar los gastos en los meses donde no hay estudiantes. Debido a que ha iniciado la temporada escolar, y Maria cuenta con muy bajo capital, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de snack, fritos, dulces, gaseosas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio en la temporada escolar. 
Maria espera que de esta manera pueda ofrecer a sus clientes todas sus necesidades, y de esta manera tener grandes ventas. Además, Maria espera que con ingresos adicionales pueda garantizarle a su hijo una educación de calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.

loans.use: Compra de productos de snack, fritos, dulces, gaseosas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio en la temporada escolar.

loans.name: Bertha Angelica

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 39 años de edad y vive enSan Martin junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como Obrera en los diferentes Fundos Agrícolas de la zona y le va muy bien porque es responsable, trabajadora, honesta y dedicada a su labor.
Bertha está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar puertas para incorporarlas en los cuartos que tiene la vivienda y de esta manera la familia pueda sentirse más cómoda viviendo en un ambiente más seguro.
texts.en:
Bertha is an enterprising woman. She is 39 years old and lives in San Martin with her family. For various years now she has worked as a laborer in different agricultural establishments in the zone. This is going very well because she is responsable, hard-working, honest, and dedicated to her work.

Bertha is grateful for her Kiva loans because with the help they have provided, she has begun to purchase doors to incorporate into the rooms of her house. And now, her family feels more comfortable living in a more secure environment.

loans.use: buy additional doors to install in her residence.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Surrounded with a poor financial circumstances she needed to start her own business to increase her purchasing power for meeting her household expenditures financially. Musarat  is 46 years old, married woman and a mother of 5 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with four children. She lives in Kijichi area in Dar es Salaam. The area has no reliable water supply. By the help of her husband and her own savings she managed to buy a water tank and an electric pump. The current size of the tank is not sufficient to meet demand of water from residents.  No public water system exist in the area. Erratic power supply which is experienced by all residents in Dar es Salaam also justifies the need for an additional storage tank and its accessories.  The additional tank will also provide an additional facility for treatment of water ready for domestic use. The project has a great value to the community as it provides a valuable resource need by each households and reduces incidences of water borne diseases.

loans.use: Purchase of Water Tank

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is married with seven children. He started his livestock trading business 4 years ago in order to supplement his farming activities. He initially started by trading in chicken locally and gradually expanded his business to goats and has subsequently included cattle. He intends to use the US$400 loan from PEMCI to expand his livestock trade. He is very encouraged by the availability of such services and facilities and he is full of expectations for a bright future. The growth in his business has given him good standing in his community and many now seek his advice. He has become a very strong promoter of PEMCI’s services wherever he goes.

loans.use: To Improve and Increase Livestock Trading

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese T. is from the village of Lotofaga Safata.  She is 43-years old and has four children; two of her children are married while the other two remain in school.  She is pictured here with her small children and her grandchildren.  Ese runs a small retail shop in her village.  She is very focused on growing her business and so is her entire family.  By working together, her family ensures that the shop is able to stay open long hours to satisfy her customers and improve her profits.  Ese reinvests as much of her business profit as possible; she is working hard to expand her product line to ensure that the local villagers have access to a wide variety of products.  She will use a loan to buy more merchandise for her shop as well as to buy wood, paint, and corrugated iron to renovate her shop, as a portion of the structure is damaged.

loans.use: Purchase inventory and supplies for renovation of store

texts.en: Mrs. L. is 49 yrs. old, and so is her husband. They have four sons; two are still at school. They live in Nghe An, a rural province in the center of Vietnam. Mrs. L. raises pigs and has a fishpond, and besides that she sells beer. She wants to become a local agent for Bia Hai Phong. With selling beer she can make a profit of $ 12.50 per day.

loans.use: She wants to buy beer from the supplier and become their only agent

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu Z. K. is forty-seven years old, married with three children.  She is from Magburaka town of Northern Sierra Leone.  Her husband is a petty trader in the same town and she runs a stall of locally made handicrafts and ink for tye and dye. Yeabu’s income supplements her husband’s micro business income to meet the family’s expenses.  She said her income is used to purchase food and her husband’s income is for school fees, medical and other expenses.  Their plan is to build a family house.  Yeabu is therefore requesting a loan of $175 to expand her business.

loans.use: Expansion of handicrafts business

loans.name: Mehrijon

texts.ru:
Mehrijon sells traditional Tajik bread at the central market of Kanibadam. She purchases the bread wholesale at the same market and then sells it individually. This helps Mehrijon to support her family budget. She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. With the help of loans from MicroInvest she has increased the productivity of her business.

Mehrijon plans to use the new loan to further expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мехричон занимается продажей таджикского национального хлеба на центральном рынке г. Канибадам. Покупает она его оптом здесь же и потом продает в розницу. Это помогает ей поддержать свой семейный бюджет. Мехричон 45 лет, она замужем и имеет 5 детей. С помощью займов Микроинвест увеличила оборот своего бизнеса. Мехричон и дальше собирается получать займы для расширения своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en: Mrs. Thaong O., age 60, works with her husband on their plot of farmland, earning only a meager $1.50 per day from the sales of their crops. She is pictured in her home. They have three children who are married and live separately. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase a water pump to bring water from their well to irrigate their vegetables. Currently, they pull the water up in a bucket by hand and water the crops manually. A water pump would greatly increase their efficiency as well as allow them to grow a greater quantity of crops to sell, leading to an increase in income.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence K. is requesting a loan in order to increase her stock so that she can supply shops and other grocery stories with supplies.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Mrs. Lim P., 37, is married with three school-aged children. She works with her husband as brokers purchasing yams in large quantities from the growers and reselling them to the people in her area for a profit of about $4 each day. Moreover, this couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more yams to meet the clients' needs.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Thun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thun S. is 30 years old. She supervises the guesthouse in front of the Lux Cinema in Phnom Penh City. Her husband, Mr. Vann Syden, is also a supervisor and takes care of three children. Together, they can earn a basic salary of about $150.00 per month.

Mrs. S. and her husband work very hard everyday to cover their family’s expenses. They have also successfully completed a loan with HKL.

In order to raise her income level and improve her family’s living conditions, Mrs. S. is requesting a loan of $700.00 to purchase a clothing store in the Bom Beak market. She appreciates HKL for their support and promises to be accurate in her loan payment.

Her husband is pictured in the photo because she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a store to sell clothes

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 37-year-old man. He lives in Tripoli, in Northern Lebanon, with his family. Mohamad has 4 children. He is a blacksmith. This is the fourth time he is applying for a loan at A. Majmoua. He wants to buy a large number of materials in order to get it for a reduced price.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 41 years old, and she has five children, all of whom are in school (e.g., one is studying nursing). Mary prepares and sells banku (a meal prepared from milled maize), plain rice, and vegetable sauce for the people of her community. However, she has to travel to nearby villages (such as Tema and Nkawkaw) in order to buy the various inputs that she uses to prepare food.

Accordingly, she is seeking a loan to buy more bags of rice, cartons of fish, chicken thighs, and vegetables to enable her expand her operation and to avoid increasing input prices.

She is a member of the group called “Eye Yehowa” (meaning, "it is God"). Group members agree in principle to guarantee each other to repay their respective loans.

loans.use: To expand her business and to reduce transaction/transportation costs by purchasing additional food products (e.g., bags of rice, carton of fresh fish, chicken, maize, etc.) in bulk

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey SaR., 28-yeas old, has already repaid her first loan. She is requesting a second loan so she can continue improving her standard of living. She has two small children and is a garment factory worker. She is very impressed and amazed at how her first loan impacted her family. She used the loan to purchase a concrete mixer for her husband, a construction foreman. This increase her husbands productivity and increased their income. This second loan will be used to buy more construction equipment that will further increase her husband's productivity and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more construction's tools for her husband to reduce his work load

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is 46 years old. She lives with her parents in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh, in Southern Lebanon. Amira is the owner of a small tailoring atelier and she supports her parents through the income earned from her enterprise.

This is the first loan that Amira has ever requested. She would like to borrow $300 to purchase fabrics and raw materials to expand her business.

loans.use: USD 300 to purchase some fabrics and raw material

loans.name: Sutariyanto

texts.id:
Sutariyanto (46 year old) lives in a rented house with his family. He rents the house for USD 25/ month. His son, Delta, is attending Junior High School.

Sutariyanto is a used goods/ wasted goods/ garbage collector. He walks around places to find used goods/ wasted goods and collect them. These goods are for example: used iron cans, paper carts, used boxes etc. He sells these goods to a recycle depot.

He usually starts his day at 5 am, then he takes break from 12 noon to 2 pm before he starts again to walks around places up tp 5 pm. He earns IDR 50 thousand/ day (around USD 6/ day).

He wants to use the loan money as a working capital so he can open somekind of small depot where people can go directly to him to sell their used goods/ wasted goods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Keseharian Sutariyanto (46) adalah sebagai seorang pemulung. Dia berjalan keliling dari satu tempat ke tempat lainnya mencari barang bekas dan rongsokan. Barang bekas seperti besi, karton, kaleng, kertas dan lain-lain nantinya akan dijual lagi ke penadah. Sarana yang dipakai sehari-hari adalah gerobak dorong untuk menampung barang bekas hasil cariannya. Mulai dari pagi jam 5, dia sudah siap berkeliling sampai siang hari jam 12. Setelah beristirahat 1 jam, dia berangkat lagi jam 2 dan pulang jam 5 sore. Penghasilan yang didapat perhari sekitar Rp.50.000. Keuntungan yang didapat dari usahanya dipakai untuk kebutuhan sehari-hari dan membiayai sekolah anaknya, Delta yang saat ini sudah di bangku SMP. Saat ini bersama keluarganya, dia tinggal di sebuah rumah yang disewa perbulan dengan harga Rp. 200.000. Dia berharap, dari pinjaman kali bisa dipakai untuk dijadikan modal membeli barang bekas, sehingga dia tidak haris berkeliling mencari lagi. Dengan demikian, keuntungan yang didapat bisa lebih besar.

loans.use: To purchase used goods/ garbage (Membeli Barang Bekas)

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. He is living in a rented house. His elderly mother and father live with him in the same house. His oldest son is studying at the university, and the others are studying in school. He has a small sewing shop, and he applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric. He wants to renovate the shop in order to improve his life and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled.  Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 45 years old. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are at school. Mrs. L. has been in TYM since 2003. Up to now, she has used most of her loans to raise chickens and pigs. With experience gathered over years, her business is now developing and getting more and more stable. With an income of VND 2 million/month, her famiL.'s life has been improved. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9 million to buy more chickens and pigs to expand her business.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La Señora Noemí, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras tanto “Las Zamaritanas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección de  lencería y todo tipo de prendas para damas, caballeros y niños en su pequeño taller  ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. José Olaya Nº 940. Trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes son amigos, familiares y personas que llegan gracias a la recomendación de sus clientes ya existentes a quienes ella trata de la mejor manera para poder mantenerlos y asegurar sus ventas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800, el cual será cancelado en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, telas de diversos colores y variedades para la confección de todo tipo de prendas, elásticos, blondas, cierres y todo lo que se requiere en la realización de sus trabajos. Desea contar con un buen stock porque sabe que ya llegan las fiestas de fin de año y ahí es cuando le llegan muchos pedidos.

Noemí tiene  42 años de edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus metas. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora y su meta  es seguir creciendo en su taller de costura para lo cual piensa comprar máquinas industriales modernas.
texts.en:
Noemí, a member of the Las Zamaritanas interim credit group, lives in the Tarapoto district of San Martín province and region. She specializes in making lingerie and all kinds of garments for ladies, gentlemen and children. Her small atelier is located in her own home at number 940 in the José Olaya neighborhood. She does custom work for her clients, who are friends, family, and people that come thanks to the recommendations of current clients, whom she treats in the best manner possible to retain their custom and ensure sales. With this six-month loan of $275 (800 nuevos soles), Noemí will purchase various colors of thread, various types and colors of fabric for making all kinds of garments, elastic, lace, fasteners and all that is needed to carry out her tasks. She wants to have a variety of stock on hand because she knows that the holiday season is approaching and that is when she receives many orders. Noemí is 42 years old, and lives with her husband who supports her goals. She is an optimistic and enterprising woman and her aim is to continue expanding her sewing workshop and she intends to purchase modern industrial sewing machines.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of thread, fabric, elastic, lace, zippers, et cetera

loans.name: Hipolita

texts.es: Hipólita tiene 59 años, vive sola, ya que no tuvo familia. La venta de carne es el negocio con el cual se mantiene Hipólita, desde ya treinta años, ella tiene un puesto en el Mercado Bellavista de la ciudad de Puno, donde ofrece sus diversos tipos de carne. Para Hipólita su trabajo es su razón de ser, ya que al no tener familia se dedica íntegramente a él, poniéndole mucho empeño para lograr las ganancias requeridas, pero el constante viaje que realiza a las provincias para traer la carne hace que se le haga trabajoso, teniendo que cargar grandes cantidades en su espalda. Este es su primer préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero que solicita viajará a traer más carne a las provincias de la ciudad de Puno para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Hipólita is 59 years old and lives alone since she never had a family. Selling meat is the business by which she has supported herself for the past 30 years. She has a stand in the Bellavista market in the city of Puno where she offers different cuts of meat. Her work is Hipólita´s reason for living and because she has no family she devotes herself completely to it. She makes a big effort to earn a living, but the constant travel she does to the provinces to bring back meat is hard because she has to carry huge quantities on her back. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has been on time with her payments. With the money she requests she will travel to bring back more meat from the provinces to Puno, so that she can increase her income and secure her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cover travel expenses to purchase goods for her business.

loans.name: Vong's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. Mrs. Vong S., 46, makes a living roasting bananas to sell in front of her house in her village to her neighbors.  She has two young children; both in school. Her husband, Mr. Ty Chandara, 39, is a taxi driver who earns a salary $150 per month. To grow the business, S. is applying for a loan to purchase more bananas to roast and sell. S. is the leader of this group.  Her group has three members:
Mrs. Sos A., 37, a tailor. She requests a loan to buy more clothes for her business.
Mrs. Kem S., 50, a local tailor.  He seeks a loan to purchase sewing materials.
Mrs. Vong M., 58, a vegetable seller.  He seeks a loan to enlarge her business. 
They all live in Ratanak Commune in the Battambang Province.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily M. Vasquez is 20 years old.  She lives in Pucallpa, Peru – a major city in the eastern jungle region of the country.  This steaming, humid city is situated on the banks of the Ucayali River, a tributary of the Amazon River.  

Emily is a member of the Las Heroinas communal bank and has been taking out small business loans for 1.5 years to support her moto-taxi and lingerie businesses.  Mototaxis are basically motorized rickshaws comprised of the front half of motorcycle attached to a two-wheeled passenger cart in back.  Emily rents moto-taxis in addition to selling lingerie.  It is common for Peruvians to pursue more than one entrepreneurial endeavour to make ends meet.

Emily is currently requesting a Kiva loan of 1,100 Nuevo Soles to purchase socks, stockings, underwear and brassiers for her lingerie business.  She will repay the loan in monthly installments.  The proceeds from Emily’s business go to support her family and her young child.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her lingerie business

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La señora Laura vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Pioneros de la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que ella tiene es la elaboración de artesanías en yeso, las cuales vende en las diferentes ferias de los departamentos de Bolivia.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar material (yeso, colorantes, etc.) y de esta manera poder surtir a todos sus clientes.

Es cliente de impro y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno.
texts.en:
Señora Laura lives in her parents' home on Pioneros Street, Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz. Her business is creating plaster handicrafts that she sells in various street markets in the states of Bolivia. The loan she is requesting is to buy materials (plaster, colorings, etc.) in order to be able to supply all her clients. She is a client of Impro and has an excellent history of repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plaster and colorings for her business of creating plaster handicrafts

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. raises pigs in her backyard. She would like to raise more pigs, but she does not have enough capital to run her business. Helen has been an active and a good CEVI client. She has a good credit history. For almost two years she has maintained good repayment records as she has established her business.

Helen is 56 years old and has 3 children.

Aside from raising pigs, she also has a small farm. She grows rice help to support their family. Her husband Eddie A. helps her manage their livelihood.

She now is asking for a loan so she can buy feed for her pigs. She believes a business line of credit will help to contribute more to their family income. She may start another business; her loan will help her get started in building a sari-sari store.

CEVI provides their clients the credit assistance that they need. They also receive training and insurance coverage from CEVI to help their small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr:
Née en 1958 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin, D. Eugénie réside dans le 4e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo. D. Eugénie est Mère de trois (03) enfants dont un (01) scolarisé.D. Eugénie est vendeuse de divers. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenu, D. Eugénie mène comme activité secondaire la vente d’ignames frites ; du haricot ; du riz préparé. Pour plus rentabiliser ses activités et se faire assez de revenus pouvant lui permettre d’envoyer ses enfants à l’école, Eugénie sollicite un crédit.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Eugénie D. was born in 1958 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin, where she now lives, in the fourth arrondissement. Eugénie D. is the mother of three children, out of which one attends school. She's a reseller. To diversify her sources of income, she runs a secondary business selling fried yams, beans, and cooked rice. To increase her profits and her income enough to enable her to send her children to school, she's seeking a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pasta, milk, sugar, soaps, bouillon cubes, rice, beans, and yams

loans.name: Rose Clair

texts.en:
Rose Clair O. is a 22-year-old mother of two. Her husband is a tricycle taxi driver (a tricycle is a motorcycle with sidecar). At her young age, she wants to establish a business to help her husband. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) in order to raise capital.

Presently, she grows vegetables to sell, and sometimes buys and resells charcoal. She applied for this loan to buy 25 heads of native chicken. She wants to venture into this business to increase her income to support the increasing needs of her children. She dreams of having a poultry farm, and buying a tricycle for her husband in the future (he rents now). She hopes to save more money to send her two daughters to a university and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy 25 native chickens

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Davaa S. lives with her husband in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Davaa's family has three grown-up children, two of whom live independently from their parents. Her youngest daughter is a university student. Davaa has a small business making shoes. With her husband's help, Davaa started the shoe-making business in 2000. Since then the business has been doing very well. Working capital has increased from $70 to $700. Davaa buys raw materials from the local market and makes winter and spring shoes for women and men. Davaa pays her youngest daughter's university tuition from her profit. In the future, Davaa hopes to expand the shoe-making business by hiring another person. She requests a loan to purchase the materials needed for her shoe-making business.

loans.use: To buy materials for her shoe-making business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es  socia del Bancomunal Las Gitanas.
Gladys es soltera, tiene 52 años no tiene hijos.
Empezó haciendo tortas y ceviches por varios años, llevaba a las oficinas, hasta que se dedico a cocinar para eventos especiales, actualmente tiene una cartera de clientas, también vende ropa y artefactos eléctricos por pedido.  
Gladys necesita un préstamo de 3400 soles, para la compra de ropa por el día de la madre y para la preparación de su  comida.  
Desde que esta en Finca cuenta con más capital para poder invertir, aprendió a administrar su negocio, a invertir y llevar sus cuentas. 
El sueño de Gladys es poner un restaurante pero en el extranjero.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the Las Gitanas community bank. Gladys, 52, is single and has no children. For several years she made cakes and ceviches (citrus marinated seafood) and took them to offices. Then she started cooking for special events. She currently has a portfolio of customers. She also sells clothes and electrical items by order. Gladys needs a loan for 3,400 PEN to buy clothes for Mother’s Day and for food preparation. Since she has been with Finca, she has more capital to be able to invest. She has learned to administer her business, to invest, and to balance her accounts. Gladys’ dream is to open a restaurant abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes for Mother’s Day and for food preparation.

loans.name: Saven

texts.en:
Mrs. Saven K. is a villager in Khpuos Kraom village in Kandal Province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for living. Aside from this, she is a Khmer noodle seller who makes a small income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Sarith, helps her in rice farming. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children: one of whom is attending the local school. The younger one is 3 years old. 
Although they work hard, they still do not earn enough money to support the family. Mrs. Saven K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a house for her family. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a house

loans.name: Margarito Antonio

texts.es: El señor Margarito Antonio C. , tiene la edad de 49 años , habita en el barrio La Borgoña , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene tres hijos , ya todos casado , pero el le apoya a una hija de 18 que es madre soltera , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 31 años don Margarito trabaja en la a agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo por falta de fertilizantes ,el inicio esta actividad con esfuerzos propios , los planes hacia un futuro en su cultivo es poder diversificarlo . Con el financiamiento va a compara fertilizantes e insumos, para tener una buena producción y mejor venta en el mercado. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con los crédito con a plazos accesible, esto ha sido de mucho beneficio para su familia ya que han podido mantener el cultivo.
texts.en:
Mr. Margarito Antonio C. is 49 years old and lives with his wife, who helps him with the household expenses. They live in the La Borgoña neighborhood of Ticuatepe and have three children who are all married. He helps support one of his daughters who is an 18-year-old single mother. Mr. Margarito would like to help improve his family’s living conditions. Mr. Margarito has been working in agriculture for 31 years. He got into this business through his own efforts. In Mr. Margarito's opinion, the pests that invade his crops because there is not enough fertilizer, is the most difficult part of farming. In the future he plans to diversify his crops. With this loan, he will buy fertilizer and supplies so he can have a good yield and therefore get better prices in the market. He thanks Afodenic for supporting him with a loan that’s affordable. This has been very helpful for his family since they have been able to maintain their crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi A. is thirty-one years old. He is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Kwasi works to be able to provide for his family. He runs a drinking spot where he sells drinks – minerals coke, fanta, malt, etc. He has his business located on one of the streets in the community.

Kwasi has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy more drinks to increase his stock. He aspires to sponsor all his children in school to the higher levels.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell

loans.name: Los Lirios Ii Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Susana del Socorro P., Amaparo de los Angeles R. Sequeiro y Gertrudis S..

 Este grupo solidario es originario  del municipio de Tisma, las tres se dedican a actividades diversas y dentro de su comunidad, tienen muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, llevan varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim y han demostrado ser personas responsables y puntuales, están comprometidas para quedar bien en la institución.
 
Doña Susana del Socorro P. es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable. es una joven mujer , vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene un hijo pequeño que va a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado donde acarrea productos  y es agricultor, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.


 Doña Amparo de los Angeles R. , ella tiene su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, Ella es madre de tres hijos pequeños, su esposo es albañil y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para tener más seguridad y proteger más a su familia. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pues la aprendió de su madre y trabajando espera poder dar a sus hijos un mejor nivel de vida.


Doña Mercedes Gertrudis S., es otra de las integrantes, ella también vende verduras ambulante, vende frutas peladas y entrega a clientes fijos, ella es conocida por vendedora en la comunidad, compra en Masaya al por mayor y  al detalle. Tiene  
 tres hijos, dos pequeños que estudian en la escuela más cercana a su casa, ella se encarga de cuidarlos y desea que terminen estudios para que conozcan cosas que ella no conoce
texts.en:
In the photo from left to right are: Susana, Amparo, and Gertrudis. This jointly responsible group is from the municipality of Tisma. The three women have many years of experience engaging in different activities in their community They have worked with ADIM several times and have shown themselves to be responsable and punctual. They are commited to being on good terms with the lender. Susana is the coordinator of the group because she is very responsible. She is a young woman who sells fruit, buying at wholesale and selling at retail during the day. She has a young son who goes to school. Her husband is a merchant in the same market to which her products are transported and is a farmer. She helps him with the household expenses. From a young age, Susana has been involved in commercial activity, and she wants to make her business grow and improve her home some day. Amparo has a business selling fruits and vegetables. She is the mother of three small children. Her husband is a bricklayer, and she helps him with the household expenses. Her dream is to imrpove her way of life in order to have more security and protect her family. She has many years of experience in her business since she learned it from her mother. By working she hopes to give her children a better standard of living. Mercedes is the other member of the group. She also sells vegetables and peeled fruit and delivers solid service to her customers. She is known in the community for her work as a saleswoman, buying in Masaya at wholesale and retail. She has three children, the two youngest study in the school closest to her house. She takes charge of caring for them and wishes that they finish their studies so that they are aware of things that she doesn't know.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of perishables

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas E. is fifty-six years old and a widow with three grown children. To make a living, Felicitas owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Felicitas joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Felicitas is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Felicitas from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to further improve her business and support the needs of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Zayas, Carmen, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
“Patience is the key to success” says Julius. He is persevering to work hard and striving to uplift their family from poverty by operating his passenger tricycle.  He is from the village of Almaguer South, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. He is a graduate of vocational course and married Cherryl. They were blessed with three children. The eldest is now in the elementary level. His greatest ambition in life is to give all his children the best education.  

He is requesting to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP13, 000 for the maintenance of his motorcycle. According to him, he must maintain the motor very well for his family lives lies on it. He is also concerns on his daily passengers safety thus, wanted the motor vehicle to be overhauled. He is just earning an average net income of PHP200 daily from his daily transport activity and it is of big help to provide his family daily needs. He hopes that someday, aside from maintaining his transport business, his wife could somehow have the chance to venture in vending or selling business. That way, they will help each other towards the progress of their family.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Yoramu

texts.en:
Dr. Y. Yoramu is a promising man, forty years old. He carries out laboratory services and he has been doing this for over twenty years. He is using the loan to obtain some more machines for his laboratory.

Dr. Y. Yoramu is married with three children schooling. His future hope is to increase his inventory and create employment for others. More so, his dreams are to increase his production of bananas since he has a plantation, and to construct more rentals for income generation.

loans.use: To obtain more machines for his laboratory

loans.name: Jehovah Shammah Group

texts.en:
Paul is 30years old he is single and father with a child who is currently in school. He is a wholesaler and trades in flour, sugar, margarine, rice etc in bags. He has his shop in the market center where he lives. He takes delivery of stock from Kumasi. He is been in business for the last three years now. He requests the loan to add to his capital so that he can buy more stock to upgrade his business. With the loan he believes it will improve his stock level to attract more customers to his shop.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Jehovah Shammah’. He is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, grocery sellers, food vendors etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs like bags of rice, sugar, margarine and vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es:
Aurelia tiene 44 años, es una mujer muy luchadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y lo que más desea es tener una vida mejor. El negocio de Aurelia es la carpintería, en su pequeño taller construye diversas cosas como muebles, roperos, camas, puertas, sillas, etc, los cuales luego pone a la venta en su propia carpintería o los lleva a vender a las ferias dominicales, pero también realiza trabajos a pedido los cuales cumple muy puntualmente.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es darle los últimos retoques a sus artículos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar con las maquinarias pesadas que usa para moldear la madera. Para el futuro, anhela que su negocio crezca y le genere mejores ingresos económicos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Aurelia con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con los pagos de todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más madera para poder cumplir con los nuevos pedidos que le han llegado.

loans.use: Compra de madera

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and has two kids who are currently in school.

Victoria trades in yams in the local market of Atebubu, a town in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She requests the loan to enable her to buy tubers of yam in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales.

Victoria hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education to give them better future career opportunities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam in bulk

loans.name: Ingri

texts.es: El Sra.  Ingri la cliente es oriunda de Santa Cruz, vive en la localidad de el Torno poblacion que esta aproximadamente a 120 Kms de la ciudad  de Santa Cruz. La  experiencia en la venta de muebles es de 20 años, en el lapso de ese tiempo establecio su propio negocio . La señora cuenta con  domicilio propio, en el cual se encuentra su negocio. Actividad economica que tiene la Sra. Ingri, venta de muebles, lo realiza en compañia de su esposo. El credito destinara a la compra de una motocicleta a la cual le anexara un carrito para el traslado de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ingri is a native of Santa Cruz, and lives in Tomo, about 120 kilometers from the city of Santa Cruz. She has about 20 years of experience selling furniture and during that period she established her own business. Mrs. Ingri has her own home, where she has her business. She does her economic activity, selling furniture, with her husband. The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle, to which a cart will be attached to move her products.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer and is requesting a loan to puchase more materials to use. Mary is 26 years old and is married to a retired soldier. She has 1 child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 female members.

loans.use: To puchase more materials.

loans.name: Sandra Arely

texts.es: Sandra Arely L. D. E. D. 34 años D. edad, resiD. en Zaragoza en el departamento D. La Libertad. Vive junto a sus dos hijos uno D. 12 y otro D. 3 años D. edad.  Ella posee un taller D. costura en el cual se encarga D. realizar ropa para niños y adultos, el negocio esta ubicado en el mercado Dueñas en Santa Tecla, el cual es un lugar muy estratégico para la venta. Sandra solícita un préstamo, para poder comprar tela, hilos y botones para la elaboración D. uniformes y pants. Debido a que el mes D. enero es el mes en el cual las personas mandan a hacer los uniformes para sus hijos, Sandra espera contar con todos los materiales necesarios. Sandra desea aumentar sus ventas y poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar, ya que es madre soltera y debe esforzarse el doble por suplir todas las necesidades D. sus hijos. Sandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy fuerte y trabajadora que vela por el bienestar D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra Arely L. D. E., 34, lives in Zaragoza in the La Libertad department. She lives with her two children. One is 12, and the other is 3. She has a sewing shop where she makes clothes for children and adults. It is located in the Dueñas Market in Santa Tecla. It is a very strategic place for sales. Sandra is asking for a loan to be able to buy fabric, thread, and buttons to make uniforms and pants. January is the month when people have uniforms maD. for their children. Sandra hopes to have all of the necessary materials. Sandra wishes to increase her sales and be able to pay for all of the household expenses. She is a single mother, and she must put fourth twice the effort to supply her children with the necessities. Sandra is characterized as being a strong and hard-working woman who watches our for her children’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Mrs. Minda A. is 47 years of age and a resident of Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio. She has five adult children who are all married. Her partner is a farmer and coconut-plantation caretaker.

Minda currently runs a sari-sari or general store which she has operated for the last three years. She earns an average net income of P4,000 from her store sales, as well as from her sales of roasted banana, a snack locally known as "ginanggang".

Minda joined Paglaum MPC this year and this is her first loan. She joined PMPC because she was interested in the various services and products offered, particularly after PMPC won the “Most Outstanding Cooperative” award in the Philippines during the COOP-LGU Partnership Competition in 2006.

Minda plans to use her loan as additional capital for her store. She is looking forward to becoming an active member of the PMPC community.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Tangub-Upper Pisaan, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. Mindanao

loans.name: Achachairu Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento ACHACHAIRU fue fundada el dia miercoles 15 de julio del 2009 en las oficinas de emprender del plan 3000 cuando se reunieron 11 señoras todas ellas de la zona del Quior que viven entre la calle numero 1 y 2 que actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo, todas ellas se agruparon y pagan cuotas quincenales y las reuniones lo realizn en las oficinas de Emprender del plan 3000 a horas 15:00 PM. 
La Señoras desean aumentar capital a sus negocios muchas de ellas son ambulates que no tienen puesto fijo

La Sra. Yessenia es una de las socias fundadoras es casada sus hijos ya son mayores de edad su marido trabaja en COPAAGUS. ella se dedica a la elaboracion de empanadas, salteñas, Pan y ella lo vende en la puerta de su casa y los hace ambular a algunos muchachos de su barrio. 

La Señora Ana Maria tambien es una socia fundadora que se dedica a la venta de ropa interior ella compra de la feria de Barrio lindo y va ofreciendo barrio por barrio y algunas veces deja a credito y de esta manera cuadyuba en el bienestar de su familia, no solamente se decica ha eso tambien es promotora de cosmeticos.

La Señora Seli  es una socia nueva que ingreso en el segundo ciclo es soltera y tien un hijo ella es muy dinamica que se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños que va ambulando y dejando al credito en cada barrio de la ciudad de Santa Cruz esa es su actividad principal y como una actividad secundaria es promotora de portones que conbina esta acividad con la venta de ropas y a al vez va ofreciendo las dos cosas   						
						
Todos los integrantes estan agradecidos con Emprender  y  Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Achachairu Communal Bank was founded on Wednesday, July 15, 2009 at the offices of Emprender as part of “Plan 3000”. The group consists of eleven members who are from the district of Quior and live between #1 and #2 Streets. They are currently in their second loan cycle and get together every two weeks to make their loan payments and conduct their meetings at the Emprender offices at 3PM. The members greatly desire to increase their operating capital. Many of them are traveling vendors who do not have established retail locations.

Sra. Yessenia is one of the founding members. She is married and has adult children. Her husband works for COPAAGUS. She prepares empanadas, salteñas, and bread and sells them from the doorstep of her house. In addition, she provides these items to a few young men to sell in the neighborhood.

Sra. Ana Maria is also a founding member. She sells undergarments that she acquires from the Barrio Lindo Fair. Ana Maria travels from neighborhood to neighborhood to offer her products, sometimes selling them on credit. This is not the only business she manages. In order to provide for the welfare of her family, she also sells cosmetics.

Sra. Seli is a new member who is participating in this second loan cycle. She is a single mother with one child. Seli is a dynamic woman who sells children’s clothing as a street vendor and offers her merchandise on credit. She visits each district in the city of Santa Cruz. Selling clothes is her main business, but she also runs a second business selling doors. Sometimes she is able to run both businesses as the same time.

All of the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in them by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Alona

texts.en: 43-year-old Alona is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has eight children that she wants to have a proper education. She is engaged in rice farming. She said, “My parents were farmers and I have also learned to love farming because it does not only benefit my family, but also other families to whom we sell our harvest.” Alona wants to grow her farm. She applied for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She told CEVI that she would use the loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is a 45-year-old father of five. He operates a pharmacy in Machakos, Kenya; a business he has been running for the past 2 years. 

He has requested a second loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy medicine, such as cough syrup, cold syrup, and others. He wants to acquire land and build a home. He describes himself as hardworking and God-fearing.

loans.use: To buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Tuyambagane Mutesi Muhammed Group

texts.en: M. Muhammed, a hardworking 30-year-old businesswoman, is married with three children, two of whom are attending school. She also looks after three dependents who attend school. M. has been processing cereal into maize flour since 2008 and is requesting the loan to purchase more maize to process. She is improving her business by injecting more capital into it, and her dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase maize to make into maize flour.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is 38 years of age. He has a quarry where he mines building stones and sells them to people constructing new houses. He has been in this business for 13 years and has four employees. He is happy to be a member of Faulu Kenya, since he can access loans to expand his business. He hopes to buy a lorry to transport stones from the mines to his customers' construction sites. He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to purchase more land for quarrying.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for quarrying

loans.name: Ajrahgui

texts.en:
Ajrahgui is 35 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Tosontsengel province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for 10 years. 
During the day, Ajrahgui operates a carpentry business with his brother. He manufactures wooden furniture such as beds, wooden trunks and beams for a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. He has been operating his business since 2005, and has expanded his business and has a loyal customer base because of his well designed products and good service. His monthly revenue is 300,000 – 600,000 tugrugs (~ 211 – 422 USD), and monthly profit is 150,000 – 250,000 tugrugs (~  105 – 175 USD). With his business profit, he provides money for his family's expenses. 
Ajrahgui is a very hard working person. The most important thing to him is being able to provide education for his children. He says, “I am working hard to be financially available for my daughters' education in the future.” He is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~  352 USD) loan to purchase a variety of wood and other raw materials for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and raw materials.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet F. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 41 years old and married with four adult children. She is starting a business venture  selling snacks and other delicacies.

In 2010, Janet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Janet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en:
Teyyub A. is a 39-year-old man who breeds sheep in the small village of Saatli. He has been engaged in this business for the last fifteen years. He is married and has three children.

Teyyub has applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase fifteen sheep and fodder.

loans.use: To purchase fifteen sheep and fodder

loans.name: Yuventius

texts.en:
Yuventius is 68 years old. He is married and has 7 children aged between 22 to 33 years old. Two of the children attend school.

He is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 40 years. His main produce is bananas, coffee, and tea which he sells to the local market and Kenya Tea Development Authority in Kisii town. His main challenge in farming is poor infrastructure that hinders him from accessing the market easily.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for KES 45000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. In future, he would like to acquire two more dairy cows to increase the production of milk.

He hopes to continue getting financial support and advice from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Glue, leather.

loans.name: Nila Insoy Group

texts.en:
Nila I. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and the leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nila I. Group.

Nila is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Nila plants and harvests rice for sale. Nila has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Nila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Nila is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Nila from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nuevo Dia Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Nueva Vida inicia su ciclo 9 con 13 socias que realizan diferentes negocios.
Como es el caso D. L. señora Candy que es L. presidenta del Banco Comunal por primera vez, Candy es soltera y vive con padres, llego a Finca Perú por invitación D. una amiga y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones y L. educación en valores.
Candy tiene una peluquería en un local alquilado ubicado en el centro D. L. ciudad llamada Jair Stilos, negocio que inicio hace 3 años y ahora esta mas granD., cuenta con L. ayuda D. 5 personas. Candy solicita un préstamo D. 450 soles para L. compra D. tintes, peines. 
Su mayor sueño es especializarse en temas D. cosmeatría y además D. iniciar otros proyectos.
texts.en:
The Nueva Vida (New Life) Communal Bank is starting its ninth cyle with 13 members who have different businesses. One of the members is Candy, who is the president of the communal bank for the first time. Candy is single and lives with her parents. She came to Finca Perú by invitation of a friend. What she likes the most are the trainings and the values education. Candy has a beauty salon in a rented place, which is located in the center of the city called Jair Stilos. She started her business three years ago. Now it is bigger, and she has five people helping her. Candy is requesting a loan for 450 soles to buy tints and combs. Her biggest dream is to specialize in cosmetology and to start other projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tints and combs

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 50-year-old married man. Since 1984, he has been selling candies on a wholesale basis. Victor drives his van and passes through many villages on his way to sell his products. His clients are very pleased with his products, and say that his prices are very affordable. 

This is Victor’s first time to request a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy an extra big variety of candies to attract kids’ attention as much as he can. Victor believes pleasing the kids is the best thing to do ever. He hopes to be the owner of a big wholesale candy store where everyone will visit and buy his products in spite of him passing by villages and clients. He said he hopes to keep his visits in the future in order to keep clients’ satisfaction and work hard on developing his career.

loans.use: To buy an extra big variety of candies

loans.name: Lorenda

texts.en:
Lorenda is a resident of District 3, Sibalom, Antique. She is 57-years-old and widowed. She is seen as strong and determined to improve her status of living. She is a caring mother of four. All of whom are still going to school and need her support.

Currently, Lorenda is busy with the buying and selling of bamboo craft and charcoal to earn the means of daily living. When she received a small amount of capital from ASHI, she managed to put it all into her business. For her, business is an important factor, and she does not want to be a problem for her group mates with the weekly loan obligations.

She applied for a new loan amounting PHP 20,000.00 to have additional working capital for her business. Specifically, the loan fund will be use to purchase inventory of bamboo crafts and charcoal to sell.

Lorenda is a very good member of ASHI. She performs well in her business. When she has enough capital, she increases her business in order to gain more income. She hopes that through her loans availed in the ASHI partnership with KIVA; someday she will be able to save money as she is getting older. Along with the business success she is dreaming about, is the hope to see the graduation of her children at college and to see them find stable jobs.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of bamboo crafts and charcoal.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 37 years old and married with three children. His first child is 10 years old, the next is two years old, and the third is one years old. Jean Pierre is a businessman. His wife is jobless. Jean Pierre owns a business selling foodstuffs such as beans, rice and so on. These products are profitable, which is the reason he has chosen this kind of business. Jean Pierre's business operates from 7 in the morning to 4 in the evening every day.

Jean Pierre is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more sacks of foodstuffs. With this expansion, Jean Pierre will be able to have more products for sale, which is the best way of earning more profits. With the extra money, Jean Pierre will save money for his future and pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah N. lives in the Kamwokya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has five children, four of whom are in school.  Deborah has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Deborah sells her products at the market, wholesale.   

 Deborah has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal.   She also generates additional income through rental rooms. The main business challenges for Deborah include seasonality and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and start going directly to producers.   Deborah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lydia Junieth

texts.es: La Señora Lydia Junieth se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, tiene 3 hijos que asisten a escuela primaria y para poder sustentar su hogar es que ella tiene este negocio.  Ella sale a vender todos los días a distribuir sus productos, ella sale muy temprano por lo que sus diferentes clientes viven en lugares muy lejanos, además de estar atendiendo su negocio en casa aprovecha para atender las necesidades de su familia. Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio, ahora necesita el crédito para comprar zapatos, cosméticos, ropa y sabanas. Ella y su esposo son personas responsables que siempre están dispuestos a trabajar para cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Ms. Lydia Junieth sells general merchandise. She has three children who attend primary school, and the reason she has this business is in order to support her household. She goes out selling everyday, distributing her products. She goes out very early because her different customers live far apart from one another. Besides tending to her business, at home she takes the opportunity to tend to the needs of her family. Her dream is to be able to expand her business. Right now she needs this loan in order to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and sheets. She and her husband are very responsible people who are always ready to work in order to fill their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and sheets

loans.name: Koitalel Ole

texts.en:
Koitalel is married and has three children whom he and his wife support.  Koitalel was introduced to KADET through a credit officer; he is requesting his first loan from KADET, and he is also a client of K-REP, another microfinance institution in Kenya.  Koitalel has been a livestock trader for five years.  He will use the KADET loan to buy livestock for his business and to meet basic family needs, for example, school fees for his children.

Koitalel's business is located in a busy open-air market; the population is large, so there are many customers.  He will use the extra profits he makes to open a butcher shop in the market.

Koitalel hopes to become a big trader; he describes himself as hardworking and ambitious.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his business and to meet basic family needs

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 32 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Dany de 28 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos trabajan cada día para forjarse un futuro mejor. Este trabajador hombre instaló, desde hace 2 años, una tienda de comestibles en su casa, y aunque en la actualidad no esta muy surtida, trata de ofrecer lo mejor en variedad de comestibles y gaseosas a sus asiduos clientes. Él se dedica a la atención de su tienda durante sus ratos libres, y la mayoría de veces deja encargado el negocio a su esposa, que lo administra muy bien sin descuidar la crianza de sus hijos. Paralelamente a esta actividad se dedica a cargar bultos pesados en un mercado mayorista de la ciudad, y manifiesta que este trabajo es bastante cansado y tedioso pues empieza a las 3 de la tarde y termina a  las 2 de la mañana. Pero con ambos negocios obtiene ganancias considerables que le permiten brindarle a su familia una cómoda calidad de vida; además como es muy emprendedor para el futuro desea ampliar más su tienda y lo surtirá  con mayor variedad de comestibles. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Miguel tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería que necesita para surtir su tienda pues quiere que su negocio se convierta en uno de los mejores de la zona.
texts.en:
Miguel is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his 28 year-old wife Dany and his two small children.  They work together every day to create a better future for themselves.  Two years ago this hard-working man set up a grocery store in his house and although it isn't currently very well stocked, he tries to offer the best range of food and drink possible to his regular customers.  He looks after the store during his spare time but usually leaves his wife in charge.  She runs the store very well without neglecting the raising of their children.  In parallel with this activity, he works loading heavy loads in a wholesale market in the city.  He says that this work is quite tiring and tedious because it begins at 3 o'clock in the afternoon and finishes at 2 o'clock in the morning.  However, between both businesses he makes a decent income which allows him to provide his family with a comfortable quality of life.  In addition, as he is very enterprising, in the future he would like to expand his store and stock it with a larger variety of food.

This is the first loan which Miguel has had with MFP and he promises to make his repayments in a timely manner because he doesn't want to give a bad impression to the people who, through funding his loan, will allow him to continue working in search of progress.  Miguel plans to invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise which he needs to stock his store since he wants his business to become one of the best in the region.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of merchandise to stock his store

loans.name: Yhony

texts.es: Yhony, de 24 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Crispín de 21 años y su querido hijo Dyron de 1 año, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Yhony es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 4 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarle a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Yhony is 24 years old.  She is a very friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives in a rented house together with her 21 year-old husband Crispín and her beloved 1 year-old son Dyron.  She would like to be able to provide them both with a better quality of life.  Yhony's store is the first to open in her village.  At 6 o'clock in the morning her doors are already open to receive her early-morning customers who know that she sells a wide variety of goods in her store and they don't hesitate to buy from her since they know that they will find whatever they need.  What she most likes about her work is chatting to her customers and finding out what is going on in the village.  She has been in this business for 4 years and she considers that the most difficult thing about her work is staying in her store all day long without being able to go out.  Over time, she wishes to grow her business and provide her customers with a better service.

This is her first loan from MFP and she hopes to be able to make her repayments on time since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members of her community bank where she is well respected for the order which she brings to the group.  She will use the 1,000 nuevos soles she is requesting to buy more products to better stock her store.

loans.use: To buy more products to better stock her store

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “HUCHUY QOSQO ”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Timotea; La socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene  3 hijos ella se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa y ahora desea implementar mas con nuevos adornos y comprar panetones, galletas de champan, vinos, champan, chocolates y adornos navideños, la socia desea el préstamo para invertir en la tienda en esta época de navidad y poder satisfacer a sus clientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos navideños e implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This member belongs to the communal bank “HUCHUY QOSQO ”, located in the Lamay district, Calca province, Cusco department.  She is Mrs. Timotea, 33, living with her spouse and 3 children.  She spends her time caring for her grocery store, a small shop in her house.  Now she wants to install new decorations and purchase panetones, champagne cookies, wines, champagne, chocolates, and holiday decorations.  She wants this loan to invest in her shop during the holiday season, to be able to meet her clients' needs.  She is requesting this loan to purchase holiday products and to set up her grocery shop.  She is grateful for and values the loan provided in this way, and she also commits herself to complete her schedule of payments in the agreed time.

loans.use: Purchase of holiday stock

loans.name: La Aurora Group

texts.es:
El nombre optado por este grupo es, “La Aurora”, las personas que integran al grupo decidieron este nombre por su gran significado, para ellos este sensacional fenómeno del amanecer está ligado a sus esperanzas y expectativas que tienen todos al llegar un nuevo día, tal y como la usura se renueva cada día así es la gracia de vivir un día más para los seres humanos, así nos dan el significado los miembros del grupo, que en su esta formado por 10 mujeres y 1 hombre, todos son originarios del municipio de San Miguel Tlacamama que se ubica a 25 minutos de Pinotepa Nacional, OAXACA. Se identifica por la elaboración de quesos, que son muy apreciados por la gente de esta región, la mayoría de la gente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de quesos, también al trabajo en al campo, el punto de reunión es en el domicilio de una de las integrantes y en ese lugar se elaboran quesos todos los días, su representante se llama Minerva Irma E. Martínez, pero haciendo un énfasis más claro hablaremos en especifico de una integrante del grupo. 
Ama de casa y mujer muy trabajadora es Martha L.
