texts.en: Norma is a 42-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and two children. Since 2010, she has worked as a private teacher. She loves her profession so much and she loves to be independent. She prepared a special room in her house where she receives her students. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a new laptop to help in her work. She wishes to receive more students with the coming school season. In the future, she plans to open an educational center in order to attract more students.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop to help in her work.

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
K. Chanthon has born ten children, six of them are still living with her. She is a widow and supports her family with a small business she is running with her four grown children. They sell dry food in front of the numerous factories in this area. The five of them can sell for 160,000 Riel ($40) per day, out of which 40,000 Riel ($10) profit.

K. Chanthon wants to start a new business. Her plan is to open a real shop in front of a factory. She could sell clothes, spices and even more…

She needs $500 to have the shop built and would like to purchase for $500 stock. She will probably also invest her own savings.

K. Chanthon is confident because she knows that two of her grown sons, who are employed in factories, would help her if anything wrong happened. If this business is successful, she is already considering another one, which would be building a house to rent it.

loans.use: Build a small shop in front of the factories

loans.name: Adjelenye

texts.en: Adjelenye trades in banku, a local product made from corn. Her business is a fast food venture. She prepares this cooked food made from corn and sells to the public in a local restaurant. She has participated in the TEACH lending skills program and graduated in Basic Business development programme. She needs a loan of $800 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en: Tuinanau is 47 years old and has raised six children.  All six of her children are married and have their own families.  Tuinanau is a very independent-minded woman and does not want to depend on her children and their families for financial support so she used an initial SPBD loan to start a business selling flavored ices (locally referred to as “ice cakes”) to the children at the local primary school.  Her business has strong sales, and she is applying for an additional loan in order to purchase supplies in bulk (and thus at better rates) and continue to make her product.  A loan to Tuinanau will help ensure that she can continue to run her business and remain financially independent.

loans.use: Buy purified water, sugar, cordials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic bakery ingredients

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Mrs Nidia S. is 52 years old. She is separated and has three children: they are 32, 25 and 23 years old, respectively. The older one does not live with her any more. The other two work and study at the university. She is very proud of her children because they are very responsible and studious. Nidia has been selling products from her home for 22 years. She lives at a good location right at the center of town. She sells primary need products such as vegetables, drinks, milk products, bread, etc.

Nowadays, demand has grown, since Nidia's store has progressed both in quantity and quality. Nidia wishes to continue growing her business. Therefore, she wants to purchase plenty of merchandise.

She requests $800 which she will use to purchase wholesale canned food, meat, bread products, flour, oil and noodles to get important discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nidia Sánchez tiene 52 años, es separada, y es madre de 3 hijos; ellos tienen 32,25 y 23 años respectivamente. La mayor ya no vive con ella, los otros dos trabajan y estudian en la universidad, ella se siente muy orgullosa de sus hijos pues son muy responsables y estudiosos. Nidia tiene una despensa en su casa hace 22 años, posee una buena ubicación pues se encuentra en el centro mismo de la ciudad. En su despensa vende productos de primera necesidad tales como bebidas, verduras, lácteos, panificados, etc. Hoy día la demanda se ha vuelto más grande, pues la ciudad ha crecido y progresado y Nidia desea seguir creciendo a la par; para ello desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías y así ir ampliando el negocio. Solicita el crédito de $ 800 que los utilizará para comprar productos enlatados, carne, panificados, harina, aceite y fideos en grandes cantidades, así de esta forma también podrá conseguir importantes descuentos.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale canned food, meat, bread, flour, oil and noodles

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyen Thi H., 44 years old, has a happy family with a supporting husband and two well-behaved children. She became a TYM Fund member since 1996. She has a shop at a very good location, and the selection of goods sold are really varied. Her shop is divided into three rooms. In one room she sells sundry goods, in one room her husband fixes bicycles and sells parts of bicycles, in the last room they sell cattle foods. Although very busy, she still spends time with TYM Fund activities. She has been an excellent officer of her cluster. Ms. H. is now the team leader of TYM Fund’s Soc Son. Her group is ranked as “Good” every month. Her business is doing well. Her family’s monthly income is 200USD. She wants to borrow 1200USD to upgrade her shop and sell more variety of goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 44 tuổi, đang có một gia đình êm ấm, hạnh phúc với người chồng luôn ủng hộ chị trong công việc và hai đứa con ngoan ngoãn. Chị bắt đầu tham gia từ khi Quỹ triển khai hoạt động tại xã Phú Cường năm 1996. Chị có một cửa hàng với vị trí khá thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán, chẳng thế mà gian hàng của chị thật phong phú và đa dạng. Một gian hàng tạp hóa với rất nhiều mặt hàng tiêu dùng hàng ngày, một gian để anh sửa chữa, bán phụ tùng xe đạp, gian còn lại anh chị để bán thức ăn gia súc. Công việc bộn bề là vậy nhưng chị vẫn luôn sắp xếp được để có thời gian dành cho Quỹ Tình thương. Nhiều năm liền chị luôn là cán bộ cụm xuất sắc, hiện tại chị là nhóm trưởng của Quỹ Tình thương Sóc Sơn và nhóm của chị luôn được xếp loại Tốt hàng tháng. Công việc kinh doanh hiện tại của anh chị đang tiến triển rất tốt, thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 200 USD. Chị tâm sự rằng nếu được vay thêm 1200 USD thì nhất định chị sẽ nâng cấp cho cửa hàng rộng rãi, khang trang hơn và đầu tư thêm nhiều mặt hàng nữa.

loans.use: Upgrade her shop and sell more goods

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is married and has two children. Her family lives in the small town of Bogorodchany in the Ivano-Frankivsk region of Ukraine. After Lesya was laid off from her previous job, she had to find some other way to provide for her family. That is how she became a market vendor. Today Lesya sells women’s clothing, footwear, and purses in a small retail store in downtown Bogorodchany. Her prices are always reasonable. Moreover, Lesya is the only entrepreneur selling this type of inventory in that area of the city. She has been in business for five years. Financial assistance has helped her business grow and expand. Currently, she has about $6,000 in inventory, and her monthly income is about $600.

Lesya is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase 15 pairs of pants wholesale to sell over this Christmas season. Her business is the only source of income for her family. That is why she is determined to work 24/7 to provide for their needs and stimulate the growth of her trade. One of her plans is to open a new vending facility in the local market and hire an employee to help her run the business. We believe her natural liveliness and enthusiasm will help Lesya achieve her goals and continue as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy 15 pairs of women’s pants to sell at her store

loans.name: Altaf Hussin

texts.en: Altaf Hussin lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two daughters. He is uneducated but he is a carpet weaver with good experience. He has lots of students so he need to expand his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy necessary materials and make his business popular in Kabul so that he can make a good income and help his family.

loans.use: To complete his necessity materials

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Mary M.. She is widowed with four children, aged 5, 10, 12, and 17, and has two other dependents, who are her niece and nephew. In 2007 Mary established a shop selling general items, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en: Mairam A. was born in 1962 in the Asht region and she is married and has four children. Mrs. A. works in a collective farm but because it is seasonal work, she also has had a business for five years making and selling yarn and warm socks. She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 when she applied for financial support to improve her business. Mrs. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 to buy special yarn-making equipment.

loans.use: To purchase special yarn-making equipment

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is a trader who sells sugar, rice, yam, maize, and Gari. She prepares kenkey and fried fish for sale. She is married to a fisherman and has four children. She wants to expand her business and also increase sales.

She is asking for $325 as an additional capital to purchase more stock for sale.

loans.use: As an additional capital to purchase more stock for her food staples business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce Y. prepares food for sale. She is married and has three children. Because the number of her customers is increasing considerably, her current production cannot meet the demand.

She is asking for $225 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her food production.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for food production

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Mrs. Yun Y., 32, is a mother of three children and works with her husband growing rice on their piece of farmland. They have been doing this for over ten years. In order to generate more income for her entire family, Mrs. Yun Y. is requesting a loan to purchase a motor-taxi for her husband. Transport people to their destinations is a good business and will generate more income for her household.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi for her husband

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is a member of the Working Women communal bank and lives in Tarapoto in the San Martín region of Peru. Her business is located in her own home, where she is dedicated to selling all kinds of groceries and snacks. She has been doing this for the past two years, and thanks to her hard work and dedication she has maD. her business grow. With the loan, which she plans to repay within four months, she wants to purchase packaged snacks of different varieties and flavors, rice, sugar, flour, personal hygiene and home products as well as stock up on soft drinks and mineral water, among other beverages. Mercedes is 46 years old and has six children, four boys and two girls. She is a very responsible woman with hopes of getting ahead. She dreams of have a bigger business and ensuring her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mercedes N. T. D. Garcia, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. San Martín y distrito D. Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Federico Sánchez Nº 139, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general y golosinas. Ella se dedica a este negocio hace 2 años, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado que su negocio se amplié. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará golosinas en paquetes D. distintas variedades y sabores, arroz, azúcar y harina en sacos, útiles D. aseo personal y para el hogar, además D. surtir con bebidas gasificadas, agua mineral, entre otros. La Señora Mercedes tiene 46 años y 06 hijos, 04 varones y 02 mujeres, ella es una mujer muy responsable y con deseos D. salir adelante, sueña con tener un negocio más granD. y asegurar el bienestar D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and other products wholesale / Compra de golosinas al por mayor.

loans.name: Zebo

texts.ru:
Zebo Y. lives in Yavan. She is a homemaker and has 4 chidlren. Zebo raises livestock. She would like to take out a loan to purchase one more calf. After feeding and fattening it, Zebo will be able to sell the calf and earn a profit. She will use the profit for her family and reuse the sum of the loan to purchase another calf. Zebo plans to pay back the loan over a 9 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ятимова Зебониссо проживает в городе Яван . Домохозяйка , имеет четверых детей. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно рогатый скот. Хочет получить кредит и купить еще одного бычка. После откормки она сможет его продать и получить доход. Его она использует для семьи , а сумму кредита использует для покупки нового бычка. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Sokry's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokry H. is a leader of a small loan group. She is 36 years old and a beef seller in her local market. Sokry has been selling since 2005, earning approximately $5 per day. She purchases beef from a butcher and resells it at the market. Her husband works for a non-governmental organization and his income helps to support loan repayments. The couple have three young children, all of whom are in school.

Due to growing customer demand, she wants to expand her business to increase her family's income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to expand her beef-selling business by purchasing more beef to sell. Her group members include: (i) Mrs. Sophy S.: Mrs. Sophy requests a loan to purchase hairdressing materials to use for her hairdressing business. The remainder will be used to purchase more beef for her beef-roasting business.

(ii) Mrs. Prem K.: Mrs. Prem requests a loan to purchase ingredients for roasted cake and porridge, to help boost her sales.

loans.use: To purchase beef to sell

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Mr. Pov C. (pictured with his grandchildren), 58, and his wife, Mrs. Eng Rous, 54, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1972 and have seven daughters. Three of their daughters are married and live outside the family home. Three other daughters are silk weavers and the youngest one studies in the local school. His wife stays at home and takes care of the children.

Mr. Pov has been selling cows since 1982. He buys them from a farmer in a nearby village to resell in his village. He is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es: Doña Luisa tiene 52 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, soltera y con dos hijos mayores de edad, que la ayudan. Ella trabaja de responsable de un comedor infantil, lleva nueve años de estar laborando y ha sido una experiencia buena por que ha podido superarse como mujer. Pues cuando empezó entró como ayudante del comedor. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para ampliar un cuarto ya que es muy pequeño e incómodo para eso necesita comprar piedra arena, cemento y hierro. A largo plazo es poder terminar de hacer las mejoras a su hogar, y poder contribuir en la dieta balanceada de los niños del comedor para que sean sanos y fuerte.
texts.en:
Doña Luisa is 52 years of age and lives in a neighborhood in the capital of Managua named Memorial Sandino. She is single with two adult children who help her. She is in charge of a children’s dining-room. She has worked for 9 years and it has been a good experience because she has been able to excel as a woman. When she started working, she started as a dining-room assistant. The loan that she is requesting is to expand a room that is very small and uncomfortable. For this she needs sand, cement, and iron. In the long term, she wants to be able to finish making improvements to her home and to be able to contribute to the balanced diet of the children at the dining-room so that they are healthy and strong.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expansion of a room

loans.name: Patricia Evelyn

texts.es:
La Sra. Patricia Evelyn R. es una persona dedicada al negocio de la producción y venta de embutidos y además con su esfuerzo y sacrificio sustenta sus estudios universitarios y al mismo tiempo sus deseos de superación hacen que se motive mucho más. Vive con sus padres, con lo que gana en el negocio ayda a pagar las cuentas del hogar. Son una familia humilde pero muy trabajadora.
Ingresó a la institución este año y actualmente paga al día sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Patricia Evelyn R. is a person dedicated to the business of the production and sale of cold meat and also with her effort and sacrifice she continues her university studies and at the same time her dreams of bettering herself motivate her a lot. She lives with her parents, with whom she works in the business, helping to pay the expenses of the household. They are a humble family, but very hardworking. She entered our institution this year and currently pays her installments to the day.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Hilário Xavier

texts.pt:
Hilario nasceu em inhambane , tem 34 anos de idade estudou ate a 11 classe vive maritalmente e pai de 3 filhos: o primeiro de 8 anos , o segundo de 5 anos e o ultimo e um recem nascido de apenas 2 semanas. Os dois mais velhos e que se encontram a estudar
Hilário sai de V. a Beira com seus pais este que era militar  quando tinha apenas 2 aninhos  vive durante 15 anos onde consegue fazer a 6ª classe, o seu pai é transferido para trabalhar como guarda civil em Namaacha uma vila na fronteira de Swazilândia e este vem com a sua familia. Chegado a Namaacha continua com seus estudos e faz a 11ª classe, porque o custo de vida sobe cada dia que passa , Hilario pede emprestado um valor no seu tio e comecça a praticar o seu próprio negócio de venda de calçados no mercado informal da Namaacha (vulgo shoprite) que funciona 2 vezes por semana e consegue entao construir a sua própria casa. Anos depois e contratado para trabalhar na Moseg como seguranca da TDM no mesmo distrito, sendo assim teve que interroper com os negócios pois o horario de trabalho conscidia com os dias da venda e assim entra na falência. Hoje é trabalhador da Moseg aufere um valor mensal de 1.800.00mt trabalhando em turnos, um periodo de 24h por dia 3 vezes por  semana. Não consegue poupar nenhum valor pois ganha pouco e esta a concluir a sua obra, em 2007 conhece a hluvuku logo que estalou a sua sucursal em Namaacha e teve a oportunidade de obter um emprestimo no valor de 7.000.00mt.

Este e o segundo empréstimo de Hilario na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva . o primeiro de 7.000.00mt  foram usados para comprar calçados, estes que revendia no mercado imformal antes  de começar a trabalhar e pede este segundo de 10.000.00mt para comprar material de construçao esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do periodo determinado e pedir outro  empréstimo para construir uma barraca na sua residência para vender produtos de primeira necessidade.
texts.en:
Hilario was born in Inhambane and is 34 years old. He studied until the 11th grade. He is married and the father of 3 children: the first is 8 years old, the second is 5, and the youngest is a new born of only 2 weeks. The two oldest kids are students. Hilario left V. for Beira with his parents who were in the miltary when he was only 2 years old. He lived there for 15 years and was able to complete the 6th grade. His father was transferred to work as a policeman in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, and he came with his family. Arriving in Namaacha he was able to continue with his schooling and completed the 11th grade. Since the cost of living was increasing every day Hilario borrowed money from his uncle and began his own business selling shoes in the informal market of Namaacha (known as Shoprite) that operates 2 times per week. He was able to construct his own home. Years later he was contracted to work in the Moseg as security of TDM in the same district. Because of this he had to interrupt his business since his work schedule conflicted with the market days, and that caused him to go bankrupt. Today he is a worker for Moseg, and he earns monthly salary of 1,800MT working in shifts, one period of 24 hours per day 3 times per week. He is unable to save any money because he earns so little. In 2007 he found out about Hluvuku as soon as they opened a branch in Namaacha, and he had the opportunity to obtain a loan for 7,000MT. This is Hilario's second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 7,000MT was used to purchase shoes that he would resell at the informal market before work, and he is asking for this second loan of 10,000MT to purhase construction materials. He is confident that he can repay this loan before its term so he can request another loan in order to construct a stand in his home to sell various staple products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Lupe Consuelo

texts.en:
Lupe Consuelo Agustini S. lives in the bustling, jungle city Pucallpa, Peru. It is the regional capital of the tropical Amazonian department of Ucayali which is characterized by the meandering Ucayali River that flows north, meeting up with the Amazon and, eventually, the Atlantic Ocean. Fifty years ago, Pucallpa was a tiny caserío or hamlet; but everything changed when the only paved highway leading into the Amazon region was built and Pucallpa became the gateway to the jungle at the road's end. Since the mid-20th century, the city has sprung up and engulfed the surrounding "caserios". Today the city is a bustling, hot metropolis with immigrants from all over Peru.

Lupe is thirty-six years old and has been working with the Ucayali office of Manuela Ramos for over seven years. She has one small son whom she supports through her sweets-selling business. Lupe is requesting a loan of 2,000 Nuevo Soles to be repaid over six months. Lupe plans to use the funds to purchase sweets and cakes to re-sell to her customers. She plans to purchase "paneton", in particular; it is a popular, traditional cake that families eat especially during Christmas. The cake has a consistency similar to bread and is dotted with raisins and fruits.

Lupe´s normal line of work is the sale of bottled drinks and beer to her neighbors. She stores her products in the glass-front refrigerator pictured above. Lupe will also use her loan to continue to stock up on the drinks and beers she sells.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and cakes to re-sell and continue to stock up on drinks and beers

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort W. is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of six kids. Two have completed junior high school; but for lack of funds they could continue their education to the senior high school level. Comfort lives with her family and husband in a house in Abofour in the Ashanti region. Through the government basic compulsory education her little kids are now in school.

She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes her livelihood. She sells in a community called Abofour, a suburb of Offinso in the Ashanti region of Ghana. The major occupation in that community is crop farming -- some people farm maize, groundnuts, etc. as a result of good fertile land they occupied. Comfort has been selling yams and bags of gari for almost eight years to support her family. She started this business with her mother when she was a young girl. She takes delivery of stock from farmers who provide her with a direct supply of yam and gari. Gari is produced from cassava. It can be eaten with beans, rice and sugar. Gari is mostly purchased by students.

Buying direct enables Comfort to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan of GH¢500, she hopes to restock her inventory and buy a bulk supply of yams and gari to serve her customers. This would enable her to save more to support her husband in taking care of their home. She also hopes to use part of her profit to support her kids in school. Comfort belongs to a village bank (loan group) called ‘Agnes.’

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of yams and bags of gari for retailing.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en: Mrs. Ra C. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Kraing Touch Village in Takeo province. She is a poultry breeder who raises ducks. Since her ducks are growing bigger and bigger, she does not have enough money to buy food to feed them so she has decided to request a loan to buy more duck food. Her husband, Mr. Pheuk Khe, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which he cultivates rice for a living. Mrs. Ra C. is 52 years old and the mother of three children: one is a construction worker while the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy duck food for breeding.

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en:
Reshma T. lives in Sainbu-Bhashipati Village. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Most of the people in this region are dependent on agriculture and farming.

Both Mrs. T. and her husband, Mr. Rabi T., are engaged in making handicrafts. They make different types of traditional sandals, which are made of thick cloth. Most of the people in Nepal use these types of sandals in kitchens. These types of sandals are also used in wedding ceremonies. They have four years of experience in this job. Mostly people use these sandals in the winter season.

They have opened small shop near their residential area. They sell all their products in that shop. Now Mrs. T. is requesting Rs 20,000 as a loan to buy raw materials for her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Zebi

texts.ru:
Солиева Зеби клиентка в Микроинвесте уже четвёртый год. Её бизнес это пошив женских платьев с вышивками. Раньше у неё в цеху вышивальная машинка была в аренду, поняв что выгоднее купить собственную машинку , Зеби решила в кредит купить вышивальную машинку. Сейчас у нас очень модно носить национальные платья с вышивками, поэтому сейчас сезон данного бизнеса. Сама   Зеби одна из лучших клиентов в Микроинвест, поэтому мы рады с ней сотрудничать.
.
texts.en:
Zebi S. has been a client of MicroInvest for four years. Her business is making of women's dresses with embroidery. She used to rent an embroidery machine before, but after realizing that it's more profitable to own a machine Zebi has decided to buy this machine in credit. Right now it is very fashionable to wear national dresses with embroidery and this is why it is a good season for this type of business. Zebi is one of the best clients of MicroInvest and we are happy to collaborate with her.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making of national dresses

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
This is Marie B., Rev. Sia L. M’bayo, Isatu J., Kadie K., and Regina G.. They named their group Faith. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are requesting from SMT/Kiva. Each of them is requesting a loan of Le 500,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to increase the sizes and quality of their businesses and consequently make better profit and improve their standards of living.

Marie (left) is the leader of this group. Marie is forty-four years of age. She was born in Waterloo, twenty miles from Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. Two of her children are already grown-ups and two are attending schools and the last is in nursery school. Marie sells palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and she has been in this business for seven years now. She will use this loan to buy two barters (five gallons make a barter) of palm-oil.

loans.use: Buy two barters of palm-oil

loans.name: Ruqaiya M. Akbar Group

texts.en:
Ruqaiya baji is an uneducated woman from Lahore, Pakistan, a city famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods.  She has been a part of this city for the past 25 years. Her husband is named M. A. and he runs a dairy business. He has been in this business for 10 years.  Ruqaiya baji helps him milk the two buffalo.  Their eldest son also works with them, while the other two sons are enrolled in the local school and are getting an education.  Ruqaiya baji is applying for a loan so they can buy another buffalo to expand their dairy business. 

Ruqaiya baji is the leader for this group loan which includes four other women from her locality. The loan will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  Bushra baji wants a loan to repair her Shahzore rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle), Irshad begum will buy garments to sell, and Nasreen baji plans to buy a molding machine. Hajran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  The members of a group loan mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo to expand their dairy business.

loans.name: Sakina Choudary Gaman Masih Group

texts.en:
Sakina baji and Rehana baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell.

Shamim baji wants a loan to buy bricks to sell.

Muniran baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business.

Sakina baji is the group leader of these above mentioned ladies. They all are citizens of a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweet meat. Sakina baji operates a kite selling business. Her business grows when the occasion of kite flying comes, because kids and even elders are fond of kite flying and they celebrate this event with enthusiasm. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband and to pay the utilities. Her husband belongs to a leather selling business. He completes the orders of factories to earn income. Sakina baji is applying for a loan to buy leather so that her husband can complete the orders of his customers.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
K. Lê Thị (1406030179) is a 29 year-old female living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, K. owns & operates a business venture raising cattle for sale.  K. has been engaged in this business for over 17 years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, K. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  K. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  K. is requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 7th loan taken out by K. from TYM Fund. K. plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Sui

texts.en: Sui P., 47, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the ice-cake business. She sells to the general public 7 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Sui’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase freezer, ice-cake supplies.

loans.name: Mary Rose

texts.en:
Vending of native delicacies or glutinous rice cake is the business of Mary Rose C.. She is 28 years old and already married. They live peacefully in the village of Wigan Cordon, Isabela.

She has been involved in her business for 5 years now, and that business is their only source of income to support their family needs. Her desire to develop her business into a more progressive one gave her the idea of asking for financial support amounting to PHP 5000 for additional working capital.

Mary Rose is happy that she learned about Kiva. She believes that with the help of Kiva lenders and with her patience in vending, she will be able to achieve her dreams in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a member of the Uaminifu borrower group in Msamvu,  Morogoro. She is a 43-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 12 and 23 years old. She also cares for one other dependent.

Mariam started her own business selling shoes 2 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 80,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Mariam's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tanzanian shillings to buy more shoes to sell. With additional profit from this loan, Mariam hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes

loans.name: Jamis

texts.en:
Jamis F. is from the village of Jasaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Jamis is married and has adult children. To make a living, Jamis owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of viands in the local community. Jamis is just starting this business.

In August 2009, Jamis joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jamis is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating the business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Jamis from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks and provisions. Her husband is a civil servant. She hopes for the loan amount of N80000 to purchase more drinks. She thanks you

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gema Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE UBICA EN LA LOC DE TENEXTEPANGO, MUNICIPIO A., ESTADO DE MORELOS, ESTA CONFORMADO POR 4 INTEGRANTES, QUE SON LA SRA. SILVIA N. C., LA CUAL SE DEDICA AL BORDADO MANUAL DE SERVILLETAS Y MANTELES, LA SRA ARMANDA R. A. LA CUAL TIENE UNA TALACHERIA, LA SRA NANCY ADRIANA A. C. QUE TIENE UN PUESTO DE DULCES, Y LA SRA CARMELA A. V. QUE SE DEDICA A VENDER COSMETICOS POR CATALOGO, ACTUALMENTE VAN EN EL 3ER. CICLO. ESTE GRUPO SE FORMO POR RECOMENDACIONES DE UNA INTEGRANTE DE OTRO GRUPO.

EN ESTA OCASION NOS REFERIMOS EN ESPERCIAL A LA SRA. ARMANDA R. A., ACTUALMENTE CUENTA CON 34 AÑOS DE EDAD, SU FAMILIA LA CONFORMAN SU   ESPOSO, SU HIJO DE 8 AÑOS Y ESTOS MOMENTOS ESTA EMBARAZADA DE 4 MESES, LA SRA ARMANDA HA FORMADO PARTE DE ESTE GRUPO DESDE EL 1ER CICLO, ACTUALMENTE CUENTA CON UN CREDITO DE $5000,EL CUAL INVIRTIO EN VALVULAS, PARCHES Y CALIBRADORES, YA QUE SU NEGOCIO ES UNA TALACHERIA "DIAZ", EN EL CUAL BRINDA EL SERVICIO DE PARCHES, VENTA DE LLANTAS USADAS Y NUEVAS.

ELLA INICIO CON SU NEGOCIO DE TALACHERIA HACE DOS AÑOS Y MEDIO, DEBIDO A QUE TRABAJABA EN UNA LLANTERA GRANDE EN LA CD. DE CUAUTLA, SUS JEFES LE OFRECIERON RENTAR UN LOCAL EN LA CENTRAL DE ABASTOS DE LA CD DE CUAUTLA, PARA QUE PUSIERA SU NEGOCIO PROPIO, AL COMENTARLE A SU ESPOSO QUE EN ESE TIEMPO ERA EMPLEADO, ESTUBO DE ACUERDO EN ABRIR EL LOCAL Y ASI LO HICIERON, PASADO UN TIEMPO, CON LAS GANANCIAS DEL 1ER NEGOCIO PUSIERON OTRO Y CON APOYO DEL GOBIERNO COMPRAROR UNA DESMONTADORA Y BALANCEADORA. SU 2DO NECIO ESTA, UBICADO EN TENEXTEPANGO, EL CUAL ES ATENDIDO POR EL CUÑADO DE LA SRA ARMANDA, LA COMPETENCIA QUE TIENEN SON 2 TALACHERIAS MAS, SIN EMBARGO MENCIONA ORGULLOSA QUE LOS CLIENTE PREFIEREN EL SERVICIO DE SU NEGOCIO YA QUE LOS CARACTERIZA LA RAPIDEZ Y EFICENCIA, DEBIDO A QUE ELLOS UTILIZAN MAQUINARIA, LO CUAL EN OTROS NEGOCIOS HACEN MANUAL Y ESTO LES LLEVA MAS TIEMPO.

LOS PLANES QUE TIENE ES SEGUIR INVIRTIENDO EN SUS NEGOCIOS, PARA OBTENER UTILIDADES QUE INVERTIRA EN SU VIVIERNDA (PISO, HERRERIA Y REPILLADO) YA QUE LA QUE LA MOTIVA A ECHARLE GANAS ES DARLES UNA MEJOR VIVIENDA ASUS HIJOS.

Y A LARGO PLAZO DESEARIA DAR EL SERVICIO DE ALINEACION SIN EMBARGO PARA PODER DAR ESE SERVICIO SE REQUIERE DE UN CAPITAL $100,000 APROXIMADAMENTE, QUE EN ESTOS MOMENTOS CREE NO ESTAR APTA PARA PODER PAGAR, YA QUE NO QUIERE SOBREENDEUDARSE CON UN CAPITAL TAN GRANDE, ES POR ESO QUE QUIERE SEGUIR TRABAJANDO COMO HASTA AHORA CON LOS CREDITOS DE FUNDACION REALIDAD, Y DA LAS GRACIAS POR LA CONFIANZA QUE SE LES HA BRINDADO AL PRESTARLES LOS CREDITOS , POR QUE DICE QUE SI LE HA SERVIDO
DE MUCHO.
texts.en:
This group is located in Tenextepango, A. municipality, state of Morelos. It’s made of 4 members who are Mrs. Silvia N. C., whose works making hand-embroidered napkins and tablecloths, Mrs. Armanda R. A., who has a mechanic shop, and Mrs. Carmela A. V., who works selling cosmetics by catalog. Currently, they are in their third cycle. This group was formed on the recommendation from a member of another group. At this time, we would like to call your attention to Mrs. Armanda R. A.. She is now 34 years old. Her family consists of her husband, her 8-year-old son, and she is presently 4 months pregnant. Mrs. Armanda has been part of this group since the first cycle. Currently, she has a loan of $5000, which she invested in valves, patches and calibrators, since her business is a mechanic shop, “Diaz,” that offers service in patching and sales of new and used tires. She began her mechanic shop two and a half years ago, because she was working in a large tire shop in the city of Cuautla. Her bosses offered her a shop rental in the center of the market of Cuautla, so that she could establish her own business. When she told her husband, who was employed at the time, he agreed to open the shop, and they did. After some time, with the earnings from their first shop, they established another and, with government support, bought a tire press and balancer. Their second business was born, located in Tenextepango and tended by the brother-in-law of Mrs. Armanda, who has experience in two other mechanic shops. However, he says with pride that the customers prefer the service at this shop for its speed and efficiency, due to the fact that they use machines to do what other businesses do by hand, which takes more time. Her plans are to continue investing in their businesses, to get the investment for utilities needed for their home (floor, ironwork and exterior walls). The motivation that drives them is the desire to give their children a good home. In the long-term, they want to offer alignment, however to give this service would require approximately $100,000 in capital. At this moment, they do not want to grossly indebt themselves with a loan this large. So they keep working until this loan is more realistic and give thanks for the trust that they have been offered through these loans. They say that they have served them well.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase valves, patches and calibrators

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom T., 45, is a widow who lives with one of her children in the Takeo province. She is a professional decorates handicrafts. Since 1996, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower on woman clothes to earn a living and typically making US$2.5 each day. Decorates dress is a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wears it during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year. It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and its price is expensive too. Most of the people prefer hand made than machine made. She said she knows how to decorate from her mother and she has started doing that business since she was not married yet. Her son who lives with her is a car driver. He typically makes US$2 each day. Mom T. is asking for a loan of US$600 to purchase more silk and beads to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy silk and beads.

loans.name: Annette

texts.fr: Annette B. est une femme de 30 ans, elle mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE depuis 2 ans et demi. Avec son prêt elle développe une activité de restauration; elle vend le petit déjeuné et des légumes tels que des pommes de terre du piment des cacahouètes. Les bénéfices qu'elle réalise lui permettent de participer partiellement au bien-être de la famille.
texts.en:
Annette B. is a 30-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de BOUCOTTE CENTRE for 2½ years. With her loan, she’s developing a restaurant business. She sells breakfast and some vegetables, such as potatoes, chili peppers, and peanuts. The profits she makes enable her to contribute to the family’s well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her commercial work

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
la joven Xiomara C. tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de medicinas,  el crecimiento y la administración que le ha dado a su negocio es muy buena ya que nos comento que los ingresos que le genera su negocio los reinvierte en la compra de algunos medicamentos que son mas baratos y que tambien contribuye a sus padres con los gastos del hogar mejorando de esta manera la situacion familiar.
para este nuevo año de ser posible continuara con los estudios de enfermeria y luego una licenciatura que le permita certificar su negocio como una farmacia.
su meta es poder tener su negocio bien establecido y que sea una farmacia de calidad.
texts.en:
The young Xiomara C. has dedicated herself to selling medicines for 3 years. The growth and management she has provided to her business has been very good, and she commented to us that she reinvests the income she generates into the purchase of medicines at better prices. She also contributes funds to her parents, to help improve the entire household’s quality of life. In the coming new year, if possible, she would like to continue her nursing studies and, later, the licensing required to register her business as a pharmacy. Her goal is to have a well established business that is a high quality pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy generic medicines.

loans.name: Rita De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Joven Rita es casada, tiene una niña de 4 añitos de edad, labora para el MINED de Nueva Guinea como maestra de primaria, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una cocina), cuando Rita va a trabajar la deja a su hija con su mamá ya que vive con ella, su esposo trabaja como relojero y ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la familia,   Rita es una joven profesional con alto espiritud de superación personal, muy responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños  a aprender a leer y escribir de la colonia San Juan a 4 km de la Nueva Guinea carretera a Managua,  su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la Licenciatura en Ciencias de la Educación, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Young Rita is married and has a 4-year-old girl. She works for the Nueva Guinea Department of Education as a grade school teacher. She is applying for refinancing her 3rd loan to invest it in home improvement (building a kitchen). Rita leaves her daughter with her mother when she goes to work since she lives with her. Her husband works as a watchmaker and both help with the family expenses. Rita is a young professional with a lot of spirit for personal improvement and is very responsible. She is a teacher who loves her job since she helps many children learn to read and write from the San Juan neighborhood, 4 kilometers from Nueva Guinea on the road to Managua. Her dream is to finish her degree of Bachelor in Science of Education, have work stability, health and a house with better living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene M. is from the village of San Roque, Iligan City. She is 33 years old. Arlene is separated from her spouse and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Roque, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Merna C., who is 58 years old, owns a farm. She grows rice so that she will be able to help her family buy food, clothing and other basic needs. She also said she has been a farmer since she was born. Her parents are farmers, and all of her life has been spent on a farm. 

She would like to grow her business. She needs additional capitalization and requests a loan of 8,000 PHP from the Kiva field partner, Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She plans to buy farm supplies so that she will be assured of a quality harvest and a good income. The loan will truly help her expand her business as well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Ngoné F. est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait du petit commerce de chaussures et divers produits. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Ngoné F. is a 51-year old married woman, the mother of six children. She runs a small business selling shoes and various products. Her goal is to increase her working capital in order to better meet her family's needs.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Run a small business selling various products

loans.name: Ismailova Habibahon` Group

texts.en:
Habibahon, 51, is the leader of this group. She is married and has two married children. Her husband works as a vet in a rural district, her son is a taxi driver, and her daughter is a housewife.
Habibahon is a farm worker who also owns some livestock. She has been in this business since the early 1990s. She started it after the collapse of the Soviet Union, when most government agricultural land was privatized. At the present time, her seasonal income from farming exceeds $1500 USD. Habibahon usually spends all her income in covering family expenses. Her business earnings have meant that her family could marry both children, build a house for her son, and increase the number of livestock. In the near future, Habibahon is planning to open a food market near her house. This is her first loan from Kiva partner, Mol Bulak Finance, and it will be used to buy potato seeds and 300 kilos of mineral fertilizers.
Hojiumar, 49, is a father of two married children. He is a farmer, and will use his loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. Hojiumar has a dream of building a pharmacy and barber shop in the village center because the local population has to go to the district center to buy drugs.
Adinahon, 41, is also a farmer. Her family has a total of 0.47 hectare of land. She cultivates potatoes and wheat there. She is requesting a loan to prepare for the spring sowing by plowing and buying potato seeds. Adinahon is married with two children. Her husband works in a cotton plant, and all her family members take an active role in the family business.
Gaznahan is 47 years old. She is a widow with four children, the eldest two of whom are married. The other two children are students. Gaznahan will use her loan to buy 500 kilos of potato seeds and 100 kilos of fertilizer. In the future, Gaznahan hopes that she will be able to build a house for her second son. For her, the most important thing is the happiness of her children.

About Mol Bulak Finance
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds and 300 kilos of mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
In a small village near the sea, in the municipality of San Jose in Antique province, Rosa R. and her husband raised her two children. They had very little money then, but were determined to graduate their two children from college and to get out from under the burden of poverty.  They decided to take out a loan from ASHI and start a business to have some source of income. 

After Rosa became a member of ASHI in 1996, her business went quite well and she made her dream for her children come true. Both have graduated from college and have a family of their own now. Despite that, Rosa still wants to be financially independent from her children. 

With her husband, she wants to attend to her own life by growing her tailoring and fish vending business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to support her plan; now that her children have their own family life, she wants to be financially secure and renovate her house to be a better dwelling in preparation for her and her husband’s old age. She also wants to help her children send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase fish for selling and some materials for tailoring.

loans.name: Alie

texts.en:
Alie is a 37-year-old trader dealing in footwear. He has been in this business for the last eight years.  He is married with 4 children.  He buys his stock from a wholesaler in Freetown and retails the footwear.  

Alie sells his goods mainly moving around through villages on market days; while he is away, his wife superintends the business at its permanent location in town.  The family uses proceeds from the business for its livelihood especially for sending the children to school.  

Alie wants this loan to rent a store in the main market and also to increase his stock.  Alie is believed to be trustworthy and resilient in his business.

loans.use: to rent a store in the main market and to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get fresh supplies for her shop

loans.name: Ebenezer #3 Group

texts.en: Standly W. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called “Ebenezer #3”. He is 23 years old, is single, and has no children. He is presently a 9th grade student seeking higher education. In the photo, he is the one holding the sign. For three years, Standly has been selling apples at Broad Street, opposite Sports Commission, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. The placement of his goods attracts customers and keeps them returning. He started by selling biscuits around downtown Monrovia, but now has a table to sell on. Standly purchases goods with United States dollars and sells in Liberian dollars and this is a problem for his business because of the foreign exchange rate. Standly plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 44,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more apples to improve his business. His goal is to grow his business into a shop. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more apples to improve his business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma G. is from the village of Naawan Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling firewood in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Beata Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Narcisa es una socia que forma parte del banco comunal Umiña situado en la costa de Manabí a orillas del Pacifico este es un puerto pesquero mayor importador de Atún para diferentes partes del mundo, siendo catalogado como el primer puerto que se dedica a esta pesca.

La señora Narcisa es una mantense de nacimiento dedicada a su trabajo a hacer una mujer muy responsable, ella a sus 54 años de edad mantiene en firme un hogar de 4 hijos su hijo mayor tiene 30 años, la señora Narcisa  labora en una fabrica de pescado, aparte de eso se dedica a la venta de ropa de una manera informal visitando a sus clientas en sus domicilios, la mercadería la trae desde Guayaquil a bajo precio, compra  al por mayor para poder obtener mayores ganancias, nos hizo un ejemplo de cómo es que ella gana dice le ayuda de mucho poder ir a comprar a los distribuidores porque si allá le salen a 12 dólares ella se esta ganando el doble en cada pantalón, tiene que tomar encuentra el viaje el gasto que tiene que hacer para poder encontrar buena mercadería, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia invertirá en mercadería para el mes de las madres que es un buen mes para las ventas, el sueño de la señora Narcisa es poder tener en su momento una cevicheria y la venta de bocaditos.
texts.en:
Beata Narcisa is a member of the Umiña community bank located on the Pacific coast province of Manabí. This fishing port is a major exporter of Tuna to different parts of the world since it was the first one dedicated to that type of fish. Narcisa is a native of Manta and is a responsible woman dedicated to her job. She is 54 years old and maintains a stable home with four children. Her eldest son is 30 years old. Narcisa works at a fish factory and aside from this also makes a living selling clothing by informally visiting clients at their homes. She brings in her merchandise from the city of Guayaquil at a low price, buying it at wholesale so she can obtain better profits. She gave us an example of how much she is benefiting from Kiva's help by being able to go and buy from the distributors because for every $12 she spends she doubles her profit with each pant she sells. She has to keep in mind the costs of the trip that she has to make in order to find good merchandise. With this new loan, she plans to invest in the purchase of clothes for Mother's Day since that month is a good one for sales. Narcisa's dream is to have a food stand selling ceviche (popular fish dish) and sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants and clothing for women

loans.name: Lingueres Aynoumane 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Lingueres de Aynoumane 2 regroupe quatre (4) vendeurs de légumes et condiment d’un marché de quartier de la ville de Mbour. Le groupe crée depuis 5 ans permette à ses membres de réunir chaque jour des cotisations de cent fracs CFA qui sont versées chaque jour à un membre du groupe à tour de rôle. Cette somme est injectée dans le commerce pour renforcer le fonds de roulement du groupe. Face à l’insuffisance ses cotisations à régler leurs besoins en fonds de roulement, le groupe  sollicite un prêt. La plus part des membres du groupe ont quitté leur village pour s’installer à la ville à fin d’avoir de quoi nourrir leur famille.
texts.en:
The Lingueres de Aynoumane 2 brings together a group of four vegetable and condiment sellers at the market in the Mbour quarter. The group was created five years ago. Every day that dues are paid, the members give 100 FCFA to a particular member of the group whose turn it is. This sum is put into their business to strengthen the working capital of the group. Faced with insufficient funds to meet their needs and working capital, the group is asking for a loan. The majority of the group members left their villages to live in the city in order to support their families.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commercial Activity

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Farming is an activity which Estrella D. (66) and her husband, Lucas, have known since the beginning of their lives. They were born poor and their parents raised them from the income they generated out of cultivating land to farm rice and vegetables. They are not landowners, but hired farm laborers, who receive a small amount of money as payment for their hard work.  

When Estrella had her own family, the lifestyle she was born into was experienced by her three children. There was no individual person or organization that would entrust them with a loan for her to start her own business.  Estrella was not able to support the education of her three children to high school level. All of them were elementary graduates and are now farmers just like their parents.

In 2008, ASHI offered the opportunity to receive loans which would allow her to run her own business. Estrella grabbed that opportunity, and the loans she receives enable her to rent land which she can cultivate for farming rice, along with her husband and children. Their harvest is sold at the market or directly to a middle-man. The proceeds have improved their lifestyle. Therefore, Estrella wants to receive more loans to ensure the sustainability and growth of her business. She wants to support her grandchildren until the cycle of poverty is stopped.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Dervina

texts.en:
Dervina P. is from the village of  Digkilaan , Iligan City. She is 37 years old. Dervina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Dervina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Dervina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dervina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dervina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Dervina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Dervina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Djiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djiguisseme 3 sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Tiendo, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le haricot et le sésame. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SITAN MALIM B., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de sésame et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme group 3 are married women who on average are 37 years old and have two children. Most live in polygamous families in Tiendo, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their businesses for the beginning of the rainy season. Among others, the crops cultivated are peanuts, pearl millet, beans and sesame. This is their fifth planting loan; the previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, MINATA T. plans to pay for planting supplies, small agricultural tools and labor costs to maintain approximatley 1 hectare of sesame and peanuts. The crops are sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana after the harvest to a clientele composed of retailers. They expect to earn an average profit of 40,000 CFA at the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for planting supplies, small agricultural tools and labor costs

loans.name: Bataa

texts.en:
Bataa N. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Baganuur, an outer district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own apartment. His elder daughter is a student while his wife helps him with make traditional Mongolian shoes by hand.


He began his shoe making business in 2006 and his shoes are well known and valued by his customers for their quality and design. Bataa would eventually like to expand his shoe making business and create his own shop in the future. Bataa is an honest, reliable and hard working person who is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for a large number of shoes.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. is a widow taking care of five dependents. She has been through junior high school.

Ekua sells salted fish, popularly and locally called “kako”, at Takoradi and uses her income in the general upkeep of her home. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to salt and sell.

With the new profits from her extended business, Ekua plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to salt and sell

loans.name: Dolores Piedad

texts.es:
Dolores de 53 años, vive en una zona urbana, y tiene un pequeño negocio de servicio telefónico, es madre soltera con tres hijos. 

Ella inicio el negocio porque no quería depender del ex-esposo, con algunos ahorros que tenia comenzó a vender hielos y helados, con los ingresos generados compro algunos teléfonos y puso su propio negocio. Ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 22h00pm, en la foto aparece con uno de sus nietos que le ayudan después de haber salido de clases.     

Ella quiere readecuar el local de las cabinas por eso quiere compra cemento y pinturas con el préstamo. En el futuro quiere tener una pequeña papelería a lado de sus cabinas telefónicas.
texts.en:
Dolores is 53 years old, lives in an urban area, and has a small telephone services business. She is a single mother of three children. She started this business because she did not want to depend on her ex-husband. Using some savings, she started to sell ice and ice cream. With the income that she generated she bought some phones and started her own business. She now works from 8:00 am until 10:00 pm. In the picture she is with one of her grandsons, who help her once they get out of school. She wants to relocate the booths, for which she needs to buy cement and paint with the loan proceeds. In the future she would like to have a small stationary store next to her telephone booths.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement and paint

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: El Trebol Magico Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el trébol mágico y tiene este nombre porque las integrantes del grupo piensan que es de buena suerte, está ubicado en Hidalgo. El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.
Yadit Raquel R. C. es la presidenta del grupo tiene 23 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es madre soltera y tiene una niña de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes por catálogo que inicio hace 3 años, 6 meses. Solicitó su préstamo para la comprar más perfumes y hacer crecer su negocio ya que quiere lograr su meta que es poner un local donde pueda vender perfumes y cosméticos.
Margarita Martínez J. es otra integrante de este grupo tiene 48 años estudió hasta la primaria, es casada y tiene en total 4 hijos; 3 mujeres de 19,16, y 4 años de edad respectivamente, así como 1 varón de 18 años. Margarita se dedica a la venta de ropa que inicio hace 9 años se solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropa e invertir en el negocio, la ilusión de la señora es poder poner un local y poder así vender sus productos ya que quiere hacerlo crecer y vender muchas cosas más. Ahora su meta es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This group is called the Magic Clover, named as such because the members think it is good luck. They are located in Hidalgo, and the group is made up of 10 members. Yadit Raquel R. C. is the president of the group. She is 23 years old, studied until secondary school, and is the single mother of a 3-year old daughter. She dedicates herself to selling perfumes by catalog, an endeavor she began 3½ years ago. She requested a loan to buy more perfumes, so she could grow her business. Her goal is to open her own locale where she can sell her perfumes and cosmetics. Another member of the group is Margarita Martínez J.. She is 48 years old, studied until primary school, is married and has 4 children; 3 daughters ages 19, 16, and 4, as well as 1 son who is 18. Margarita dedicates herself to selling clothing, a business she started 9 years ago. She is requesting the loan to buy more clothing and invest in her business. Her dream is to open her own store so she can sell her products, since she wants to grow her business and sell other types of merchandise. Right now, her goal is to provide a higher standard of living for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow the business and, in the future, have their own stores.

loans.name: John Mbindu

texts.en:
John is married and has three children whom he supports. He describes himself as ambitious and hardworking.

John joined KADET through the recommendation of other group members and is acquiring his first loan; he has not dealt with other MFI's yet. John has been in the water distribution business for three years and makes a good profit. With this loan, he intends to obtain more means of water storage to be able to distribute water widely.

With the extra profits, John will purchase more household items. John hopes to be an international business dealer.

loans.use: To obtain more means of water storage

loans.name: Compartimos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Compartimos lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora María Elsa O. de 46 años se dedica a la venta de pan. Ella inicio su negocio con la ayuda de sus hijos al principio vendía 500 a la semana actualmente vende 1200.  
O. invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de aumentarlo, mejorar la situación y salir adelante.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son Diana Oliva Mendosa de 21 años madre de un bebe de 40 días desde hace 9 meses se dedica al comercio de ropa actividad en la que invertirá el crédito y Sugey Martines de 30 años quien tiene una pequeña y modesta venta de chiverías, granos básicos y gaseosa…etc.
texts.en:
The “Compartimos” (Sharing) group is comprised of three hard-working people.  María Elsa O. is one of them.  She is 46 years old, and she sells bread.  She started her business with help from her children.  In the beginning, she sold 500 a week.  Now she sells 1,200.  Elsa O. will use the loan to expand her business, to improve her situation, and to get ahead.

Diana Oliva Mendosa, age 21, is also a member of the group.  She had a baby 40 days ago.  For nine months she has been selling clothes.  She will use the loan to invest in her business.

Sugey Martines, age 30, is the other member of the group.  She has a small and modest business selling snacks, basic grains, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.use: Bread

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un C., 31, is a farmer who lives in Kompong Cham Province. Un C. earns about $2.5 per day.  In addition, she raises a few pigs in a stall at her home. 

Un C. is married to SokVeng, age 34, who assists her in the business. The couple has been married for years, and they have three children. All of them are single and are attending school. 

With growing family expenses, Un C. needs to increase her income. Un C. requests a loan of $600 to purchase small pigs to raise, and the remaining funds to buy additional feed. By using this loan she will get more profit and be able to support her family effectively. 

Un C. was busy when the photo was taken, so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Laura Luisa

texts.es:
Laura, confecciona y cose ropa en su casa. Vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso de la flor ubicada en una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y montañas. 

Desde pequeña ella aprendió a coser porque le gustaba. Pero al ya tener a sus hijos sin un padre decidió comenzar a trabajar en una máquina de coser que se la compro cuando era joven. Poco a poco pudo coser y tener ya un número definido de clientes. En la actualidad tienen su taller de costura y confección en su casa, trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta que termina sus pedidos. Realiza su trabajo haciendo enmendaduras, cociendo y confeccionando  para entregarlo el fin de semana. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser, telas, hilos porque la que tiene ya esta vieja. En el futuro quiere tener un local para su negocio  y asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Laura designs and sews clothing from her home.  She lives in a periurban zone called Paraíso de la Flor, located in an area characterized by its dirt roads and mountains.

As a child she learned how to sew because she enjoyed it.  But having had her children without their father, she decided to begin working on a sewing machine that she bought when she was young.  Little by little she was able to sew and have some regular customers.

Currently, she does her design and alteration business from home.  She works from 9am until her orders are done.  She completes her work mending, sewing and designing by the end of the week.

With this loan she wants to buy a sewing machine, cloth and string, because what she has is old.  In the future, she wants to have a different location for her business and to be secure in old age.

loans.use: For the purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Joel Manaen

texts.es:
Joel, reside en Gualococti, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a los servicios de mecánica automotriz, vive con sus padres y tres hermanos, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero. El presta sus servicios de mecánico automotriz de 6:00am a 5:00pm, este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en un taller mecánico.
Por el momento tiene intenciones de comprar herramientas para la ejecución de su trabajo, por lo que solicita un préstamo para la obtención de esta herramienta que le ayudara a desempeñar mejor su trabajo y ganara más clientela por su buena labor y reconocimiento de los mismos clientes.
Su objetivo es cancelar puntualmente este préstamo, realizar una buena compra y sueña con algún día lograr su propio taller mecánico.
texts.en:
Joel, 21, lives in Gualococti, department of Morazán. He is a car mechanic. He lives with his parents and his three brothers and he is single. He works as a car mechanic from 6am to 5pm. He learnt the trade by working in a garage.

He is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work. The tools will help him do a better job and win more customers thanks to his good work and the satisfaction of his customers. 

His goal is to repay the loan on time and make a good purchase. He dreams of having his own garage one day.

loans.use: Buy tools

loans.name: Khum

texts.en: Mrs. Khum K. is a villager in Saen Ban village, Takeo province. She was born in 1958. She and her husband, Mr. Soeng Phoeuk, are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow both rice and vegetables to sell to support their family. They breed four cows too. Since her cow breeding is going well, she wants to expand. Therefore, Mrs. Khum K. is applying for a loan to buy another cow and a piglet for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are waiters. Two others help in their parents’ business and one attends public school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a piglet

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Yiriwa sont des femmes mariées, elles vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans le village de Timbabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage, elles font le commerce de bétails, volailles, des céréales, des savons, des habillements et des articles divers.                                                                                  
Les femmes du groupe Yiriwa sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, du savon, des bétails, volaille, des céréales, des habillements et des articles divers.                                                                                    
SITAN C. s’approvisionne en  draps de lit avec les grossistes de Dioïla. Elle effectue sa vente sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
