The women who belong to the Yiriwa group are all married, and live with a husband and children in traditional families. With an average age of 41 and an average of 6 children each, they all live in the village of Timbabougou, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative district of the Republic of Mali). 

Having met through family and neighborhood connections, the women sell cattle, poultry, cereals, soap, clothes and miscellaneous articles. This is their first group loan, and it will be used to buy these items. 

Group member Sitan C. obtains sheets from wholesalers in Dioïla. She sells locally in the village, for cash and on credit, to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to pay back the loan, to meet healthcare- and school-related expenses, with the rest being reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy sheets

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A. is 39 years old, married and has six school-aged children.She  is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods, and toothpaste, in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6 000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages. This loan will be Arlene's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and beverages

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is 44 years old and is married with one child who is 16 years old.  Nada has been running a restaurant for the past five years and she employs four people.  Her restaurant is open from 6am to 8pm.  Nada realized she needed more equipment and food stocks to help improve her business and is taking her first loan from VFC to help her expand.

Nada will use any added profits she makes from her improvements to reinvest in her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase more food and equipment for her restaurant.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot G. is married and lives with his family of eight members, including his eldest son’s family with three little children, in Goris city.  

Ashot started beekeeping 20 years ago with only a few dozen beehives. Through the years Ashot and his sons worked hard and with great patience to enlarge the business and produce quality honey.
 
The grandfather wants to ensure that his family, particularly the grandchildren, have sufficient income to meet their basic needs and receive good educations. To ensure that, Ashot requires a business expansion through purchasing more beehives and thus increasing the family income.

loans.use: To purchase more beehives

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is currently in a business of selling alcohol, sugar, and fish. She is 45 years old, married to an engineer, with seven children.  Two of her children go to school. Lucia took out a loan to stock more alcohol, sugar, and fish to sell. She hopes to expand with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more alcohol, sugar, and fish to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia R. is from the village of Banga, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 43 years old. Letecia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as canned goods, snack foods, candies & instant noodles in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like detergents & canned goods. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as detergents & canned goods

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with six children. Three of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 49 years old. 

Teresita has a buying and selling of home products business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more home products to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 22 years.  In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a young man from Tulkarem. He works in a car repair shop and when he needs extra money he works in workshops on the other side of the green line. Muhammad took out a loan from FATEN to pay for house repair expenses, especially ceiling damage after the winter.

Muhammad who appears in the picture here is married and has no children.

loans.use: to pay for house improvement--painting, fixing ceiling, fixing windows.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna Macapia is a married woman with three adult children. She is 52 years old and has had a food-selling business for 15 years. She sells fruits and vegetables like ripe mango, cabbage, tomatoes and lot more to the people in her community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP monthly. 

Edna is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase a different variety of fruits like apples, oranges, pears and also to buy dressed chickens in order to increase her her income. 

In the future, Edna hopes to attract more customers and have a big business to make her family more economically stable.

About ASKI: 

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a different variety of fruits like apples, oranges, pears and to buy dressed chickens.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental, is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital, she is now requesting her fifth loan for 7000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. Evelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, D. 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Sosimo D. 42 años y sus 04 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida, para lo cual esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro. Todos los días, desD. muy temprano por la mañana, Lidia  y su pareja salen a labrar sus tierras,  para ellos no existen los días D. feriado, ya que tienen que trabajar continuamente para obtener una buena producción y con ello ofrecer un mejor porvenir para sus hijos. Sus principales productos son: el cacao, café, plátano y achiote, que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado central D. San Francisco. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es la libertad para trabajar en el campo, ya que pueD. disfrutar libremente D. sus verdes paisajes. Sin embrago el tener que cuidarlos D. la plaga D. insectos le resulta muy difícil. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras para aumentar su productividad. Este será su noveno crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo D. cada uno D. ustedes para que pueda concretar sus planes. Asimismo se compromete una vez más para pagar sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es una persona responsable y participe. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más semillas D. café para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Lidia, 37, is a hard worker who lives in her own house with her husband, Sosimo, 42, and their four beloved children.  What she wants most is to offer them the best possible lifestyle, so she is willing to work very hard.  Everyday, from very early on in the morning Lidia and her husband go out to work the fields.  They never have a day off since they must work constantly to ensure a good harvest so they can proviD. for their children.  Their main crops are cocoa, coffee, banana and annatto, which are in much demand in the central market in San Francisco.

She has been in business for 10 years and enjoys the freedom of working in the fields among the green scenery.  But protecting the crops from insect plagues is the hardest challenge.  In the future she plans to buy more land to increase production.  This is her ninth loan through MFP and she is counting on everyone of you to be able to carry out her plans.  She is committed to paying it back on time.  She is a responsible, partipating member of her communal bank.  With the 1,000 PEN loan she plans to buy coffee seeds for the next planting cycle.

loans.use: To buy coffee seeds.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina   y su esposo tienen una tienda ubicada en el barrio las nieves  sobre la vía principal del barrio, el  negocio se encuentra registrado en la Cámara de comercio y en él se dedica a la venta de víveres, abarrotes, bebidas, carnes, productos de la canasta familiar y de primera necesidad, en general. Delfina tiene 16 años de experiencia y 7 de funcionamiento en el mismo local  arrendado, en el cual ha construido una imagen que genera  buenas referencias personales y comerciales  a su alrededor. El 92 % de sus ventas son  de contado y maneja un margen no menor de 20% debido a que hay una alta rotación de mercancías por volumen de ventas, las compras a sus proveedores las realiza  de contado y maneja  inventarios  que rotan  cada 25 días . Cuando iniciaron la tienda “El descanso Costeño”, acudieron a una liquidación del esposo de Delfina cuando trabajaba en la ciudad de Bucaramanga en el departamento de Santander. Antes de emprender su negocio trabajaron en tiendas de sus familiares para lograr una buena experiencia, que hace  7 años   convirtieron en su propia forma de ganar dinero, con un trabajo independiente, como el de la tienda;  con su credikiva, que es su primer financiamiento comprará productos de miscelánea, para surtir su negocio  a propósito del día del padre que se acerca, en el cual las familias celebran entregando regalos al progenitor del hogar, que delfina planea que encuentren en su  “Tienda el descanso costeño”, porque su sueño es tener su propia casa y un negocio  muy confortable,  y para aumentar su capital de trabajo, que es u mayor desafio,  es necesario esforzarse cada día mas en familia.
texts.en:
Delfina and her husband have a store which is located in Las Nieves neighborhood, on the main road.  The business is registered with the Chamber of Commerce and in it they sell provisions, groceries, drinks, meat and essential household products.  Delfina has 16 years experience and has been running her store in these rented premises for 7 years.  She has built up an image that creates good personal and commercial references.  92% of Delfina's sales are cash sales and she maintains a margin of no less than 20% as she has a high stock turnover period for her sales volume.  She buys from her suppliers with cash and her stock turnover period is 25 days.

When Delfina and her husband set up their store "El Descanso Costeño" they used the severance pay that her husband received from when he used to work in the city of Bucaramanga, in Santander department.  Before setting up their own business, they worked in stores belonging to family members in order to gain good experience.  Seven years ago they turned this experience into their own way of earning money, working for themselves in their own store.

Delfina will use her Kiva loan (which is her first loan) to buy products with which to stock her business as Father's Day is approaching and families celebrate this day by giving gifts to their fathers.  Delfina plans for them to find these gifts in her store.

Delfina's dream is to own her own home and a very comfortable business.  She also plans to increase her working capital, which is her biggest challenge.  It is necessary to work harder and harder ever day as a family.

loans.use: to buy products for her general store

loans.name: Jumdah

texts.en:
Jumdah is 35 years old.  She is married and has 4 children.  Jumdah runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She also earns an income from farming coconut.  She works hard to provide for her family.

Jumdah has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as shampoo, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid 5 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jumdah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Mahougnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUGNON est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Afiavi Georgette est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Afiavi Georgette est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un certain Salomon. Le couple a six enfants à charge, dont quatre sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Afiavi Georgette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs vingt ans que Afiavi Georgette exerce comme activité, la vente de bois de chauffage à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Afiavi Georgette vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) et des poissons frits à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Afiavi Georgette s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Afiavi Georgette désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Afiavi Georgette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUGNON, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Mahougnon group comprises three people who live together in the same area. The group representative, Afiavi Georgette, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ with the goal of raising the level of their business. Afiavi Georgette is 51 years old and married to a man named Salomon. The couple have six children in their care, of whom four are their own. All of the children are in school and live together with their parents. Afiavi Georgette did not attend school. For about twenty years, she has run a business selling firewood at her home. In addition, she sells "akassa" (a local food made from cornstarch) and fried fish at her home; this allows her to respond without too much difficulty to the needs of her family and to provide for herself. She gets her supplies in Benin. With the goal of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Afiavi Georgette wants to increase her stock of products. To do this she, along with the other Mahougnon group members, is seeking a third loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. Jesca has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door for the past six years, working 7 days every week. Jesca has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of clothes. The main business challenges for Jesca include the ever-increasing prices of clothes and the rainy season. Her goals and hopes for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to get a permanent business premises.

Jesca lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medications.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a married woman with six children, all of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. Leah dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of sugar, beans and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of sugar, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Seryozha

texts.en: Seryozha works in the sale and rental of wedding dresses and accessories, as well as organizing weddings. Seryozha would like to open a new booth and develop his business further. With the requested loan Seryozha plans to purchase new wedding dresses and clothing, as well as to rent another booth and expand his business. With the help of this loan he will increase his working capital, which is very important for him to start his own family in the future. Seryozha lives together with his parents and grandmother.

loans.use: to pay for his wedding dresses and accessories booth and buy additional inventory

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en:
Uyanga has requested a loan to purchase equipment for her beauty salon which is called Uyanga. It is located in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. 

She opened her salon in 2008. Before that she used to work as a beautician in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has a lot of experience in this business. 

She needs to buy equipment to help increase her salon output and income. It is important to her to expand her business. 

Uyanga lives with her husband and son in her in-laws' house.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her beauty salon to help increase her salon output and income.

loans.name: Balbino

texts.es:
El Señor Balbino es cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad, el mismo vive en la ciudad de Luque, vive en casa propia con su esposa.
Se dedica hace varios años a la fabricación de cepillos y escobas en forma artesanal y los vende en el mercado de dicha ciudad. El mismo es cliente desde el año 2006 y cuenta con 6 créditos cancelados en nuestra entidad. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela y que tiene muchos pedidos siempre. El se considera un hombre muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por darle un mejor porvenir a su familia, ya que desea evitar que ellos pasen por las mismas privaciones por la que paso el.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas y accesorios, los cuales son insumos necesarios para la fabricación de las escobas. Agradece a la Fundación por la nueva oportunidad que le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Balbino is a repeat client to our agency. He lives in the city of Luque in his own house with his wife. 

For many years he has worked making traditional brushes and brooms, and he sells them in his city’s market. He has been a client since 2006, and he has had 6 repaid loans with our agency. He says that he is a good client and that he always has many orders. He considers himself to be a hardworking, tenacious, and enterprising man. He says that everything he does is to give his family a better future since he wants to avoid them having to endure the same hardships that he’s been through. 

He is asking for a loan to buy wood and accessories, which are the items needed to make brooms. He thanks the Fundación for this new opportunity that they’ve given him since getting this loan will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy wood and other items to make brooms.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Mariama (qui a la main levée sur la photo),est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un Ferrailleur du nom de Constant. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leurs charges. Mariama vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Mariama n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Mariama mène comme activité, la vente de fruits, de tissus et de chaussures de façon secondaire dans son quartier. Mariama s'approvisionne au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Mariama et Mélaine, le second membre du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, sollicitent l'appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur capacité financière et de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
DIEU EST GRAND Group is made up of two women who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Mariama, is 37 years old and married to a scrap metal dealer named Constant. She's the one raising her hand in the photograph.

The couple has four school-attending children, whom they have to support. Mariama lives together with her children and husband. She never attended school. To provide for herself and her family, she sells fruits, fabrics, and shoes in her neighborhood.

She gets her supplies in Benin. This is the second time that Mariama and Mélanie, the other member of the group, are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their financial capabilities and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fruits, fabrics, and shoes

loans.name: Dominga Elizabeth

texts.es:
Dominga es una madre de familia de 26 años de edad, vive con su menor hija en la casa de sus padres, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Dominga desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vacas) y aves de corral (gallinas), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada, pastos y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de la casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más aves de corral como pavos y alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta de sus animales puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.  Dominga es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su hija se supere y  mejore económicamente para contar con otras comodidades tanto para sus padres como su hija.
texts.en:
Dominga’s a 26-year-old mother living with her youngest daughter in her parents’ house which lacks basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Paijan District belonging to La Libertad Department.  This zone is noted for farming and animal husbandry.

Dominga has been raising and selling cattle (cows) and barnyard fowl (chickens) for several years.  Her corral is located in the exterior of her house; they are appropriate and spacious.  She feeds the animals nutritionally balanced feed, grasses and natural grains so that they will reach optimal growth to sell in various local markets earning good profits to cover household daily expenses.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy more barnyard fowl like turkeys and nutritionally balanced feed for her animals.  Income from the sale of her animals will be to repay the loan and improve the quality of life of her loved ones.

Dominga is a hardworking, very responsible person.  The only thing she wants is that her daughter makes something of herself and to improve economically in order to have other comforts both for her parents and for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy more barnyard fowl, like turkeys, and nutritionally balanced feed for her other animals.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Letecia is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Letecia has a used clothing business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of used clothing to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nellieflor May

texts.en:
Nellieflor May is a mother who has three school-age children. She and her husband both pay for the education of their children. She enjoys cooking and selling meals and snacks in their community. She hopes to improve the business to be able to satisfy her customers' needs and to increase her income. She mentioned that their children are in need of financial support for they are now in secondary and tertiary levels at school. 

She is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings for her food stall. She believes that through this loan, she can  improve her business. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand the business and make it viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy pork, fish, vegetables and seasonings to be cooked and sold in her food stall

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 37 years old and a business man. He is married to his wife Dinah, who is a business lady. They are blessed with three children ages 12, 6, and 2 years old. He has been a mason for the past 20 years with the monthly income of 6,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

Philip is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy cement and bricks. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes are to venture into a retail shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy cement and bricks.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 51-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a shop where he sells clothes. He started out in farming where he raised the capital to start the shop, which has since progressed. He faces the challenges of price fluctuations, inflation and the seasonal nature of the business. His dream is to educate his children and to build a permanent home. Stephen needs the loan to buy first class clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy first class clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jelia

texts.en:
Jelia is 25 years old and a single mother of a five-year-old child. To earn a living, she runs a retail shop. She has been in the business for two years and has employed one person. Previously, she used to sell clothes for a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access business loans.  This has helped her to grow her business.

Jelia has requested for a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy a shaving machine and a hair drier.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine and a hair drier.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es: El señor Luis Fernando a sus 28 años de edad es un emprendedor quien inició su propio negocio de venta de licor los días jueves, viernes, sábados y domingos después de las 6 de la tarde en un pequeño local cerca de su casa. Este negocio surgió de la necesidad de mejorar los ingresos económicos para poder apoyar a su familia. El señor Luis Fernando requiere de la compra de surtido con el fin de poder suplir la demanda de fin de año y así mejorar sus ventas y con estas la calidad de vida de su familia y cumplir su sueño de tener su propio mini mercado.
texts.en: Luis Fernando is a 28 year old entrepreneur who started his own business selling liquor on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays after 6pm in a small shop near his home.  This business came out of the need to increase his income in order to help his family.   Luis Fernando needs to buy additional stock in order to meet demand for New Year's.  This will allow him to increase his sales and therefore his family's quality of life.  His dream is to have his own mini market.

loans.use: to purchase a selection of liquors such as beer, aguardiente, and rum.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 49 years old and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is married and has 3 children. 

Daisy has a business that sells ready-to-wear clothing.  She earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more clothes to sell. 

Daisy has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future, she hopes to own a general merchandise store to earn more money because she wants her children to finish their studies.  Daisy is a MIGS member of PMPC.  She is a hardworking mother, an honest person and has a happy family.

loans.use: buy clothese to resell

loans.name: Jacinta Lucia

texts.es: Jacinta es una mujer emprendedora que ha salido adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se le pudieron presentar. Ella tiene 45 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos, 02 de ellos aun dependiente. Hace más de 10 años que Jacinta se dedica a la venta de golosinas contando con un kiosco en su domicilio, donde la gran mayoría de sus clientes es gente que transita para el centro del país, aparte habilito un espacio donde ahora puede ofrecer todo tipo de jugos de frutas. Ella se siente orgullosa, ya que con su  perseverancia y trabajo ha brindado educación a sus hijos. Jacinta tiene como meta instalar una bodega donde pueda ofrecer productos de primera necesidad pues así asegura tendrá mayores ganancias. A fin de seguir mejorando solicito el crédito para la compra de frutas como plátano, papaya, piña y manzana y así poder preparar sus jugos. Jacinta agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
Jacinta is an enterprising woman who has gotten ahead despite difficulties that have arisen.  She’s 45 years old and has a spouse and four children two of which are still dependent.  For more than ten years Jacinta has been selling snacks in a kiosk located at home where most of her customers are people traveling to the center of the country; she also set up a space to sell fruit juice.  She feels proud because thanks to her perseverance and work she’s been able to provide education for her children.

Jacinta’s short-term goal is to set up a store where she can sell basic staple items because she’s sure to earn better profits that way.  In order to continue improving, she’s asked for a loan to buy fruit like bananas, papayas, pineapples and apples to make the juice.  Jacinta thanks Kiva lenders for helping people like her.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 61 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Jesusa has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, beer, cooking oil, bath soap, canned goods, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides con 49 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado caprino, las compras lo realiza en caseríos aledaños así como en el suyo. Adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de aves como gallinas,patos y cultivo y venta de cacao,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 15 años.El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de animales con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Leonides es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, firmará con su esposa.

loans.use: será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de animales

loans.name: Maritza Judith

texts.en:
My name is Mariza.  I have been making cinder blocks for 4 years, that are used in the construction of buildings, houses, walls.  I have a great clientele, especially some iron workers in my city.  The generated income from this activity help me fulfill family and business commitments.  I am experienced in this business and due to the high demand, I employ a few young people to help manufacture the cinder blocks.

[Note from Kiva:  The above is Kiva staff member's transalation of the below text -- using Google translator and working knowledge of Spanish based off of 4 years high school Spanish, a very long time ago!  Apologies for any errors or omissions.]

Mi nombre es Maritza tengo cuatro años de dedicarme a la elaboracion de Bloques, que se usan para construccion de edificios, casas, muros, ya tengo una buena clientela especialmente algunas ferreterias de mi ciudad, las ganacias que me genera esta actividad son bastantes buenas ya que me ayudan a cumplir con los compromisos familiares y del negocio. Este negocio es familiar y debido a la demanda que tengo de pedidos he contratado a otros jovenes quienes nos ayudan para la fabricacion de los bloques.

loans.use: Compra de cemento, arena, herramientas como pala, carreta de mano y otros

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Vicky sells locally manufactured oil in the market. She has participated in the TEACH lending program of the Kraban Support Foundation. Vicky needs a Kiva loan amount of $850 to expand her business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig is a resident of the town of Beylagan. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He has a shop on the way to the local market where he sells carpets. He has been engaged in this business since 2001. He sells carpets of Azeri production and sometimes imports carpets from Istanbul or Dubai. In 2004, when he was going abroad, he applied to Normicro Beylagan branch and borrowed $600 to buy more goods in Istanbul. Later, he borrowed two more loans and increased his stock of carpets. As he is planning a new trip to Istanbul he has applied for $1200 to buy new models of carpets.

loans.use: To buy new models of carpets

loans.name: Martha Inés

texts.es:
For twelve years Martha has been making and selling tortillas. She is married with four children. Her husband helps her with her business and he delivers her products to village shops. They come from Creel in the state of Chihuahua. The family union has been a fundamental part of the development of this business and it has therefore grown.

At the moment, Martha needs a loan of $475 which she will use to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her products. Martha wants to increase the area which they serve and her and her husband are willing to work hard to be able to improve their family’s quality of life. You can help this family, and they thank you

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años Martha se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijas. Su esposo le ayuda en el negocio, él se encarga de distribuir sus productos en las tiendas del pueblo, ellos son originarios de la localidad de Creel, en el estado de Chihuahua. La unión familiar ha sido pieza fundamental en el desarrollo de este negocio, así como de su crecimiento.

En estos momentos Martha necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que requiere para incrementar su producción, Martha desea poder ampliar su área de servicio, ella y su esposo están dispuestos a trabajar mucho para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, tú puedes ayudar a esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon S., a 34-year-old mother of three children, lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by growing crops and raising pigs, and earns around $2/day. Her husband works on the farmland with his wife, and also works as a taxi driver whenever he is free.

The couple wants this loan to purchase feed for their pigs.

loans.use: To purchase feed for pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is an artisan, is 34 years old, and has three children. She makes cloth blouses and then embroiders them. She is part of the group called "Mujeres para Progresar 2," together with two other artisans, Alejandra Hernández Hernández and Flor de Maria Jiménez Hernández. With their loan they will buy wholesale fabric and thread and share it between their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

GLORIA es artesana, tiene 34 años, tres hijos. Ella hace blusas con tela de manta y después las borda. Forma parte del grupo llamado Mujeres para Progresar 2, junto con doña Alejandra Hernández Hernández (artesana) y doña Flor de Maria Jiménez Hernández (artesana). Con sus prestamos compraran tela e hilo al por mayor y se repartirán entre ellas para sus respectivos negocios .

loans.use: Purchase fabric and thread to create embroidered blouses

loans.name: Santa Isabel

texts.en:
Santa is a 28-year-old mother of five children, four boys and a girl, all of whom attend the public school of the town. Her husband is a farmer. Santa dedicates herself to the sale of women´s clothing. She started that activity one year ago. Bi-weekly, she goes to the stores in Santo Domingo where she can acquire garments at very low prices. She sells the clothes in a much frequented public place.

The entrepreneur wants to significantly augment profits from the business. She plans to buy clothing in bulk so that she can reduce costs due to the number of trips she has to make to Santo Domingo to get the clothing. She thinks that she will increase her income and improve her margin profit.

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Karyati

texts.en: Karyati is a 38-year-old woman who has to work to pay for her day-to-day necessities and her children's tuition. She sells sheets and clothing on credit door-to-door in various places where she can find customers. Karyati usually earns US$33 a week with US$5.50 in profit. She is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan to help expand her business. Karyati is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
"I am Suriya T.. I was born in Mian Chunnu , a small town, but later I moved to Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am the mother of nine: four girls and five boys. My son needs a loan to buy wood for our furniture manufacturing. Our business does well and generates decent profits. Earlier, with these profits, I constructed a house for my parents who are very poor and old.

I am a group leader of four other women. We are mutually responsible for each other’s loans, so if one does not repay others will pay for her. Farzana B. runs a boutique. Koser B. will invest the loan in their rug manufacturing. Shamim B. manufactures cloth on power looms."

loans.use: Buy wood for our furniture-making business

loans.name: Temor Shah

texts.en: Temor Shah lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan with five members of his family. He is single. His father died during the war in Kabul. He is the only breadwinner for his family. Temor has a retail shop. He wants to expand his business, so he requested an individual loan to buy extra materials like oil, rice, telephone cards, baskets, and shampoos, to complete his inventory and improve his business. He is happy and he would like to thank Kiva lenders who help poor people around the world.

loans.use: To buy more supplies like oil, rice, and telephone cards for his grocery store

loans.name: Ofeliya

texts.en:
Ms. Ofeliya is a low-income, vulnerable woman. She is 45, single, and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ofeliya sells inexpensive items that she buys in the wholesale market. Every day, she purchases goods from the market and distributes them to her neighbors. Ofeliya is a hard-working entrepreneur. She sells the goods quickly and efficiently, and she has the free time and determination to make it useful. But she has very little capital to run her business. This year, she has applied to the Normicro micro-credit organization for $500 USD.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Zabibu R., who is married and has three children aged 8, 12 and 15. In 2000, she established her general store business. Zabibu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks, such as rice, oil, and soap, in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock, such as rice, oil, and soap, in bulk.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica F. operates a restaurant where all kinds of local dishes are sold. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family, so Veronica is working very hard to help with the family’s expenses.

Business is good and customers are increasing rapidly. Veronica wishes to improve her services to attract more customers, so she is asking for a loan to buy more food items and other ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy food items and ingredients for her restaurant

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma is 35 years old, married and lives in the Jocote Dulce area, in the city of Managua. She has four children ages 1, 2, 5 and 15. Her husband is a merchant and contributes with the home expenses. Vilma's business is a general store and also a diner. She has six years of experience and started selling sodas, coffee and pastries. The loan she is requesting is to buy different products and offer them to her clients and improve the service at the diner. In the future she would like to expand her business, increase capital and offer education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Vilma tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y habita en la comarca Jocote Dulce de la ciudad de Managua, tiene cuatro hijos de 1, 2, 5 y 15 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y aporta a los gastos del hogar. El negocio de doña Vilma es una pulpería y también tiene un comedor. Tiene seis años de experiencia e inició vendiendo refrescos, café y respotería. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar productos diversos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar el servicio del comedor. A futuro es ampliar el negocio y aumentar el capital, brindar educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase products for sale.

loans.name: Herving

texts.es:
I am Herving P., and I work in a factory in Piedras Negras. In order to help me out with the household and my young daughter’s expenses, my wife runs a small general store in our home. We have not been able to sufficiently stock it up with goods so that it can be productive. We are, therefore, requesting a loan of $675.00 USD so that we can supply our general store with goods and obtain profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Soy Herving P. trabajo como obrero en una fábrica de Piedras Negras, para ayudarme con los gastos de la casa y de nuestra pequeña hija, mi esposa me ayuda con una pequeña tiendita que tenemos en nuestra casa, pero no hemos podido surtirla lo suficiente para que sea productiva, así que solicitamos la cantidad de 675 dls para poder surtirla y así tener alguna ganancia.

loans.use: Supply general store with groceries

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Кулматов Муродали житель города Яван. Возраст 37 лет из них 18 лет занимается животноводством. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Семья не очень большая , но прокормить ее ему тяжело. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит и использовать деньги для покупки бычка. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 8 месяцев.
texts.en:
Murodali K. is a resident of the city of Yavan. 37 years old, 18 of those years he has practiced animal husbandry. This business is his family's only source of income. He is married and has two children. The family is fairly small, but it is still hard for him to support them. Now he has decided to take out a loan and use the money to buy bull calves. He will repay the loan over 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Mathilde

texts.fr: Mathilde K. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et  mère de 2 enfants tous à l’école. Elle tient bientôt un an, une baraque à Adeta, un village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce crédit, le premier à FECECAV, d’augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huiles alimentaires, des cartons de laits et des boîtes de conserves et aussi louer un magasin. Elle compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mathilde K., age 38, is married and the mother of two school-attending children. For almost one year, she's been having a shop in Adeta, a village located approximately 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, her first with FECECAV, she wants to bolster her business by purchasing sacks of rice, cans of cooking oil, boxes of milk and canned food. She also wants to rent a shop. She counts on this opportunity to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, cans of cooking oil, boxes of milk, canned food, and to rent a shop

loans.name: Malvina

texts.es: Malvina cuenta con 56 años, se ha quedado viuda hace 5 años, tiene 9 hijos y 5 están viviendo en la ciudad de Lima, y el resto viven en otra zona mas cercana, actualmente está viviendo con sus nietos que le acompañan.  Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, tenia sus chacras de plátano, pero el precio que le pagan en el mercado es muy bajo y no le conviene, por ello que ha decido abrir un restaurante hace 5 meses, donde ahora  tiene ya su casa propia. Ahora todo el día se dedica a preparar los alimentos para sus comensales, lo que mas le agrada de su negocio es tener contacto con la gente y de ese modo no sentirse sola. Y lo mas difícil, es tener que levantarse muy temprano para empezar sus actividades del preparado de la comida. Y lo que le incomoda, a veces, es que le sobra comida, entonces tiene que rematarla aun menor precio para los cerdos.  En su afán de sobre vivencia ha puesto este restaurante ante el fracaso en la chacra. Malvina  es una experta en la gastronomía,  sus comensales fijos son los profesores, enfermeras  y algunos turistas.  Con el préstamo invertirá en mercaderías de primera necesidad para su restaurante; como es el arroz, azúcar, fideos y aceite, que son primordiales para que pueda preparar el menú del día y atender a sus comensales. Dice que para empezar le esta yendo muy bien, y con el tiempo quiere hacer un restaurante campestre, decorarlo a base de hojas, algo diferente que les atraiga a los turistas y sobre todo preparar comidas típicas en fechas festivas.
texts.en:
Malvina is 56 years old, has been a widow for 5 years, and has 9 children, of whom 5 live in the city of Lima and the rest live in a neighboring area. At present, she is living with her grandchildren, who accompany her. Earlier, she worked in agriculture. She had banana farms, but their price in the market is very low and is not suitable for her. Because of this, 5 months ago she decided to open a restaurant, where she now has her own house. Every day she prepares food for her guests. What she likes about this business is that she is around people and, in this way, she doesn’t feel alone. The most difficult thing has been waking up very early to begin preparing the food. The most inconvenient thing, sometimes, is having leftover food, which she then has to sell at an even lower price for the pigs. In her eagerness, she has put this restaurant before the failure of the farm. Malvina is an expert is gastronomy. Her regular customers include teachers, nurses, and some tourists. With this loan, she will invest in necessary merchandise for her restaurant, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and oil, which are fundamental so that she can prepare the day’s menu and take care of her clients. She says that the business is going well for her. With time, she wants to have a country restaurant, to decorate it with leaves, which she hopes will attract tourists, and above all to prepare traditional food on holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies food the preparation of her food

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Santos Matamoros, tengo 66 años de edad. toda mi vida me he dedicado a la sastreria con lo cual he sacado adelante mi hogar y mi familia, en mi barrio me conocen muy bien y la gente dice que yo me esmero en mi trabajo, por eso es que a la gente les gusta que yo les costure, soy una mujer luchadora y siempre estoy a la orden para cualquier trabajo que me pidan, en estos momentos necesito comprar repuestos y varios materiales para mi maquina de costurar tambien necesito comprar telas, hilos, etc, ya que vienen las epocas de navidad y la gente compra bastante ropa. necesito el credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello. My name is Santos Matamoros. I am 66 years old. For all of my life I have been a tailor, which is how I have helped my household and family to get ahead. I am very well known in my neighborhood and everyone says that I go to great pains to do a good job. That's why people like what I sew for them. I am a determined woman and am always at my clients' disposal for whatever work they order. I currently need to purchase spare parts and various materials for my sewing machine. I also need to purchase fabric, thread, etc., seeing the Christmas season is coming up and people buy a lot of clothes. I need this loan to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene una oficina en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz y se dedica a la comercialización de tintas y cintas para impresoras. También realiza mantenimiento de computadora e impresoras.
Su esposa es profesora y trabaja con su hijo. Vive en la Zona central de la Ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito, su comportamiento es bueno en el pago de sus cuotas 
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (tintas y cintas en cantidad)
texts.en:
Juan Carlos has an office in the downtown area of the city of La Paz where dedicates his time to the marketing of ink and print ribbons for printers. He also does maintenance for computers and printers. His wife is a teacher and he works with his son. Juan Carlos lives in the downtown area of the city of La Paz. This is the third time he has sought a loan and he has a history of making his loan payments on time. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (ink and print ribbons in bulk).

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is single and has no children. She is a 24-year-old trader. She has been running a clothing shop for eight months now, and sells items like brand new clothes and lace, and also deals in kidswear etc. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business.

With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance. She is part of an association called ‘God is Good’ Trust group, within the community in which she lives. This makes it easier for her identification.

loans.use: To buy more stock of lace materials, ladies shoes, and kidswear etc.

loans.name: Maritza Mercedes Group

texts.en: "Maritza Mercedes" is a group of 5 women all hoping to receive their third loan cycle. This group has all already got a start on their small business, and have started to experience some success. The representative of this group is a very hardworking women named Sandra M.. Sandra is the mother to 3 children, and started a small business selling shoes in her area. Before her first loan, Sandra had no real form of income, and had no way to pay for all the basic needs of her children. She came to Esperanza International really hoping to change her life, and with a great desire to succeed. With each loan Sandra has been able to increase the size of her shoe business, and for the first time in her life she feels like she can provide for her children. She is starting to make money, and so excited for her future. When we talked to Sandra she said that she wants nothing more in life than to see her children succeed, and live comfortable lives. Sandra is on the way to reaching that dream, and is very excited about this next loan. Thank you for all of your support!!

loans.use: Buy shoes for her business

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Phea S. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in the Battambang Province. She sells rice and makes USD $7 per day, while her husband works as a farmer and earns $6 every day. Mrs. Phea is asking for a loan to purchase rice in bulk to resell.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Akoko

texts.fr: Akoko D. est une jeune femme de 49 ans, mariée et mère de  5 enfants. elle est revendeuse de friperies depuis 5 ans à Atakpamé. Cette activité est sa principale source de revenus. Elle désire relancer son commerce en passant de nouvelles commandes afin de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Akoko D. is a young woman, 49 years old, married, and the mother of five. She has been a retailer of used clothing and the like for five years in Atakpamé. This work is her principal source of income. She would like to revitalize her commerce by submitting new orders, so as to respond to the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used clothing, towels, etc. for resale

loans.name: Rodulfo

texts.en: Mr. Rodolfo M. is fifty-four years old and married with no children. Rodolfo is responsible and a good member of Paglaum MPC. Their income is from fishing. He needs to have a fishing net and accessories for his fishing business. He decided to borrow the amount of $225 from the cooperative to buy what he needs. It will help them a lot to have additional income to sustain their daily needs. His future plan is to improve their living situation and to live happily with his wife.

loans.use: To buy fishing net and accessories for fishing

loans.name: Marina

texts.ru: Махмудова Марина жительница района Гиссар. Возраст 47 лет, вдова и имеет троих детей. Имеет высшее образование . Всю жэизнь проработала учителем в средней школе. Но после смерти мужа , пять лет назад занялась бизнесом. Торгует рисом на Гисарском рынке "Сомон".Старший  сын работает в средней школе учителем.Сейчас цены на рис растут , в связи с сезоном. Поэтому она решила получить кредит и сделать запас рисом. Это поможет сохранить цены до нового урожая и не потерять клиентов.
texts.en:
Marina M. lives in the Gissar district. She is 47 years old and a widow with three children. She completed a college education. She has always been a middle school teacher, but after her husband's death five years ago she started a business as well, selling rice at Gissar's Somon Market. In this season of the year rice prices rise, so she decided to apply for a loan to buy a reserve of rice. This will help her maintain prices until the new harvest so she doesn't lose customers. Her eldest son is also a middle school teacher.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza M. is 48 years old and married to Armando M. Sr., a farmer in their village. Aside from farming, she also has a tailoring business but, since she has few customers, her focus is on the farm, which is their main source of income. The couple is thankful they have been blessed with five children: Arlee - 30 years old, college graduate; Armando Jr. - 27 years old, also a college graduate; Jefferson - 25 years old, high school graduate; Phelipo - 21 years old, and the youngest is Emmanuel - 20 years old, fourth year college student.

Eliza wants her youngest son to finish his studies and she and her husband are doing their best to send him to school. She is hoping for a loan of 12,000 PHP for farm maintenance. This couple is doing their best to support their family. Eliza always prays for God’s blessing in their life.

loans.use: For farm maintenance

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru has been a clothes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for two years. She belongs to the Tuzinduke group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $20. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more clothes for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Nuru is 30 years old, married and has three children: ages 12, 10 and 3.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ngô Thị

texts.en:
Hòa Ngô Thị makes a living primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She is 56 years old, married and has three school-age children. They live in the town of Quảng Xương. Hòa has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, Hòa joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Hòa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Hòa is now requesting a loan of 7,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her sixth loan from TYM Fund. Hòa plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

No. 1414040884.

loans.use: To purchase additional seafood products

loans.name: Evan

texts.en:
Evan has been working in the carpet and flooring installation business for over 15 years.  Evan’s strong entrepreneurial spirit has motivated him to continue to look for ways that he can strengthen and expand his business.
 
As many small business owners know, securing a small loan in the US can be challenging and sometimes impossible, especially without collateral. Evan has tried, without success, to secure a loan from a number of banks who generally don’t make such small loans.  He feels fortunate to have found an organization that understands the needs of small businesses. This is his second time coming to Opportunity Fund for a loan that he is confident will greatly help his business.
  
Recently, Evan earned his contractor’s license and was able to secure the necessary insurance to enable him to provide start-to-finish services for home and business flooring needs. With the ability to do all types of floor installation and cleaning, Evan can build and maintain longer relationships with his clients and provide excellent service along the way.
 
With the loan, Evan hopes to increase the number of people he currently employs. To learn more about Evan’s business, check out Metro Carpet at http://www.MetroCarpet.com

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Evan from  United States

loans.use: Flooring and carpet installation

loans.name: Ñustas Group

texts.es:
La asociación  “Ñustas” pertenece al centro focal Santiago II, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto,  a la fecha cuenta con catorce integrantes, que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace mas de dos años.
En su mayoría el grupo se dedica al reciclaje de chatarras, compran materiales en desuso para luego venderlos a fábricas a mayor precio, otras de ellas se dedican a la costura, venta de  dulces y otros.
Actualmente su presidenta es T. Laura, cuenta que trabaja con movilidad, ofreciendo transporte publico junto a su esposo, ellos necesitan comprar repuestos, al igual que sus compañeras necesitan créditos para reforzar sus negocios, adquiriendo mayor cantidad de productos, repuestos e insumos.
texts.en:
The Ñustas association belongs to the Santiago II Community Center, which is located in the city of El Alto. The currently have 14 members who have worked together with the Pro Mujer family for over two years. Most of the group recycles scrap metal. They buy discarded materials to later sell to factories at a better price. Other group members sew or sell sweets and other things. T. Laura is the current president. She works with her husband in public transportation. They need to buy replacement parts. Her colleagues also need loans to reinforce their businesses by buying larger quantities of products, replacement parts, and supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Irma Ester

texts.es: Irma Ester T. D. N. vive en San Lorenzo departamento  Ahuachapán, vive con su esposo que trabaja D. motorista y con sus dos hijos Jose D. 10 años y Juan D. 6 años, ambos son estudiantes, Irma se dedica a la a la elaboración D. ropa a la medida pero también a la logrado montar un pequeño negocio para aumentar sus ingresos con una  venta D. antojitos como enchiladas y pastelitos D. papa , el destino del crédito que solicita Irma es para comprar materia prima para los antojitos y tela para la ropa que confecciona.
texts.en:
Irma Ester T. D. N. lives in San Lorenzo in the district of Ahuachapán. She lives with her husband, a motorcycle operator, and her two children Jose (age 10) and Juan (age 6). Both of her sons attend school. Irma makes clothes for a living and has been able to manage another small business making snacks, such as enchiladas and potato cakes.

Irma will use her loan to purchase ingredients for her snack business and fabric for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her snack business & fabric for her clothing business

loans.name: Mary Grace M

texts.en:
Mary Grace M L. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is twenty-nine years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Grace owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Mary Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $42 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mary Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to  purchase fertilizers such as manure. Mary Grace is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Emprendedores De Cantemoc 2A Group

texts.es:
El Sr. José del Carmen Rodríguez  García de 45 años, buen esposo, padre de 7 hijos, hombre trabajador de fuertes raíces, buenos principios y valores, es originario de la  pequeña comunidad pesquera de Cantemoc 2a (Cantemoc que en lengua chontal significa arbol de sombra) se encuentra ubicada en las orillas del municipio de Nacajuca en el estado de Tabasco.

Don José por mas de 20 años tenia en su tierra, cultivos de plátano, maíz, fríjol y un poco ganado, los cuales al venderlos eran el medio para obtener un recurso económico, pero debido a la inundación ocurrida hace ya dos años, la fertilidad de sus tierras se acabo y con ella la producción del campo, pero esto no mermo la fuerza de luchar por seguir sacando adelante a su familia, actualmente como actividades económicas sigue desarrollando la crianza de animales de traspatio (borregos y puercos) y junto con sus hijos mayores realiza trabajos de albañilería en comunidades aledañas. 

Como parte de esta labor que emprende día con día por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Don José y sus hijos se han acercado a FRAC para solicitar un crédito por $16,000.00 pesos, con la finalidad de seguir invirtiendo en la compra de ganado porcino mismo que será destinado para la crianza, engorde y posteriormente la venta de carne a granel.

Este será el primer crédito para el grupo denominado F.E. Emprendedores de Cantemoc 2ª, conformado por José del Carmen Rodríguez García, Sara Rodríguez M. (Maestra), Uber Rodríguez M. (Albañil) y Oscar Rodríguez M. (Albañil).

loans.use: Crianza y engorda de cerdos

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is 42 years old and married with eight children aged between 15 and 25 years. Four of her children go to school. Aisha resides in and owns a four-room house where she staying with ten people. There is no electricity and piped water at home.  Aisha takes care of additional family members.  The family gets one meal a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 30 customers a day. Aisha sells cold drinks.  She doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly rent, medication, thieves, feeding the family and increasing prices of clothes. Aisha has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fifteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more drinks. Aisha hope to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda

loans.name: Alejo

texts.en:
Mr.Alejo C. J.., 45 years of age, is married to Melissa C., and they  are blessed with three loving children namely: Alejo C. III, 23 years of age, working in Dubai, as a stocker in a hypermarket, followed by Philip C., 16 years of age, 1st year college student, and their youngest is Geebee, 14 years of age, 2nd year high school student at Alicia Vocational School. They are living at San Francisco Alicia, his wife is also working in Dubai as an OFW (Overseas factory worker). Their house is near at the baranggay hall, beside the irrigation area.

Alejo is a tricycle driver and operator, and also a baranggay councilor in their village, his daily net income is minimum PHP 150.00, and maximum 300.00, he plans to use a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle (part of the tricycle). He wants to help his wife by providing additional income to support the education of their children.

loans.use: Repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia N. is married with three children. She has a small cafe located at the central market in Vinogradovo.

She used to sell small home products at the same market. Because of high competition she decided to take a risk and change her business. She began to provide other market vendors with food. This became a stable source of income for Natalia and her family.

Natalia would like to borrow 12500 UAH to increase the assortment at her cafe. Her business goal is to start a second location and increase the sales.

loans.use: To increase the variety ar her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, juice, rice, beans, cheese, sausage, limes, salt, spices, bread, plates, glasses, and disposable silverware.

loans.name: Carmen De La Flor

texts.en:
Carmen, 27, is a single woman living in Cusco. She is part of the Amancaes group. She works for a tourism agency here in the city and also owns a small grocery store called “Multiservicios Nelli’s” in the neighborhood of Santiago. In her grocery store, she sells various foods and products for the local community after buying all of the goods wholesale. Each day she makes between 40 and 50 soles (about $13 to $17) in earnings from her bodega, or small shop. 

With the loan she receives from Kiva, Carmen hopes to better her business by buying more products for the store. Specifically, with the Christmas season approaching, she will purchase various holiday foods and items to sell.

loans.use: To buy holiday products for her store

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a 12-year-old daughter. She sells cosmetics and perfumes in one of the local markets in Zaporozhye. Irina owns two vending locations in the same marketplace. She has a loyal clientele. Her customers buy from her because she has affordable prices in comparison to other entrepreneurs working with the same type of merchandise. Irina has been in this trade for eight years. She has 25,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas. 

Irina is seeking a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for the upcoming holiday season. Irina’s sales always get a boost at Christmas and New Year’s. She believes the generated profit will not only help her keep a stable position in the market, but will also offer a better livelihood for her family. Irina has been a role model of discipline, accuracy and responsibility. We believe perseverant work and natural liveliness will help her succeed in trade and repay her current loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell during the holiday season

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Mrs. Sao K. and her husband have been rice farmers for many years. This couple have been married for a long time and have four children. Two of their daughters are garment workers and are currently using their income to help their family. Rice comes to maturity at this time of year and Sao K. desires to have some extra income. She has decided to request a loan for capital to order mature rice in bulk to resell. (Sao K. was not available at the  time the photo was taken, and her husband appears instead.)

loans.use: To order mature rice for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chickens

loans.name: Wasswa 1 Lwaga Joyce Group

texts.en: Joyce L. is a widow of forty-six years old and blessed with four school-aged children. She also has ten dependents of which six of them are going to school. She is carrys out tailoring services and has done this for two years. She is using the loan to purchase clothing and cloth to make wears. She is an active woman and dreams of building a better house for her family.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and cloth to make wears.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Dried fish in Nigeria is an essential ingredient in the preparation of local soup like egusi (Melon soup). The demands for dried fish are high in Nigeria. 

Beauty sells dried fish to make a living in Sapele. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She sells her dried fish in the market. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more dried fish to sell. 

She is 41 years old, married to a carpenter, and they have four children. Her youngest child is 14 years old. Her children are still dependent on her and they all attend school. Beauty says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan M. is trader who trades in men’s wear (jeans, t-shirts, etc). He is married and his wife helps in the business on a daily basis. They have two kids.

The stall where he sells his clothing is located at O.I.C gate within the central business district of Bo. He has five years of business experience in men’s wear.

He is seeking a loan to increase his stock as well as increase his sales.

He hopes to use the proceeds of the loan to pay his sons' school fees and to help them pursue their tertiary education.

He is keen to succeed in business as he spends his life on this business.

loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cereals and kola nuts

loans.name: George Kimani

texts.en:
George is 36 years old, married and a father of two boys: Paul and Lewis. He has a food kiosk in Uthiru Trading Center where he sells ready-cooked foods like fries, chicken, rice and others. This is his primary business and he has been doing this for a number of years now. His wife Lucy helps him at the food kiosk.

He learned about KADET through a neighbor who was already a member. This is his third loan with KADET.  With this loan, George plans to buy a bigger cooker so that he can be more efficient in delivering his food services to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a bigger cooker for his food kiosk

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou D. est une femme de 51 ans sociétaire de la caisse de Ouakam et qui habite dans la même localité. Elle a un an d’ancienneté dans l’institution et a déjà bénéficié d’an prêt antérieur. Elle est parent bénéficiaire, mariée  et mère de 8 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de légumes et de charbon de bois. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de charbon de bois destine a la revente. Depuis un certain temps elle a note l’augmentation de la demande et son but est de satisfaire la commande des boutiquiers qui sollicitent de plus en plus ce produit. Pour madame D. ses bénéfices lui permettent de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et d’assurer la dépensé quotidienne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. is a 51-year old woman, who is a shareholder-member of the Oukam savings bank and who lives in the same town. She has been with the bank for a year and has already had one loan. She is a parent member, married and mother to eight children. She is active in trading and selling vegetables and charcoal. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs which will be used for the purchase of charcoal destined to be resold. For some time she has noticed an increase in demand, and her aim is to satisfy the orders of shop owners who are increasingly asking for this product. Mrs. D.'s profits allow her to pay for her children's schooling and to cover daily expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening of funds

loans.name: Mt. Zion Group

texts.en:
Mama B., the leader of the five-member group Mt. Zion, is a 39-year-old single mother of five children who range from 4 to 19 years old and also cares for five siblings. Mama did not have the opportunity to go to school due to a lack of financial support.

For 25 years, Mama has been selling quality cosmetics at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia, treating her customers with politeness and respect which ensures much return patronage.
