She plans to use her 12,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 60,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cosmetic products, her goals being to develop her business into a shop and improve the living conditions of her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mama is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products.

loans.name: Las 5 Rosas Group

texts.es:
ESTA UNIDAD DE DESARROLLO (UDE), SE LLAMA LAS 5 ROSAS, LA RAZON DEL NOMBRE ES QUE ESTA CONFORMADA POR SEÑORAS LAS CUALES SE CONSIDERAN UNAS ROSAS. LAS UDE ES UN GRUPO QUE TIENEN UN PRESTAMO Y SE REUNEN CATORCENALMENTE EN CASA DE LA REPRESENTANTE PARA REALIZAR SUS PAGOS. TIENE UN REPRESENTANTE Y UN COMITÉ QUE LO GOBIERNA. ESTE GRUPO ESTA  UBICADO EN LA LOCALIDAD DE EMILIANO ZAPATA MUNICIPIO DE TECPATAN CHIAPAS.

 EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA SILVERIA C. G. Y TIENE 25 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO ESTUDIO POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS Y APOYO POR FALTA DE SUS PADRES. ELLA HASTA LA ACTUALIDAD TIENE TRES HIJOS 2 MUJERES Y UN VARON. SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE PAN Y EL PRESTAMO LO UTILIZA PARA LA  COMPRA DE INGREDIENTE Y ASI OBTENER MAYORES GANANCIAS,  SUS CLENTES LE COMENTAN QUE TIENE UN BUEN NEGOCIO Y LO PREFIEREN POR EL SABOR Y CALIDAD QUE TIENE.

ANGELINA G. G. ES MIEMBRO Y COMITÉ DE GRUPO LAS 5 ROSAS TIENE 63 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA NO ESTUDIO POR QUE SUS PADRES NO TENIAN SUFICIENTE RECURSOS. EN LA ACTUALIDAD YA NO TIENE HIJOS EN SU PODER SOLO ESTA EN COMPAÑÍA DE DOS NIENTOS Q DESDE PEQUEÑOS ESTAN CON ELLA. DOÑA ANGELINA SE DEDICA A VENDER TRASTES DE PLASTICOS Y PELTRES LA RAZON DEL PRESTAMO ES COMPRAR MAS MERCANCIAY AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y VENDERLO EN LAS COMUNIDADES, SUS CLIENTES LE COMENTAN QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS DE CALIDAD Y LE VA MUY BIEN DESDES QUE TIENE SURTIDA SU VENTA LA PREFIEREN POR SER  AMABLE Y PACENSIOSA.
LOS OTROS TRES INTREGRANTES SE LLAMAN: BLANCA LETICIA E. H., BLANCA LIDIA H. M. Y BENITA H. S., ELLAS UTILIZAN SU PRESTAMO PARA AMPLIAR CADA UNA DE SUS ACTIVIDADES, Y ASI PODER TRABAJAR Y OBTENER MEJORES GANANCIAS ATRAVES DE SUS ESFUERZOS Y DEL PRESTAMO QUE FUNDACION REALIDAD A. C. LES BRINDA.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “Las 5 Rosas” (The Five Roses) because the women of this group consider themselves to be roses. They have taken out a loan and meet every two weeks in the home of the group representative to submit their payments. In addition to having a representative, the group has its own governing committee and is located in the community of Emliano Zapata, which is within the town of Tecpatan Chiapas.

The group representative is 25 year old Silveria C. G.. Unfortunately she was not able to attend school due to limited financial resources and a lack of support from her parents. She currently has three children, two daughters and a son. Silveria makes bread and will use her loan to buy ingredients so that she can generate more income. Her customers say she has a good business and that they prefer the taste and quality of her products.

Angelina G. G. is 63 years old and a member and part of the committee for the Five Roses Group. She did not attend school because her parents did not have enough money. Angelina no longer sees her children because they left her alone to take care of her two grandchildren when they were little. Doña Angelina sells cooking utensils made of plastic and pewter. She will use her loan to buy more merchandise so that she can expand her business and sell in other communities. Her customers say that the products she sells are of good quality. Doña Angelina has done very well because she keeps her business well-stocked and people prefer to buy from her because she is friendly and patient.

The other three members are Blanca Leticia E. H., Blanca Lidia H. Muñoz, and Benita H. S.. Through their hard work and with the support of Fundación Realidad, they will use their loans to expand their businesses so that they can continue working and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Celestina's Group

texts.en:
Celestina A., aged 57, is from the village of Punta Sulong. She is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if either is delinquent or defaults.

Celestina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling piglets. Celestina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. She is also engaged in fish selling.

In 2004, Celestina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC which was used as additional capital for raising pigs. Celestina is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used as additional capital for fish selling. This will be the 17th loan she has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her standard of living. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for fish selling

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda I. is from Iligan City. She is 45 years old, widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. Gilda owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Gilda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Gilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gilda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be again be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Gilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además brinda el servicio de venta de comida a algunos pensionistas que tiene en el mismo local, actividades que realiza todos los días ella sola. Además Elsa alquila habitaciones en su casa. En el ultimo mes le realizaron una intervención quirúrgica lo cual impide un normal trabajo en sus negocios.
Elsa es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua y lo mas le agrada son las capacitaciones acerca del valor de la mujer que son iguales a los varones y también el incentivo al ahorro.
Elsa solicita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Alicia son tener una ferretería y educar a sus hijos porque ocupan los primeros lugares en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elsa has a store in her house where she sells groceries. In addition, she offers a service selling prepared foods to a few pensioners for whom she has provided lodging in her home. She manages both businesses every day by herself. Elsa also rents out rooms in her house. Last month she had to undergo surgery which kept her from the normal duties related to running her businesses.

Elsa is married and has three children who are in school. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. What she enjoys most are the training classes that value women on the same level as men as well as having the incentive to save.

Elsa is requesting a loan of 900 PEN to be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of opening a hardware store and providing an education for her children because their studies are her main concern.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Jyambere Group

texts.fr:
Germain U., née à bugesera  secteur Sake l’Est du pays, marié, il a 3 enfants, il a 33 ans, son ainé a 6  ans et son dernier enfant à 2 ans et  son niveau d’éducation est primaire. Il vit avec sa famille à sake Bugesera. Cinq de  ses enfants vont à l’école. Avec son épouse ils travaillent pour faire vivre et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Il fait le commerce des habits pour détail, avec ce prêt il veut  acheter les chemises et pantalons  pour hommes et femme et pour enfants, il effectue ce commerce dans le centre commercial de Sake qui est un centre rural mais qui en voie de développement. Il a pu construire une maison dans laquelle il habite, lui et sa famille.
Il appartient dans un groupe solidaire appelé JYAMBERE,  qui est un groupe dont les membres sont  tous commerçants et ils se garantissent mutuellement, Jérémie et son groupe travaillent pour faire vivre leurs familles en améliorant leurs conditions de vie et en amenant leurs enfants à l’école. En fait, le groupe a contracté un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano Community Banking pour acheter les articles de leur commerce et les revendre, une partie du profit est  réinvesti pour maintenir la stabilité financière du groupe et épargner afin de préparer pour un bon futur.
texts.en:
Germain U. was born in Bugesera, in the Sake district in the Eastern part of the country. He is 33 years old. His eldest child is 6 and the youngest 2 years old. His education level is primary. He lives with his family in Sake Bugesera, and five of his children attend school. He earns his living together with his wife and they seek to improve their family’s living conditions. He retails clothing, and with this loan intends to buy shirts and pants for men, women and children. His business is located in the commercial area of Sake, which is a developing rural centre. He was able to build a house where he lives together with his family. He belongs to a solidarity group named Jyambere, whose members are all merchants and provide each other with mutual guarantee. Jérémie and his group work to ensure their family’s subsistence, improve their living conditions, and provide schooling for their children. In fact, the group has obtained a loan from the Amasezerano Community Banking association, to buy items for resale in their commerce. Part of the profit is reinvested to ensure the group’s financial stability, and put into savings to prepare for a prosperous future.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shirts and pants for men, women and children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Corina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Corina es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene la edad de 57 años, casada, con cuatro hijos.
Desde hace varios años logro tener su propio negocio, venta de comida en donde vende en su casa. Lo que no ha logrado es la construcción propia del negocio.
Su esposo es de condición humilde pues trabaja como obrero pero ambos se han esforzado para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Hoy en día necesita dar un jiro a su pequeña comideria, el menú le es variado y ha logrado la captación de clientes.
Para ella es de necesidad invertir en las mejoras de su negocio es por eso con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción  para entechar el local y poner piso.
Para esto comprara: laminas de zinc, perlinez, piso. Lo que permitirá un mejor ambiente, mejor higiene. Y esperando lograr mejores ventas que superen el objetivo. Para un bien común.
texts.en:
Corina is a very hard-working woman of 57 years, married, with four children. She has had her own food-selling business for several years, which she manages from within her own house. However, she has not been able to build a proper site in which to house the business. Corina’s husband works as a labourer and is of modest means, but both have worked hard to improve the standard of their family’s living. Corina has given her small eatery a new approach by varying the menu, therefore attracting more clientele. She needs to invest in improving her business and therefore will use the loan to buy building materials from which to construct the roof and lay the foundations. Corina plans to buy zinc roofing panels, purlins (roof joints), and flooring, which will improve surroundings and hygiene. Corina hopes to achieve greater sales, which exceed her expectations, in order to benefit everybody.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan will go towards buying building materials and therefore give the small business a boost in improving its overall infrastructure.

loans.name: Kpormah Group

texts.en:
Parker K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Kpormah. He is 26 years old and single. He was able to attend school only through twelfth grade due to lack of financial support.
 
For 6 years, he has been selling used clothes in “Red light Market” on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 26,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of used clothes to sell. 

He describes himself as a determined man whose dream is to improve his business and to continue his education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo ya sus hijos en el sector Cruce de Vega, una zona agrícola dedicada principalmente al cultivo de frutos como el mango y el limón, pertenece a la provincia de Piura y se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo en actividades ligadas a la agricultura desde que se casaron. Ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde ha sembrado árboles de mango y limón, actualmente estas plantas se encuentran en plena producción y semanalmente se dirige junto a sus hijos a recoger los frutos para luego venderlos a las fabricas del lugar que se encargan de preparar los productos para exportarlos a diversos países del extranjero.

Adicionalmente cría gallos y gallinas en un corral ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Su esposo trabaja como dependiente en un fundo del lugar. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de sus respectivas actividades ellos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia de la mejor manera posible.

Margarita desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a sus plantaciones, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles de modo que pueda lograr su objetivo.

Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Margarita, 43, is married and lives with her husband and children in Cruce de Vega, an agricultural area known primarily for fruit cultivation, mostly mangoes and lemons. It is part of Piura province, Piura region, located over three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. She and her husband have worked in farming-related activities since they got married. She has farmlands where she has planted mango and lemon trees. The plants are currently in their optimal production phase and she and her children harvest fruit weekly to sell to local processing plants that prepare the products for export to various countries abroad. In addition she raises chickens and roosters in her back yard. Her husband is employed as a laborer by a local agricultural estate. Income they both earn from their respective activities is used to provide for the family in the best possible way. Margarita wants to get some fertilizer for crop maintenance. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 500 new sol, loan to reach this objective. Her greatest wish is to continue working to get her family ahead. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a levelheaded, responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for mango and lemon crops.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a member of the Wema group in Faulu Kenya. She runs a grocery shop to earn a living. She also sells charcoal in a stall made of iron sheets. Her husband also supports her financially. She was previously running a retail shop before she went into this business.    

She has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy charcoal and groceries.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and groceries

loans.name: Jennifer Rosa

texts.es: Jennifer tiene 24 años de edad ella se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa desde hace ya un año aproximadamente, ella sueña con incrementar su negocio por lo que solicita un crédito a fin de comprar mas mercaderia y poder empezar a realizar sus ventas en mas cantidad, ella vende la ropa en su domicilio, su negocio es el sustento de su familia ya que ella es soltera y no tiene hijos, por lo que se esfuerza bastante  para poder darle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida, se le brinda el credito por contar con buenas referencias personales y capacidad de pago.
texts.en: Jennifer is 24 years old and has been in the business of selling clothes for about a year.  She dreams of increasing her business.  She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more merchandise and be able to make more sales.  She sells clothes from her home.  Her business supports her family since she is single and has no children.  She works hard to be able to give her parents a better quality of life.  She is being granted a loan because she has good personal references and the ability to pay.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Albina

texts.es:
Albina es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mensajeras” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y con 02 hijos, la señora realizo estudios de educación  primaria.

Albina viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año,  nos cuenta que su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar el capital de su negocio de fabricación de prendas de vestir y tejidos.

La señora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero con el que comprará materiales para la confección de ropas para niños y producción de tejidos.
	
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y educar a sus hijos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones, charlas y lo que gana el ahorro.
texts.en:
Albina is a member of the communal bank, “Las Mensejaras,” or ‘The Messengers,’ located in the Juliaca District of the San Román province, Puno department. She is 34, in a common law marriage and has two children. She completed elementary school.

Albina has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. She tells us that her first loan was for 500.00 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency], which she used to increase the capital for her business of weaving and making clothing.

Albina requests a new loan for 800.00 nuevos soles which she will use to purchase material for making children’s clothing and weaving. 

Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children. 

What she likes best about her comunal bank are the meetings, the talks, and what she earns in savings.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the production of clothing and weaving

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es: Marcelino, de 55 años, hace algún tiempo se separó de su esposa, con la que tienen 8 hijos. Pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Jesús, de 18 y Alfredo, de 15 años. Juntos viven en unión familiar en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio. A pesar del apoyo que perdió, él se siente fortalecido, ya que el amor hacía sus hijos es lo que le motiva para salir adelante. Ya tiene 8 años dedicándose a la agricultura, donde siembra café, plátano y demás productos oriundos del lugar. Lo que más le gusta a él es poder ver sus esfuerzos cristalizados, en cada fruta que vende, pues sabe muy bien el esfuerzo que realizan los agricultores para trabajar la tierra y poder producirla. Sin embargo, los constantes retrasos que tiene la cosecha de sus últimos productos, es lo que perjudica en la producción, debido a al clima inestables. Pero a pesar de todos los altibajos propios de un buen agricultor, él desea seguir sembrando cada año más cantidad de frutos. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo de trabajo arduo con su banco comunal, logró grandes objetivos, como el de construir una casa propia ubicada en su mismo terreno agrícola. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varias plantas de café, para su nuevo vivero y si el dinero le alcanza podrá comprar abono, para sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Marcelino, 55 years old, has for some time been separated from his wife, with whom he has eight kids.  He lives with two of them: Jesús, 18 and Alfredo, 15.  They live in their own home in Sanchirio.  Despite the support that he lost, he is strengthened by the love that he has for his children.  This motivates him to come out ahead.

He has farmed for eight years, cultivating coffee, plantains and other native products.  What Marcelino likes most is seeing his efforts crystallize in each fruit that he sells.  He knows well the effort that farmers put in to working land and making it produce.  Of course, constant set backs in harvesting his latest crop has damaged production, due to climate instability.  Despite the ups and downs of any good farmer, he wants to continue cultivating more fruit each year.

This is his fourth loan with MFP.  In this time of arduous work with his communal bank, Marcelino has been able to fulfill big goals, like that of building a house on his own farm land.  This is why he has thought of investing the loan in the purchase of several coffee plants for his new nursery.  If he has enough money left, he will be able to buy fertilizer for his coffee plants.

loans.use: For the purchase of coffee plants and fertilizer.

loans.name: Orn

texts.en: Mrs. Orn P. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops from their own farmland. The couple has a child who attends public school. Mrs. Orn P. has raised a lot of piglets and she is hoping to sell them to buyers four months after she begins raising them. Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for Mrs. Orn P. and her family, she has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets. She will use the rest of the funds to purchase many sacks of rice to store and then sell when rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and piglets

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay S., 41, is a farmer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and nine children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkor Wat Temple. The family has to spend USD 60 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase cows to help plow her rice field. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Oropesa, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Yanet; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con negocio de preparación y venta de pan, ella es propietaria de una panificadora y prepara diferentes tipos de pan, la socia vende en la plaza de armas de Oropesa, ella atiende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pan. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE OROPESA” community bank which is located in Oropesa district, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department.

Yanet is 29 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business making and selling bread.  She owns her own bakery and makes different types of bread which she sells in the main square in Oropesa.  She works from 6.00am to 8.00pm.  Yanet would like to expand and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making bread.

Yanet is pleased to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making bread

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Virginie is 48 years old. She has 5 children aged between eighteen and twenty-eight. They have all been in school, apart from one who did not want to go to school. 

Virginie sells green bananas; she is proud of her business and she has done it for nine years. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more green bananas and with the profits she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying more green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy goats for retail

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita O. is from the village of Zone 7, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 55 years old. Warlita is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Warlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a single woman with five school-aged children. She has been running a food-selling stall for the past two years. Previously she sold ground nuts which contributed to her source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit.

She is requesting 25,000Kes to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a restaurant in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda L. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old and still single. She is currently engaged in a dressmaking business and at the same time she is working as a caregiver for two children. She has been engaged in this business for two years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of   PHP 20,000 PHP from PMPC.

Merlinda is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be use to purchase additional materials in her dressmaking business. This will be her 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the living standard of her family.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her dressmaking business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old.  She is married and has 1 child. Letecia works very hard to provide for her family.   To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  Letecia has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Letecia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, curls, oil, etc.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy medicines for resell.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch S. M. is a 40-year-old rice farmer who resides in the province of Kompong Cham. She has a plot of land where she plants vegetables and other crops to generate income. She has three children who have completed school. One daughter stays with her; she is employed as a garment factory worker. Her husband earns a daily income by cuting old trees to make firewood. Touch S. wishes to buy a new motorcycle so she can transport her vegetables to sell in the market. She will also be able to ride anywhere without renting a motor taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to transport her vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, aged 43, is a single mother to two children,  Mary aged 26 and Ruth who is 18 years old. Esther sells timber in Limuru town near Nairobi, which she has been doing for the last six years. The business earns her a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is Esther's fifth loan from Kiva partner, KADET,  and she has successfully managed to pay her previous loans. WIth this loan, she wants to buy more timber for resale. In the future, Esther hopes to start a yard in Nairobi in order to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy more timber for resale.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Doña Esperanza es una señora casada, tiene 41 años D. edad, cursó los estudios D. educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos y ninguno esta estudiando, se dedica a oficios domésticos, elaboración D. prendas D. tejidos a mano, y a la venta D. medicina en general, tiene 6 años D. experiencia en atender una farmacia que ha sido una fuente D. ingreso importante para ella, inició con un poco D. capital, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la albañilería. 

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo para la compra D. medicamentos para reventa, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: crianza D. animales, venta D. calzado, venta D. medicina, atención a tienda D. consumo diario, y a la venta D. verduras. Esperan mejorar su negocio y capitalizarlo más.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a 41 year-old married lady.  She completed her elementary school education and has two children.  Neither of her children are in school.  Esperanza does housework and weaves garments by hand.  She also sells medicine.  She has six years' experience running a pharmacy which has been an important source of income for her.  She started out with just a little capital.  She has the support of her husband who works in the building traD..

Esperanza formed a group in order to request a loan to buy medicines for resale.  The other members of her group work in different businesses including: raising animals, selling footwear, selling medicine, running a grocery store and selling vegetables.  Esperanza hopes to improve her business and capitalize it further.

loans.use: to buy medicines for resale

loans.name: Heber Alexi

texts.es: Hebert Alexi tiene su actividad de granos básicos. Hace más de 8 años que tiene este negocio por lo que le ha gustado conversar con sus clientes, el los ofrece en su vivienda y de manaera ambulante pues el siempre se esfuerza por proporcionar un buen servicio para no perder la clientela. El vio este negocio como una oportunidad de empleo para mantener a su familia, ya que tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. El crédito es para la compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, concentrado,  aceite y otros productos. Su deseo es obtener nuevos clientes y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Hebert Alexi’s business is basic grains.  He has had the business for over eight years, and he has enjoyed conversing with his customers.  He sells in his house and in an itinerant manner.  

He is always striving to provide good service so that he does not lose customers.  He viewed this business as an employment opportunity in order to support his family.  He has three minor children who are under his care.

The loan is to buy corn, beans, rice, concentrate, oil, and other products.

His wish is to get new customers and to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, concentrate, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is married and a mother of three adult-age children. She is 51 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Annette is a farmer. She grows and harvests pineapples to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, Annette earns approximately PHP 50,000 from this farming business. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase plastic mulch to prevent weeds from growing.

Annette has been a member of GDMPC for six months. In the future, Annette hopes to expand her pineapple farming and finish the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase plastic mulch.

loans.name: Gelou Blood Marina

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans, celibataire sans enfant , A la fin de l'obtention de son Diplome de Technicien Superieur,n'ayant pas pu trouver du travail elle se lance dans l'apprentissage de la broderie et le tricotage il depuis bientot dix ans.Elle fait des tricots et brassieres pour nouveaux nes, des napperons et sacs en fils de nylon.
Elle fait des ventes de 50.000 a 125.000 frs par jour, elle a une forte clientele qui sont la majorite des femmes enceintes et des femmes au foyer.
A l'octroi de son pret, elle va renforcer le stock de ses fils en achetant 10 douzaine de fils a tricoter, 10 rouleaux de fils en nylon et des tissus.
Avec ses benefices , elle est entrain d'epargner pour acheter une machine a tricoter pour fabriquer des ensembles de nouveaux nes en quantite enormes et des series de services de table.
texts.en:
This borrower is 29 years old and single without children. Unable to find work after obtaining her Senior Technician Diploma, she started to learn embroidery and knitting nearly ten years ago. She makes knit tops and wrap-overs for newborns, as well as placemats and nylon bags. 

She earns 50,000 to 125,000 francs per day, and has a strong customer base consisting mostly of pregnant women and housewives. 

With her loan, she will replenish her stock of supplies by buying 10 dozen balls of yarn, 10 rolls of nylon thread and some fabrics.  

With her profits, she will add to her savings to purchase a knitting machine, which will help her to produce large quantities of clothing for newborn and sets of table linens.

loans.use: to buy 10 dozens balls of yarn, 10 rolls of nylon thread, and some fabrics

loans.name: Andres Abraham

texts.es:
Andrés, es ganadero, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedico a la ganadería por iniciativa propia, no tiene un horario fijo y cuenta con mucha experiencia para tratar con ganado.
Actualmente necesita comprarse ganado, pues tiene la oferta de comprarse unas vacas que le ayudaran para aumentar tanto en número en su terreno como la producción.
Su objetivo es que a través de financiamientos pueda crecer su ganadería, y fortalecer así su condición económica y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Andrés, a livestock breeder, lives with his wife and child. He raises cattle on his own. Andrés does not work according to fixed schedule and has plenty of experience in raising cattle.

He currently needs to buy cattle. Andrés has an offer to buy a few cows to add to his herd so that he can increase production. His goal is to use the loan to grow his livestock business and strengthen the financial condition of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ysaias

texts.es:
Ysaias es un padre de familia de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande, la cual pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Ysaias desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado ovino (tiene 30 ovejas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales, una vez que lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo los ofrece en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtiene buenas ganancias para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Ysaias es un hombre trabajador y responsable que lo único que quiere es que su hijo se supere y  mejorar económicamente para brindarles estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Ysaias is 29 years old and a husband and father. He lives with his wife and son in his own house, which has electricity only, in the rural district of Tambogrande, Piura. This area is known for its farming, livestock and handicrafts. 

Ysaias has been raising and selling sheep for several years (he has 30 sheep). His corral is located at the back of his house and is both suitable and large enough. He feeds the sheep nutrtionally balanced food and fresh fodder. Once they have reached an optimum weight, he sells them at various local markets. He makes a good profit and uses this to pay for the familiy's daily living expenses.

He has requested a loan of 500 Nuevos Soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy nutritionally balanced food. The income will be sufficient to cover the loan and improve his family's standard of living. Ysaias is a hardworking and responsible man. His only wish is to better his economic situation in order to afford a higher education for his son so that he does better for himself.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced food for his animals

loans.name: Concilie

texts.en:
Concilie has been a rice farmer for the past 5 years. She is married, with 2 children, and she learned rice farming from a formal training program within her cooperative.

She will use a Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es: Pepe tiene 60 años, es un hombre que siempre esta en actividad y pendiente de sus responsabilidades, convive con su pareja, ambos tienen cuatro hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Él vive con su pareja en su casa propia cuidando de sus tres nietos. El trabajo de Pepe consiste en la siembra de ajies que tiene en un huerto especial en su chacra, por otro lado cuenta con una pequeña tienda en donde vende gasolina, éste negocio lo realiza en su casa, y el cual se encarga su pareja vendiendo también pollo, hielo y bebidas heladas. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder hacer todas sus actividades y estar a lado de sus nietos. Este será el quinto crédito con MFP y espera seguir contando con la ayuda de todos ustedes ya que es muy imñortante para crecer su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará seillas de ajies para la siguiente siembra, además de comprar productos para su tienda, como bebidas y otros productos.
texts.en:
Pepe is 60 years old.  He is a man who is always working and aware of his responsibilities.  He lives with his partner and they have four children who are grown up and live independently.  Pepe lives with his partner in his own home and cares for their three grandchildren.  Pepe's business is growing peppers in a special vegetable garden that he has on his farm.  He also has a small store where he sells soda.  He carries out this business from his home and his partner works there too, selling chicken, ice and frozen drinks.  What Pepe enjoys about his work is that he has time to be able to carry out all his activities and also be with his grandchildren.

This will be Pepe's fifth loan from MFP and he hopes to continue receiving your help as it is very important to him in growing his business.  He will use the sum he has requested to buy pepper seeds for his next sowing season.  He will also buy products for his store such as drinks and other products.

loans.use: to buy pepper seeds and products for his store

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Angeles utilizara el credito para seguir invirtiendo en materiales para la produccion de calzado.
texts.en: María de los Angeles will use the loan to continue investing in shoe-making materials.

loans.use: Purchase materials to make women's shoes

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila; ella tiene 58 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de picantería, ella vende gaseosas, cervezas y comida, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de picantería. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la picantería como vasos, cervezas, gaseosas y sillas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila is a member of the Valle Sagrado de Calca microfinance group, which is located in the Calca district of the province by the same name, department of Cusco.

Ms. Lucila is a 58-year-old married mother of four. She alternates her daily chores with her restaurant business in which she sells soft drinks, beer, and food. She works from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm. She would like to expand and improve her restaurant. She is requesting this loan in order to restock her restaurant with things like glasses, beer, soft drinks, and chairs.

Our member is happy about this loan, and she commits to making her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase glasses, beer, soft drinks, and chairs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 36-year-old, married woman with four children. The oldest child is 15 years old.  Wilma's husband is a carpenter.

Wilma provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community.  She is happy that she has regular customers now.  Wilma is also an AVON dealer.  She works hard to support her family.  Wilma requested this loan to purchase cuticle remover, nail polish and other materials for manicures and pedicures.  Wilma hopes to have a stable business in the future. She hopes to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cuticle remover, nail polish and other materials for manicures and pedicures.

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny manage his corn field patiently to earn a living. He is 31 years old and married with only one child. He devotes his time to cultivating and maintaining his corn field so that his profit will increase. His wife is still in college.

Johnny has been managing his farm for almost 13 years but still needs additional capital to maintain it and increase his yields. For these reasons, he would like a loan amounting to P27,000. This amount would really help him, especially in supporting the education of his wife and their daily needs. He is hoping that someday he could be financially stable and he could save some money for the future of their only child.

loans.use: to maintain his corn farm.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She farms to earn a living for her family.  The climate of her region is favorable for farming.  This has helped her to farm well.  She practices mixed farming; growing crops and rearing dairy cows. It has been 1 year since she started farming.
Dorothy hopes to expand her farm by 3 acres for more produce.  She needs a loan of 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy seedlings for cabbages, kale, spinach, and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for cabbages, kale, spinach, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Expedith

texts.en: Expedith is 29 years old and single. He sells fertilizers in a shop that he has run for 6 years, but he would like a loan to buy veterinary products such as injections, capsules and aerosols to sell in his store. He will use any profits to build a house.

loans.use: To buy veterinary products to sell in his store

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 28 years old and married to Vivian.They have two children. He buys and sells cereals to earn a living and besides that, he also sells a grocery inclusive of fruits. He earns an income of Kshs.10,000 every month and he has been in this business for a period of one year now. 

He has applied for a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which he will use to buy more cereals for sale. This is his first loan from KADET LTD and he hopes to pay it well without delays.

His dreams for the future business and his family is to be the leading distributor of goods in the whole district.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  cerals and fruits for sale

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT and Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 10,600,000 Sierra Leonean Leones in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will use their salaries to repay the loan. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment amount from their salaries and pays SMT/Kiva lenders on their behalf.

Joseph (who is pictured second from right) is the leader of this group of teachers. The 33 year old was born in Magburaka. He is married to a teacher and the couple has three children – one in primary school and two in secondary school. Joseph has been a professional teacher for 15 years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials like bags of cements, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a family house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like bags of cements, iron rods, etc. for the construction of a family house

loans.name: Am

texts.en: Am, 61, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer. All of her children are employed. Two children are chewing gum vendors and one is a garment worker. Am is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to run a new business by purchasing groceries to sell at home. In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell at home.

loans.name: Dolores Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Dolores tiene como actividad en la venta de mantas de tejido y de Tules, trabaja en su domicilio en la Zona Ballivian de la Ciudad de el Alto La Paz, actividad que desarrolla de lunes a domingo,  siendo muy conocido por su trabajo y tiene pedidos en las tiendas de su Zona, el esposo es chofer asalariado, el destino del crédito en esta ocasión es  para aumentar su capital de negocio, en esta temporada esta bajo el precio del corte para la manta.
Ella  es una persona muy activa el vive junto con su esposo,  tiene tres hijos todos son dependientes,  los solicitantes  tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante para vivir mejor y  creces en su actividad, se siente muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Dolores sells woven blankets and reed rugs. She works in her home in the Ballivian area in the city of Alto de Paz. She works from Monday to Sunday, and she is well known for her work and has orders in the local stores. Her husband is a wage-earning chauffeur. The purpose of the current loan is to increase working capital since the cost of fabric for the blankets is low at this time of year. 

She is a very busy person and lives with her husband. She has three grown children. The applicant has a great desire to get ahead to live better and grow her business. She’s very thankful for the opportunity that’s been given to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make blankets.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson wants a loan to buy more land to plant tea. The forty-five-year-old hardworking man lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He still has challenges of unpredictable seasonal changes and his dream is to own at least forty acres of tea plantation. He used the previous loan to pay workers who were plucking his tea.

loans.use: to buy more land to plant tea.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hard-working mother of five children. 

She is determined in her hog-raising activity in Pagadian and wants to earn more for commercial sales. 

With a loan of PHP 25,000 she hopes to build concrete pig pens for good sanitation. 

In the future, she hopes to put up a meat shop.

loans.use: to build concrete pig pens

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gemma is 49 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Gemma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients  like chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Gemma has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients  like chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is among the first members of Karura Mwangaza Women Group. She is married with four children, enterprising and hard working. Two of her children are in secondary while the other two are in primary.

She sells milk to her neighbours and has a stall in Wangige market –Kiambu. She is able to get school fees for her children and for her home upkeep. In addition, she sells fruits and vegetables in the same market.

loans.use: She would like to use dairy feeds to help increase milk production.

loans.name: Timothy Suh

texts.en:
Timothy is the father of five children and seven grandchildren. His dream is to build a house from which he can collect rents when he becomes old and tired and cannot continue with labor-intensive business. Having received training in pig farming, shoe-mending, marketing techniques and credit management organized by GHAPE, he has borrowed and repaid three cycles of loans of $40, $100 and $120  since 2003. He succeeded in rendering shoe repair services and providing manure for cultivation and meat to his community.

Given a loan of $400, he plans to buy 2 truck loads of firewood and sell it for cooking and heating; buy materials to enlarge his pig sty to produce additional manure and meat for farmers and consumers in the community; buy a hoe and cutlass yam seeds to cultivate for increased carbohydrate supply in the local markets; and tools to repair shoes. 

He is capable of handling the loan and repaying without difficulties given his previous credit history and achievements from profits on previous loans. He plans to pay his loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Pig and crop cultivation; sale of firewood;  shoe-mending

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the materials he needs to start a cafe

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is a charismatic, entrepreneurial, hardworking and very sociable person. He is married and has two children, a boy and a girl, 8 and 7 years old respectively, and his wife is a housewife. Armando started in this business 10 years ago in Mexico City, and then he moved to another city to establish his own business and also obtain a fixed income to support his family expenses. He did it 5 years ago. He started in a little place in a house which was lent by his uncle and there was the place in which he began, and with the passing of the years his business grew and he also maintained his family and continued with this and also improving their quality of life.

Armando is requesting for a loan of US $ 475 to purchase merchandise for his business and also to makeover his business to have a better place for his clients. He offers to repay this loan in four months and he appreciates very much all your support to continue his business growth.

Translated from the original text in Spanish.

Armando es una persona carismática, emprendedora, trabajadora y muy sociable, el esta casado y tiene dos hijos un niño y una niña de 8 y 7 años de edad respectivamente, su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar, Armando empezó en el negocio de la carnicería hace 10 años atrás en la ciudad de México y luego se mudo de ciudad para poner su negocio propio y poder tener un ingreso que le permita mantener a su familia, fue hace 5 años atrás. Empezó acondicionando un espacio en una casa que le fue prestada por su tío y ahí comenzó su negocio, con el tiempo ha ido creciendo y le ha permitido su negocio poder mantener a su familia y espera continuar con el mismo y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Armando está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar materia prima para su negocio así como también para remodelar su local y tener un mejor aspecto para sus clientes. Él ofrece pagar el préstamo en un período de 4 meses y les agradece mucho la ayuda que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer para poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Mr. Eusebio is 44 years old, and he is married to Nilsa Caballero, age 44, who is an educator. She teaches at one of the schools near their home, and through that activity she contributes to the support of their household. They have two children and one niece whom they care for since she became an orphan. All of them attend school. Eusebio tells us that those three are the happiness of the house.

Eusebio has a butcher shop, which he inherited from his father who worked there for a long time. Many of the necessary elements were purchased by his father, such as a commercial freezer, a saw, a scale, and others. Since he already had the necessary elements, he decided to continue with this work. With the help of his wife, and the good fortune to have a clientele already formed, the business has proceeded well and has grown in recent times. Thanks to this he can give a worthy life to his family and a good education to his children.

Mr. Eusebio is requesting a loan in order to buy a high-capacity electric saw, since the one he has got damaged and the necessary repair is difficult to get.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Sr. Eusebio tiene 44 años de edad, está casado con Nilsa Caballero de 44 años, quien es docente, ella enseña en una de las escuelas cercanas a su domicilio y con esta actividad también aporta para el sustento del hogar. Tienen dos hijos y una sobrina que quedo a cargo de ellos luego de quedar huérfana, todos estudian y van a la escuela, Eusebio nos cuenta que los tres son la alegría de la casa.

Eusebio tiene una carnicería, la misma la heredó de su padre quien por mucho tiempo se dedicó a ella; muchos de los elementos necesarios ya los había comprado su padre, como ser heladera comercial, serrucho, balanza y otros.

Ya que contaba con los elementos necesarios decidió continuar con este trabajo con la ayuda que le proporcionaba su esposa, con la suerte de contar con una clientela formada, el negocio marcha bien y a crecido en los últimos tiempos; gracias a esto da una vida digna a su familia y una buena educación a sus hijos.

El Sr. está solicitando el préstamo para poder comprar un serrucho eléctrico de mayor capacidad, ya que la que tenía se averió y el repuesto necesario es difícil de conseguir.

loans.use: to buy a high-capacity electric saw

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is very happy with her plantation business of planting taro, yams and bananas. She also recently added vegetables, such as cucumbers and pumpkins, to supplement her income.

Her requested $800 USD loan is for buying weed-killing chemicals and fertilizers, which are much needed in maintaining the good growth of her plantation. She hopes for another loan to help buy a second-hand pick-up truck for delivering her produce to the market. She is very thankful for the financial support she looks forward to receiving and paying back within the loan term.

loans.use: To buy weed-killing chemicals and fertilizer for her plantation

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira belongs to the Las Riojanitas ("The Rioja Girls") community bank. Her business is located in her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She offers hair-dressing services (haricuts, waves, coloring, etc.) and sells beauty products.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (500 Peruvian soles or about US$167), to be repaid in 4 installments, Elvira will buy supplies like hair dyes (24 units of different colors), luminous base (2 litres), "acidos fijadores" (2 litres), shampoos and conditioners.

Elvira is a single mother. Her children were her main motivator for starting the business. She's proud that she's independent and that she's managed to set up the business at home. She also shares her knowledge, teaching what she most enjoys--hair-dressing--at a local vocational school.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman

La señora Elvira pertenece al Banco Comunal las Riojanitas, tiene ubicado su negocio en su casa en el Jr. Angaiza 735 del distrito de Rioja, provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Ella brinda servicios de cosmetología (corte de cabello, ondulaciones, tintes y otros) así mismo a la venta de productos de cosmetología.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 ($ 167.00), el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará materiales como tintes para cabello (24 unidades de distintos colores), bases luminosas (02 litros), ácidos fijadores (02 litros), shampoos y acondicionadores de cabello (02 litros).

Ella es madre soltera, sus hijos son su principal razón para salir adelante y se siente muy orgullosa porque ahora es independiente y se organiza para distribuir las tareas en el hogar. Comparte sus actividades de docente en un Centro Ocupacional enseñando lo que más le gusta hacer... cosmetología.

loans.use: Buy products for beauty salon.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy is a young woman who is 21 years old. She's been almost married for one year to the person she's been living with for 4 years. They have two small children whom they adore.

Daisy is a seamstress and previously worked for a person who paid for all the work she completed. She currently has three sewing machines, that are set up in her living room.

She now wants to build a small workshop where she'll be able to work with greater ease because the space that she now has available is very limited.

Currently she is in need of a loan which will be invested in the purchase of a sewing machine which will handle the work which is in high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Deisy es una joven mujer de 21 años que se casó hace apenas 1 año con la persona con quien convivió primeramente por un lapso de 4 años. Tienen dos hijos pequeños que son la adoración de la pareja.

Deisy es costurera y comenta que anteriormente trabajaba para una persona que le pagaba por los trabajos terminados. Hoy día ya cuenta con tres máquinas de coser propias que están instaladas en la sala de su casa.

Desea construir un pequeño taller en donde trabajará con mayor comodidad debido a que el espacio que dispone ahora es muy reducido.

Actualmente necesita de un préstamo que será invertido en la compra de una máquina más debido a que tiene mucha demanda.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.  (compra de una maquina de coser)

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 40-year-old Mwajuma S.. She is married with six children, ages 4, 11, 15, 17, 21, and 23, and has two other dependents, who are her niece and nephew. Mwajuma runs a clothing business, and requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her range of clothing.

loans.name: Awisir

texts.en: Awisir, 46, is married but her husband S. is unemployed. To support her family, she has gone into business on her own, running a small food stall near her house where she makes $5 a day selling snacks. She has applied for a loan of $100 to expand this business. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand a business selling snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase an industrial strength sewing machine

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. is married and has seven dependents. She sells food supplies. Business is going very well and she plans to increase sales.

She is asking for $325.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food supplies to sell

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr:
Adzo A. is 37 years old, married, and a mom. To earn money in order to provide for her children's needs, she makes and sells mocha coffee in a small village in the mountains surrounding Kpalimé, one of the biggest cities in Togo. As you can see in the photo, she does not have the basic ingredients to do her work. So, she sells charcoal on the roadside. With this FECECAV loan, she wants to buy the basic ingredients for restarting her mocha business. Through the profits she is going to make from her sales, Adzo hopes to expand her enterprise in the coming years. She appreciates the opportunity that this loan will give her to improve the quality of life for her and her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Adzo A. est âgée de 37 ans, marié et est mère d’enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent afin de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, elle prépare et vend du café cacao, dans un petit village dans les montages qui entourent Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Comme on la voit dans la photo, présentement elle n’a pas les matières premières pour faire son travail donc elle vend du charbon au bord de la route. Avec ce crédit de FECECAV, elle veut acheter ces matières premières pour recommencer son travail de café cacao. Par les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses marchandises, Adzo espère agrandir son entreprise dans les années prochaines. Elle apprécie l’opportunité que ce crédit va lui donner pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie et la vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients

loans.name: Bolanlé

texts.fr:
Born around 1970 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Bolanlé A. comes from Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. Married to Jonas Odounfa, a transporter, she is the mother of four children; Ismaël (16) is in eighth grade, Constantine (13) is in sixth grade, Igor (9) is in third grade, and Josiane (6) in first grade. She retails cosmetics, soaps, and other beauty products. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1970 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du BENIN, dame A. Bolanlé est originaire du NIGERIA, un pays frontalier au BENIN. Mariée à ODOUNFA Jonas, transporteur,elle est mère de 04 enfants que sont Ismaël âgé de 16 ans,est élève en classe de Quatrième, Constantine âgée de 13ans est élève en classe de Sixième, Igor âgé de 09 ans est élève en classe de CM1 et Josiane 06 ans est en classe CP2. Elle est revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, de savons et autres produits de beauté. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer et satisfaire la démande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 4 cases of ointments and 2 cases of Fanico-brand soap

Achat de 04 cartons de pommades et de 02 cartons de savon FANICO.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Fabiana, a widowed 37-year-old mother of five children, is a member of the Brisas Village Bank, where she has learned to be punctual, responsible and frugal. Fabiana makes ice cream in a traditional style, which she learned from her current partner, as well as lollipops and milkshakes with the help of her daughter-in-law. She sells her products directly to a variety of regional fairs, in front of high schools, and on the streets of the city. Fabiana invested a previous loan to purchase a machine to begin her ice cream business. She now needs a loan of $575 to invest in sugar, ice cream cones, drinking glasses and a motor for her machine.

Fabiana’s dreams are to improve her business, become economically established, have her children study hard, and enjoy a tranquil old age.

loans.use: To invest in sugar, ice cream cones, drinking glasses and a motor for her machine.

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is from a small place called Snagovo, near the town of Zvornik. She is a 43-year-old woman and she is a widow. She does agriculture, crop husbandry, and cattle breeding. She receives a pension in the amount of 400 KM and she has help from her son who works.

Mina needs this loan in the amount of 1000 KM because she wants to buy a few goats and sheep. Her wish is to improve the monthly income for her family by selling sheep and goats after fattening them and to help her daughter with school.

loans.use: To buy sheep and goats

loans.name: Mwanvua

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Mwamvua Matwi from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child aged 13. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependent who is an orphan. Mwamvua has been running a shop where she sells shoes and hand bags since 2007. This SELFINA client's business is doing well. She works at the business for 8 hours per day and is assisted by one employee. Mwamvua currently earns about US$ 50 from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 250 in order to purchase an additional stock of hand bags and shoes. In the future, she plans to open another business.

She thanks you for your support! SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of shoes and hand bags

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria Elena tiene 30 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, tiene tres hijos de 1,5 y 8 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Maria tiene una pulpería, con cuatro años de experiencia, comenzó con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que están solicitando es para invertir en la pulpería, comprará productos percederos ya que actualmente cuenta con poco inventario de esos productos y desea surtir de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y la misma vez poder captar más clientela
texts.en:
Maria Elena is 30 years old, is married and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She has three children of 1, 5 and 8 years of age, and her husband works in security services, and contributes to household expenses. Maria has a small grocery store with four years of experience, which she started with her own funds. The loan that she is requesting is to invest in a small grocery store. She will buy perishable products as she currently has little inventory of these products and she wishes to diversify the products to satisfy the necessities of her clients and at the same time capture more clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products.

loans.name: Praderas Group

texts.es:
Las clientas del g/s  PRADERAS viene del barrio german pomares es una zona semi rural  de la ciudad de Masaya son de condición humildes y modesta, todas tuvieron la oportunidad de aprobar  primaria, esto las hace un poco expresivas en cuanto a lo que pretenden conseguir. 2 Miembros tiene negocio de elaboración de calzado y la coordinadora es dueña de una abarrotería, sus créditos los usan en la compra de inventarios para hacer crecer sus negocios, las clientas están confiadas en el éxito de sus negocios por que tiene buena ubicación y demanda de  sus productos. De aspecto muy humilde esta microempresarias nos han demostrado que se puede salir adelante cuando se tiene la disponibilidad, valor y tenacidad para salir de la pobreza, 
 Doña Thania le gustaría que su negocio se expandiera para obtener mayor ganancias y poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, Eugenia, es otra de las integrantes dice que ella quiere hacer crecer su negocio, necesita mas materia prima  ya que sus hijos le ayudan en la elaboración de sandalias, y de esta manera asegurarle la educación a sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
The members of the PRADERAS communal bank come from the German Pomares neighborhood, which is located in a semi-rural zone in the city of Masaya. They come from modest backgrounds, although they have had the opportunity to complete primary school, which makes them ambicious in terms of what they set out to achieve. Two of the members have a business making shoes and the other is the owner of a grocery store. They use their loans to buy inventory to increase the size of their businesses. The women are confident in the continued success of their businesses due to their good locations and the customer demand for their products. In a very humble way, these microenterpeneurs have demostrated that it is possible to get ahead when one has the willingness, courage and tenacity to get out of poverty. Thania would like her business to expand in order to gain more income and to be able improve the living conditions of her family. Eugenia, another member of the group, says that she wants to grow her business and needs more raw materials since her children can help her making the sandals, and thus secure an education for her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and supply their businesses

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim P., 30, is a single man who earns his living driving a taxi. He is able to make $23 in revenue per day. He has been doing this work since 2003. Currently his car has broken down so he needs to take out a loan of $800 to fix it. His car is a long term sustainable investment and he hopes to raise his standard of living.

loans.use: To fix his taxi

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 47 años, vive sola, ya que es soltera. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la venta de cuadros en el mercado Tupac Amaru, uno de los más concurridos de la ciudad de Juliaca, arrojándole buenos ingresos económicos. A Ruth le gusta su trabajo, ya que trabaja tranquila, sin complicaciones y ella misma dispone de su tiempo, empezando usualmente a las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 o 7 de la noche siendo estas horas las de más concurrencia. Lo difícil de su labor es el frío que hace en su puesto, ya que el sol no cae por ahí, teniendo que soportarlo, pero Ruth lo supera, sabiendo que siempre existen algunos inconvenientes en el trabajo. Ella se encuentra en su octavo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, siendo muy puntual en los pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cuadros en la ciudades de Tacna o Lima para venderlos en su puesto y así lograr mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 47 years old and lives alone because she is single. For 30 years she has sold pictures in the Tupac Amaru market - one of the most visited markets in Juliaca city - which brings in good income. Ruth likes her work because it is calm and without complication, and she can set her own hours. She usually starts at 8 in the morning and goes until 6 or 7 at night since those are the busiest hours. The difficult part of her job is dealing with the cold temperatures in her spot since the sun does not hit it. She has to put up with it and she overcomes the difficulty knowing that jobs always have some inconveniences. This is her eighth loan through Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with her payments. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase more pictures in Tacna or Lima to sell at her place and bring in better income.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more pictures

loans.name: Gustavo José

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo G. desde hace dos años decidió invertir en su negocio de servicio de reparación de bicicletas atendiéndolo todos los días y siendo visitado por varios clientes en su establecimiento en la ciudad de Managua.

Es importante destacar que en este negocio ha adquirido vasta experiencia por lo que es muy buscado para realizar este tipo de trabajos el cual es su sustento diario. Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito y es por esto que espera que su crédito sea aprobado a lo inmediato para así comprar las herramientas y continuar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Two years ago Mr. Gustavo G. decided to invest in his bicycle repair business, which operates everyday and is visited by various clients in his establishment in the city of Managua. It is important to highlight that in this business he has acquired vast experience which is why he is very sought after to carry out this type of work which is his daily sustenence. Today he has come to Ceprodel to benefit from a loan and this is why he hopes that his loan be approved immediately so that he can buy tools and continue his business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of parts

loans.name: Choup

texts.en: Choup L., 40, runs a small-size store out of her house, selling groceries like cooked foods and some sweets for kids. She is widowed and has one child, a daughter who is single. To help provide more food for the family's living, her daughter works in a garment factory and currently gets a salary of $70 a month. Choup L. is applying for a loan to purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en: K. Rashida is the chairperson of the Bugembe Katwe group in Jinja. She is a business woman who sells new clothes, mostly ladies’ and girls’ wear.  Recently she has added children's clothing. This is her eighteenth loan with the group. She has benefited by being able to construct rental houses as well as to pay school fees for her children, one of whom is at the University.
