She buys her clothes from Kampala twice a week and always has a large stock of new clothes. Rashida needs a new loan to be able to buy more clothes for sale. (The credit officer for the group, Richard, is also in the photo.)

loans.use: Buy more new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles Y. is thirty-six years old. He is married with four children, three of whom are currently in the basic school. The last-born is still breast-feeding. Charles says as a family man, it is necessary for him to work very hard to make income to meet the family’s expenses. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Mampong in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

Charles deals in polythene rubber manufacturing. He produces polythene rubbers and distributes to retailers and food vendors. Food vendors normally use the rubber to sell food to their customers.

He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure more raw materials to expand his business. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To expand rubber manufacturing business

loans.name: Abdukocim

texts.ru: Исматов Абдукосим житель Гиссарского района. Холост, живет с родителями.Семья небольшая , но он один является кормильцем семьи. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства.  Он откармливает бычков для реализации их на мясо. Бизнесом занимается уже 10 лет . Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка и таким образом увеличить поголовье скота. Сейчас нет проблем с кормом , поэтому покупка и содержание животных является выгодным.
texts.en:
Abdukocim I. lives in the Gissar district. He is single and lives with his parents. The family is small but he is its only provider. He has a business in animal husbandry. He raises bull calves and sells them for meat. Its a business he's been in for 10 years. He decided to request a loan to buy a bull calf and so increase his herd of livestock. Feed is not an issue right now, so buying and keeping livestock is profitable.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bull calf purchase

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
Purification A. formerly sold food in the streets. Now she grows rice, which she uses to feed and clothe her six children. Her husband is also a farmer. Together they work very hard to provide for all their needs. She wants to start  another business. She also wants to grow her rice field so that later on she can buy additional lots for a bigger income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy insecticide and herbicides. The loan will really help her increase her yield. The loan will definitely increase her income.

CEVI provides not just loans. They also provide credit, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase insecticide and herbicides

loans.name: Parveen Gulzar Group

texts.en:
My name is Parveen and, for the past 14 years, I have belonged to a city named Multan, Pakistan, which is famous for its shrines.

My husband’s name is G., and we both handle our decorative-embroidery business. I prepare embroidered dresses and my husband sells them to the clothes shops and earns income. We’ve been in this business for the past three years. The shopkeepers are satisfied with our work. I’m applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, beads and cloth) to complete the orders and to earn a good income.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my locality:

Mumtaz baji and Nasreen baji each want a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) for their decorative embroidery business.

Aziza baji and Naseem baji each want a loan to buy clothes for their clothes-selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia D. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 34 years old. Arsenia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arsenia owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arsenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to buy a lot for the family's house. Arsenia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP (US$250), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell at her store. This loan will be the third loan Arsenia has taken out  from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell at her store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Irma Etelvina

texts.es: La señora Etelvina es originaria del cantón Xolsacmalja del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán y ella se dedica al amarrado de hilo el cual es utilizado en el matizado del corte típico y otras prendas de vestir, de las mujeres del departamento. Hoy en dia ella ve la necesidad re realizar un prestamo que sera utilizado para la remodelación de vivienda para el bien de la familia y asi vivir una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Etelvina is from the canton Xolsacmalja of the municipality and department of Totonicapán. For work she is dedicated to tying thread which is used to tint the typical cut of clothing and other typical apparel of women in the department. Today she sees the need to request a loan that will be used to remodel her home for the good of the family and thus live a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. is 58 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh City where she sells vegetables that her husband grows. She also buys vegetables from other farmers to sell to customers who need vegetables. She is married and has two children, both of whom are employed. Her married child is a fisherman and her single child is a blacksmith.

Sok S. manages her investments very well. She can generate an average of $5 of income each day to meet her family’s daily requirements. Sok S. is taking a loan to buy a used motorbike for her children to ride to work. With the remainder of loan, she will increase her business capital .

Note: The man shown in the picture is Mrs. Sok S.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for her children to ride to work

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
Charline B. is from the village of Danao. She is 27 years old. Charline is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Charline owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Charline has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Charline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Charline is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Charline from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the fish business

loans.name: Zulola

texts.en:
O. Zulola is 20-years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Zulola is a market vendor who sells fabrics for national dresses in the local market. Zulola started this business because she needed money to be able to support her parents and to pay for household and personal expenses. Zulola has been in this business for 2 years. For these years she managed to make her business stable and profitable so that she can generate the income she needs for her family. Now Zulola is planning to expand her business and is requesting a loan of $800. This will enable her to have a wide assortment of fabrics. She promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all those supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase fabric to sell for making national dresses

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
La señora ANGELA A. C. , tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA , provincia de TRUJILLO, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES EN ACCION.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, refiere que le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Derecho pero por falta de recursos económicos de sus padres. Al terminar el colegió empezó a trabajar en casa, hasta que empezó a vender sandalias y regalos en un puesto del mercado que esta cerca de  su casa.
ANGELA es soltera y trabaja para apoyar a sus padres que son ancianos y para afrontar sus propios gastos.
Se dedica a la venta  de zapatillas y juguetes en el mercado cercano a su casa, refiere que ella ingresó a Manuela Ramos después de un viaje que realizaba a Lima para traer mercadería en el cual le robaron todo lo que traía y con el préstamo de  Manuela Ramos logró otra vez empezar con su negocio y seguir adelante.

El primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra de mas regalos y sandalias que trajo de la ciudad de Lima.
Este crédito de 1,100 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar zapatillas al por mayor y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
ANGELA sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Angela A. C. is 46, and she lives in the La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Perú. She belongs to the Mujeres en Accion Comunal Bank. This entrepreneur attended high school until the fifth year. She would have liked to have studied for a career in law, but could not because of her parents’ lack of economic resources. When she finished school she started to work at home. Then she started selling sandals and gifts at a stall in the market that is close to her house. Angela is single. She works to support her elderly parents and to pay for her own expenses. She sells shoes and toys in the market near her house. She joined Manuela Ramos after a trip she made to Lima for merchandise. On the trip she was robbed of all of the merchandise. With the loan from Manuela Ramos she was able to start her business again and get ahead. She used her first loan for 300 PEN to buy more toys and sandals that she brought from the city of Lima. With this loan for 1,100 PEN she will buy shoes wholesale and be able to get greater earnings. Angela dreams of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoes wholesale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margaret is a 39 year single mother of 5 children aged between 6 and 19 years.All her children go to school.  Margaret resides and rents a two roomed house where she staying with ten people. There is electricity and no piped water at home. Margret takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 10 customers a day. Margaret owns a pub selling beer and other soft drinks in Ntinda and sells to all categories of people.  She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are transportation and rent.  Margaret has been with MCDT for 10 years servicing her twentieth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda and beer Margaret is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and also build a house

loans.use: To buy crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Hanieh

texts.en: Hanieh is a 49-year-old single woman. She has been working as a home-based tailor since 2005 to earn income to satisfy the needs of her old mother. Hanieh is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine and additional textiles to meet the requirement of her clients and make a good income.

loans.use: buy a new sewing machine and additional textiles

loans.name: Cristhiam Guadalupe

texts.es: Cristhiam de 37 años de edad es soltera, tiene una niña de 4 años de edad, trabaja para el MINED como maestra de primaria desde hace 20 años, esta solicitando su 7mo credito para continuar mejorando su casa, pues anteriormente ya habia sido beneficiada con KIVA pero no logro terminar con la construccion, tiene los materiales pero no cuenta con el suficiente dinero para comprar las puertas y ventanas, ademas del pago de la mano de obra, por lo que solicita se le financie el credito y asi lograr darle mejores condiciones de vida a su bebita que es la razon de su vida y a quien desea darle las mejores condiciones para que crezca en un ambiente comodo y agradable.
texts.en:
Cristhiam is a 37 year old single woman. She has a four year old daughter. She has worked for MINED as a grade school teacher for twenty years. She is requesting this seven month loan to continue improving her house. She has previously been a beneficiary of Kiva, but she was unable to finish the construction. She has the materials, but she does not have sufficient money to buy the doors and windows, or further to pay for the labor. This is why she is requesting the financing of this loan in order to manage to give her young daughter better living conditions (who is the reason for her life) and who she wants to give an environment that is comfortable and pleasant.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy housing construction materials

loans.name: Dona

texts.es:
La señora Dona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de La Inmaculada”,  Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 55 años, 03 hijos; todos independientes.

Su espíritu  luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes. Dona nos cuenta que lleva 10 años en este negocio y empezó vendiendo huevos y galletas, poco a poco fue ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad y haciéndose muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, invertirá comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Dona, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Dona belongs to the communal bank, "Virgen de La Inmaculada" in the district of Tarapoto in the province of San Martín, in the department of San Martín. She is married, is 55, and has three chidren. Her fighting spirit has always characterized her, and her desire to get ahead through her own means have led her to open her own business selling groceries. Dona tells us that she has 10 years of experience with this business and started by selling eggs and cookies. Little by little, she has earned experience with this type of business and is making herself known and loved among her customers. Currently she has a loyal clientele who come to her store daily to buy why is necessary to run their homes. She personally attends to them with her the charisma she is know for. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will invest in the purchase of rice and sugar in sacks, noodles in packages, milk and preserved fish in boxes of a variety of brands, cleaning supplies for the home, and personal hygiene products to continue giving the best service to her customers. Dona is thankful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy groceries to raise the number of products she has

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is a widow. She lives in Vinogradovo and runs her small venture there. She started her business selling cosmetics and perfumes 10 years ago. Low competition and high market demand have enabled rapid growth in the business. Presently, Ganna has about 50,000 Grivnyas in her inventory. Her income amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Ganna is a hard-worker. She has proven to be a prudent borrower, as she never asks for a bigger loan that she can pay back. Lending services in combination with her perseverance, trustworthiness and responsibility have helped to guarantee success in her business. Ganna is seeking a loan of 6,500 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She would like to purchase assorted cosmetics at wholesale prices to re-sell them in her store. Ganna’s long-term goal is the continued expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics at wholesale prices

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel, 45 years old, owns a stall at the market in Agbor, Delta State, where she sells tubers of yam wholesale and retail to her customers. Yams are eaten boiled, roasted and fried in Nigeria. The demand for her tubers of yam is high and she hopes to meet the demand of her customers. This is the festive season and she hopes to make more profits.

Mabel is married with five children. Her eldest is 23 years old. Her husband is a welder and he also works to support the family. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna D., 54 years-old is a mother and a farmer in Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. She has three adult children who help her on the farm tilling the soil. They work from morning until sunset so that they ensure an abundant harvest because they really take seriously the growing of their rice crop.

She is hoping to receive a loan of 8,000 from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. In that way she will be able to improve the size of her harvest and her income.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional food to increase the variety of his goods

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebbecca is 30 years of age and is married with three children aged between 3 and 7 years. The family resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with five people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. The family has three meals a day.

Rebbecca owns a stall selling bricks in Kisaasi Kikoni. She has operated this business for over ten years and works seven days a week. She receives an average of twenty customers a day, selling wholesale only.

Rebbecca incurs transport costs to and from buying bricks and half-bricks from the village of Kulambiro. Her main challenges are seasonality and transportation. Her greatest monthly expenses include paying utility bills, medication and feeding the family.

Rebbecca has been with MCDT for one year and is servicing her third loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bricks.

Rebbecca is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to owning a business laying bricks herself.

loans.use: To buy more half-bricks to sell

loans.name: Maryanne

texts.en:
Maryanne W. M. is 38 years old. She is single and has two children aged 14 and 10 years old.

Maryanne has a safaricom M-PESA (money transfer) shop which provides money transfer services to the local people. Her business is located at Juja, a business market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples.

Maryanne says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business as hers, hence customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

She will use her loan of 50000 KES to increase her float to enable her serve more people. In the future, she hopes to open more M-PESA outlets to serve a larger market and become the market leader in this kind of business. She is a very hardworking and innovative lady.

loans.use: Increase float.

loans.name: Tamasyor Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Tamasyor' group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 each to enable them to further strengthen their businesses. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in size and quality. Consequently, they will make more sales and better profit. As their profit-to-sales-margin increases, they will better support themselves and their children.

The leader of this group is Sallay K., pictured on the right. Sallay was born in Kono, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. She is age 33. She is married to a businessman and they have 3 children – one in secondary school and two in primary school. Sallay sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil). She has been selling palm oil for 4 years now. Sallay will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells smoked fish at Elmina market.  Esi has no educational background.  She is a single parent living with her three children.  She is responsible for paying school fees for the children and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to process (smoking method) for sale. She hopes to use the profits she gets as a result of the loan, which served as increased capital, to save to give the children a meaningful education.

To smoke her fish, she goes to the seashore to buy fresh fish from the fishermen. She comes home with the fish, cleans or dresses them and drains the water that comes about as a result of washing the fish. She prepares her traditionally-made oven with firewood to smoke her fish for sale. Smoking the fish preserves the fish to keep longer before going bad.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to process

loans.name: Adinsi

texts.fr: Cette femme est une femme mariée, elle est mère de 5 enfants et vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de Bè kpota qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « Ets KANGO & FRERES ». Sa  clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Actuellement son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de divers produits d’alimentation générale afin de gonfler son stock.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of five children. She lives with her family in Bèkpota, which is a borough in the periphery of Lomé. She retails general food products in her own store she named “Ets Kango et Frères” (Kango & Bros. Cy). Her customers can be anyone and everyone. Her supplies are decreasing and she needs to replenish her stock, which is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy an assortment of general food products.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: María Azucena

texts.es:
María Azucena tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Lagunas del distrito de Mórrope, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayoría de su población dispersa en pequeñas áreas rurales, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la compra y venta de animales, empezó ayudando a su madre y actualmente se vale de esta actividad para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento familiar. Ella compra animales pequeños a sus vecinos, los termina de criar y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona, esta actividad es muy comun en la zona y tiene muy buena acogida.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento para seguir adelante con su negocio y poder ayudar a sus padres a salir adelante, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y hogareña, su anhelo es cuidar de sus padres y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona amable y respetuosa.
texts.en:
María Azucena is 37 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Lagunas sector of Mórrope district, a zone characterized by a population dispersed in small rural areas. It is part of Lambayeque province, and is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated since she was very young to buying and selling animals. She began helping her mother and, presently, she relies on this activity to cover her personal costs and help sustain her family. María buys small animals from her neighbors, raises them, and when they have reached a good point of development, she sells them to business people who visit the zone. This activity is very common in the region and many people do this. María wishes to expand her business by buying more animals and feed, in order to forge ahead with her business and be able to help her parents to get ahead. For this reason, she is for the first time approaching Edpyme Alternative for a loan of 2,000 new sols to help her reach her goal. She is a hard working woman dedicated to her home. Her dream is to care for her parents and offer them a better quality of life. María's neighbors and friends consider her an agreeable and respectful person.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING ANIMALS AND FEED TO EXPAND HER FARM ANIMAL SELLING BUSINESS

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Horizonte está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ella es la señora Adriana del Socorro M. G. quien desde hace quince años trabaja en costura oficio que aprendió y realiza junto con su esposo para mejorar su situación y en el cual ha instruido a sus cuatro hijos de 18, 17, 16 y 14 años respectivamente.
Ella desea comprar maquinas para mejorar el negocio y adquirir otro terreno para trasladar el taller el cual se localiza actualmente en su casa de habitación.
Sus compañeros son María Concepción A. L. quien vende frutas y verduras en el mercado todas las mañanas, licor en su casa por las noches y nacatamales los fines de semana y José María L. es comerciante de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The New Horizons group is made up of three hard-working people. Mrs. Adriana del Socorro M. G. started working as a seamstress when she was 15. She works along with her husband to improve their living situation; she has taught her children, 18, 17, 16, 14, respectively, how to sew as well. She hopes to buy sewing machines to improve her business and purchase a lot where she can relocate her shop, which she currently operates out of her house. Her partners are Maria Concepcion A. Lopez. Maria Concepcion sells fruit and vegetables in the market every morning, sells liquor from her house at night, and sells nacatamales on the weekedns. Jose Maria Lopez also sells fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 44 años, es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Flaviana de 45 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Cuando era niño, le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, se fue encargando él solo de las tierras de sus padres, ya que su hermano mayor decidió dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensos campos de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha alverja y papa, para luego venderlos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas de insectos que afectan su producción. Su mayor anhelo es comprarse un carro, para que pueda facilitar el transporte de su cosecha a la ciudad. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de alverja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Victor is 44 years old and a cheerful hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Flaviana, age 45, and their five beloved children for whom he wants to provide the best education. As a boy, his parents taught him everything about farming and as time passed he was given the responsibility to take charge of their land when his older brother decided to pursue other activities. Victor now has vast plots of farmland where he grows peas and potatoes, which are later sold at the wholesale market in Tarma. What he enjoys most about his job is cultivating the land since the work helps to feed his family. Victor has been in business for 20 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting his crops from plagues of insects that impact his production. His greatest wish is to buy a vehicle so that he can easily transport his harvest into the city.

This is his sixth loan with MFP. Victor has always been punctual with his payments and hopes to continue to do the same with this loan. In his Communal Bank, he is one of the members who gets along well with the rest of the group. With the loan of 2000 PEN that he requested, Victor will buy seeds for planting peas since it is the crop that currently sells the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting his next crop of peas

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita V. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 44 years old, married and has four school-age children. They are from the town of Fugu Jones. Clarita has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Clarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Clarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase products to sell. Clarita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her tenth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 25 years old, married and has a 4-year-old child. Sheryl owns and operates a farming business, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sheryl has been engaged in her business for over 10 years now.

Sheryl joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sheryl has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Sheryl from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 60 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos, se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales.
La señora trabaja en la agricultura y contrata personas para que le ayude a sembrar, los horarios son indefinido, de acuerdo a la necesidad de trabajo, ella cultiva maíz y frijoles, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos: abono y fertilizante para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, este dinero contribuirá de mucha ayuda para producir una cosecha que se pueda vender, obtener ingresos, para cubrir gastos económicos.
Ana  tiene como objetivo que lo ingresos obtenidos por la venta de la cosecha, solventar los compromisos económicos, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ana María is 60 years old. She has a partner and 4 children. Ana María works in agriculture and breeds animals. She contracts people to help her to sow the crops. The work hours are not defined, and are agreed according to the work that is required. She cultivates maize and beans and is seeking a loan to purchase items such as fertiliser to cultivate the maize and beans. This money will contribute greatly to produce a crop that she can sell and obtain earnings to cover her economic costs. Ana María has the objective of using the earnings from the harvest to cover her economic obligations and help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul A. is 47 years old and was born in the south of Kyrgyzstan in a large family; her father was an actor and her mother was a schoolteacher. Unfortunately, in 1964, when Ainagul was one year old, her parents died in a car accident and Ainagul grew up at her grandmother’s house, helping her in the household: she milked cows and pastured the cattle.

From her childhood, Ainagul was eager to study and, after graduating from secondary school, she intended to pursue her studies through higher education. However, when Ainagul was 23, she was given into marriage.

Ainagul and her husband moved to the capital, Bishkek, where she graduated from Bishkek Humanities University with a degree with honors. Ainagul and her husband returned to the south of the country where Ainagul got a job as a researcher at Osh State University. In 1996, Ainagul divorced her husband. Some years later, Ainagul, being a very whole-hearted and persistent woman, adopted two little girls, who are presently 8 and 11 years old.

In 2004, Ainagul and her daughters moved to Belovodskoe village near the capital. It was the beginning of a new life which led Ainagul to start up her business. With an investment of only 6,000 Kyrgyz Soms, Ainagul started to sell foodstuffs at a local market in 2006. After four years, she already owns her own little shop.  Recently, she also bought two milk cows and began cattle-breeding.

Ainagul will use this loan of 100,000 Kyrgyz Soms to further broaden the range of the food products in her shop and to buy one more cow. With the revenues, she plans to renovate her shop and to give a good education to her daughters. As for Ainagul, she intends to get a driving license this year.


About Bai-Tushum and Partners:
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable members of the population. Its Kiva borrowers benefit from a 5% discount on their interest rate if they pay back without delay.

Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, it contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To broaden the range of her food products and to buy another cow

loans.name: Maxima Audely

texts.es: Máxima Audely tiene 44 años. Es madre soltera, Su actividad económica es la venta de productos varios. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde oficio. Por lo que no solamente se dedica a la venta de ropa si no que también a la venta de comida, ella es muy luchadora y siempre le ha gustado innovar en negocios pues ha sido productivo.  Ella tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación por lo que ha sido muy gratificante para ella. Por lo que sus inicios han sido muy difíciles y con mucho empeño es que ha salido adelante. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Maxima Audely is a 44 year old single mother. Her form of income is by selling various products; an occupation she has been dedicated to for more than 10 years. Not only does she sell clothes but she also sells food. She is a fighter and has always enjoyed business innovation which has turned out to be productive. She has been working with the lender, Leon Foundation, for a long time which has been very gratifying for her. Her start was very difficult and she has been able to get ahead due to her determination. This loan is for the purchase of raw material needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bella Beatriz

texts.es:
Bella de 21 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en una zona periurbana llamada “Perimetral”, su esposo le ayuda en la tienda, ellos tiene una hija. 

Iniciaron el negocio para obtener dinero y poder mantener a su familia, poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación de Bella y su esposo pudieron surtir mas su tienda. Venden todo tipo de legumbres y víveres. Trabajan desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer, uno de los sueño de ellos es que quieren que su tienda sea muy conocida. 

Para surtir mas su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceite, lácteos. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Bella is 21 years old and has a small store in Perimetral in the city's surround area. Her husband helps her with the store, and they have a daughter. They started the business to earn money to provide for their family, and little by little with Bella and her husband's hard work and dedication they were able to better stock their store. They sell all kinds of foods and vegetables. They work from very early until dusk. One of their dreams is for their store to become better known. With the loan, Bella wants to purchase rice, oil and dairy products to better stock the store. In the future, she wants to purchase a car so she'll be able to transport her supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, oil and dairy products

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario Vive en la localidad de la  Guardia, bario nuevo el Carmen distante a  18 km de  la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  cuenta con domicilio propio, su actividad de principal es la construcción(albañil), su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, lo cual le ayuda a su esposo para sostener  su economía, hace 5 año que trabaja como albañil desde que se vino a vivir desde Chuquisaca Capital de Bolivia, el destino del crédito solicitado es para arreglo de su vivienda que se encuentra en mal estado, siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le esta brindando, tiene cuatros hijos en edad escolar, por lo que se le hace difícil con su ingresos sacar adelante a su familia por lo que tienen que trabajar ambos para sostener a la familia
texts.en:
Sr. Mario lives in his own home in the Nuevo El Carmen neighborhood of La Guardia, which is 18km from the city of Santa Cruz. His main business activity is working in construction as a mason. His wife sells clothing as a street vendor to help with the finances. Mario started working as a mason five years ago when he came here to live from Chuquisac, where the Bolivian capital is located.

The loan he is requesting will be used to remodel his home which is in poor condition. Mario is grateful to Emprender for the support that has been provided. He has four school age children, so it is difficult for his family to get ahead on his income. Therefore, both he and his wife must work to support their family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina M. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 53 years old. Rufina is widowed and has a 28-year-old child. To make a living, Rufina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rufina has been engaged in farming for over 20 years. She used to farm with her husband. Now that she is a widow, she would hire some of her relatives to help till her farm.

Rufina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rufina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Rufina is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
El señor Juan David B. C. tiene 49 años, vive en la zona de Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe, provincia Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba.
El señor Juan David no ha podido estudiar porque la situación económica no se lo permitía, pero siempre es optimista esperando mejorar en un futuro. 

El se dedica a la agricultura, siendo esta su principal actividad, el cliente cuenta que para que le pueda ir bien en su actividad, un factor muy importante es el aprovisionamiento de agua para riego, y normalmente eso depende de que llueva. Pero estos últimos años su producción es pequeña porque no dispone de agua para regar sus plantas. Lo cual generado una preocupación en todos los comunarios.
El tiene el objetivo de cambiar esta situación y quiere incrementar su plantación de alimentos para lo cual necesita asegurar la provisión de agua. 

Es por esta razón ha solicitado un crédito para ser socio de un pozo de agua que le permita regar sus plantas y mejorar su economía. Al ser socio de un pozo de agua, muchos vecinos incluyendo su persona serán accionistas de un pozo común que les permitirá a todos abastecerse de agua de forma segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan David B. C. is 49 and he lives in the Cochabamba department, in an area of the Quillacollo province called Mallco Rancho – Sipe Sipe.
Even though Juan David’s economic condition did not grant him the opportunity to have an education, he keeps on being optimistic and hopes to improve himself in the future.
He engages in agriculture, which is also his main activity: he says that a key factor to guarantee prosperity to his activity is the supply of irrigation water, that is normally provided by rain. However, during the past two years his production has been low because of the lack of water to irrigate his plants, something that is a major concern for all the members of the community.
He aims to change this situation, and he needs to assure himself of water supply as he wants to increase his food plantation.
The reason why he has asked for a loan is to become a shareholder of a well: this will permit him to irrigate his plants and thus improve his economy. By joining the well, many of his neighbors and he himself will become shareholders of a community well, and this will give them all the chance to provide themselves with water in a safe way.

loans.use: To buy shares of a community well to get water to irrigate his plants.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 21 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama (sabanas, colchas, cubrecamas y toallas, vive con su familia y es padre de 2 hijos, el negocio de Luis tiene más de un año  de existencia y es el que le genera sus ingresos diarios, él reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel.
El solicita un préstamo para compra de mercadería para la venta, y ofrecer a sus clientes sabanas, colchas y todo lo referido a la cama, en diferentes estilos y colores, esta inversión le ayudara a estabilizar el negocio, a cubrir la demanda y a generar mayores ganancias.
El aspira ser comerciante empresario en un futuro y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man who is 21 years of age and sells linens (bed sheets, blankets, bedspreads, and towels). He lives with his family and is the father of two children. Luis has been in business for more than a year and is able to generate a daily income. He resides in the city and department of San Miguel.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy merchandise for sale. He wants to offer his customers bed sheets, blankets, and other bedding products in different styles and colors. This investment will help him stabilize his business, meet customer demand, and generate more income.

Luis aspires to become a commercial entrepreneur in the future and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets, blankets, bedspreads, and towels

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES to buy stock items such as bales of flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat, among other products. He operates a retail shop in Nairobi where he sells foodstuff and household items. His clients are mainly middle class earners in his neighborhood. John is married and he is the father to three who are in school. 

He describes himself as ambitious and persevering and hopes to be a major distributor of foodstuff in the future, with a desire of owning a wholesale shop in five years. John also sells kerosene and does photography for extra income. 

Faulu Kenya has provided him with relevant financial solutions to help him grow from a mere photographer to owning a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy stock items such as bales of flour, rice, sugar and cooking fat, among other products

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité Primavera nace hace de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de las señoras activas y que trabajan mutuamente para continuar con el comite.
Este comité son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
 Comentan que como grupo siempre surgen dificultades entre las integrantes, pero todas estan trabajando con mucho compromiso de pago semanal de las cuotas, y desean continuar trabajando conjuntamente.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Luciana S., quien se dedica  la cofeccion y bordados.
Ella posee máquinas que realizan los bordados de acuerdo a los diseños que elige cada cliente.
Cuenta con muchos cliente ya su taller de costura se encuentra en un lugar muy concurrido.
Se siente satifecha con esta actividad y mas adelante desea ampliar su taller comprando maquinas y contratando persona.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio con en la materiales que utiliza diariamente, hilos, agujas especiales de diferntes tamaño, telas de varios tipos y otros.
texts.en:
The committee called “Primavera” (Spring) was started two years ago with the effort and support of a group of active women who work together to keep their committee going. This committee has become known locally as a group of hardworking women. It should be mentioned that this group always rises above any difficulties encountered by its members. They all work with great commitment to complete their weekly payments and desire to continue working together.

One of the members is Sra. Luciana S., who engages in sewing and embroidery. She owns embroidery machines that she uses to produce the designs selected by each of her customers. Luciana has many customers and her sewing workshop has become a very busy place. She is pleased with her business and looks forward to expanding her workshop by acquiring more machines and staff.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in her business. Luciana will acquire materials that she utilizes on a daily basis such as thread, special needles in different sizes, various fabrics, and other supplies.

loans.use: Purchase thread, needles, fabrics, and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is from the village of Dapaon. She is 38 years old. Tessie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Tessie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing & shoe products in the local community. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Tessie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Soun

texts.en: Soun S., 38, is a professional tailor in Kampong Chhnang province. She is married with five children who are still living at home, and her husband works in security. She typically makes about $6 USD each day. Soun S. would like a loan to purchase a motorbike. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mujeres Forjadoras Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es la presidenta del grupo “Mujeres Forjadoras” desde hace 6 meses, el grupo está conformado por 9 vecinas que llevan trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 1 año. Rosa a sus 50 años, conviviendo y con 4 hijos, se dedica a vender polos desde hace medio año, además de hacer servicios para gamarra desde hace 1 año y ah logrado apoyar los estudios de sus hijos hasta el momento, indica que de tener un buen capital pondría su propio Stand comercial en gamarra, pero para llegar a lograr esta meta sabe que deberá trabajar duro y recibir la ayuda de Edaprospo con sus habilitaciones.

Les acompaña la hermana de la Sra. Rosa.
texts.en:
Rosa has been the president of the "Mujeres Forjadoras" group for six months.  This group is made up of 9 neighbors who have been working with Edaprospo for one year.

Rosa is 50 years old.  She lives with her partner and has four children.  For six months she has been selling polo shirts.  She has also been working for the City of Gamarra for one year and has managed to support her children in their studies.  She says that if she had good capital she would set up her own sales stand in Gamarra but in order to achieve this goal she knows that she will have to work hard and receive help in the form of loans from Edaprospo.  The group members are accompanied by Rosa's sister.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two school-aged children. He has worked in the car repairs field for 21 years, and in 1990 he opened his own car spare parts shop. Parallel to this, he owns a small car mechanics garage. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or a small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional car spare parts for his shop so he can satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional car spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more batteries, soap, mosquito spray, body lotion etc.

loans.name: Saber

texts.ar: صابر في عمر 47 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يحب عائلته ويكن لها كل اهتمام يريد ان يؤمن لها حياة كريمة وجديدة من خلال تطوير نفسه وعمله يعمل في ميني ماركت له في عمله 8 سنوات دائم التطور والتجديد له تاريخ مشجع مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى الدعم الكبير من العائلة وقد ساهم في تطوير عمله يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء قطع سيارات وقطع غيار زيت للسيارات بهدف فتح مصلحة جديدة تزيد له من مدخوله وتدعم عائلته مادية وتطور عمله فهو له زبائن كثر من محيطه وله معارف كثيرة في محيطه العملي
texts.en: Saber is 47 and married with 4 children. He works in a mini-market and has 8 years experience. He loves his family very much and they are his priority. He wishes to secure a comfortable life for them by developing himself and his business. He has an encouraging history with Al Majmoua, which contributed to the advancing of his business. He wants this loan to purchase car parts with the goal of opening a new section in his business, and thereby increasing his income. He has the full support of his family, and wants to provide for them financially. He has many local customers and clients.

loans.use: Purchase of spare car accessories, spare parts, and automotive oil

loans.name: Brenda Julissa

texts.es: Brenda Julissa G. C., de veintitrés años de edad, vive con su esposo José Alexander y su hija de dos añitos de edad Brendita, ella posee desde hace mas de dos años un chalet en el municipio de San Pedro Masahuat, departamento de La Paz,  sobre una de las principales calles de este municipio. Gracias al chalet Brenda a encontrado una forma de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y cuidar ahí mismo de su pequeñita, ella se esmera porque su hija cuente con todo lo necesario. En esta época del año sus ventas han mejorado significativamente y es por esto que desea incrementar su inventario de productos a través del crédito solicitado,  además de contar con productos que demandan sus clientes y a la fecha no tiene.-
texts.en:
Brenda Julissa G. C., age twenty-three, lives with her husband, José Alexander and their two year old daughter, Brendita. For more than two years, she has had a stall in the municipality of San Pedro Masahuat, department of La Paz, on one of the main streets of this city.

Thanks to the stall, Brenda has found a way of helping her husband with the household expenses while caring for her little girl. She does her best to give her daughter everything necessary.

In this season of the year, her sales have improved significantly and that’s why she wants to increase her inventory of products through the loan she has applied for. In addition, she wants to have products that her customers demand and which she doesn’t yet have.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and juices for making smoothies and medicine for inclusion in her inventory.

location.town: San Pedro Masahuat, Departamento de La Paz

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em Soklin, 32, has been a recycling buyer since 2000, and she always rides her old bicycle to buy all kinds of old things. She earns an income of approximately $3.25 per day, 

Her husband works growing a rice crop on his own farm, and he can get an income of about $1 per day. 

These two try their best to work. They have been married for many years, but they don’t have children yet. 

She would use this loan to purchase used goods to stock up for resale and to buy a new ladder to replace the broken one. The loan from Kiva’s partner HKL will increase her daily income. 

She dreams of having a big wooden house and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more used goods for resale and to buy a new ladder to replace the broken one

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is married to I. A. who operates a grocery store in the community market and also works as a farmer and grows cotton, wheat and other seasonal crops. Razia herself is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are very young and are not of school-going age. Her youngest son is only three months old and requires the full attention of his mother. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to improve his grocery store business. Through the loan, he will put more groceries into his grocery store to fulfill the needs of his customers and to earn better profits. Razia is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and upgrade her family’s living standard. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is a responsible client and pays her installments on time. She belongs to Mian Channu which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture. Her house contains four rooms and she has been living in it with her family for the past seven years.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Dimitri

texts.en:
Dimitri T. comes from the village of Aradeti, Kareli District. He is 57 years old, married and lives with his wife Lena and mother. Dimitri and Lena earn a living with agricultural activities. They have a milk cow and two calves. Lena makes cheese and sells it in Kareli. In addition, they have plot of land where a variety of fruits and vegetables are grown. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,100 Laris. 

Dimitri requested credit, as he needed cash for cultivating his plot. He plans to buy fuel for his tractor (for tilling) and fertilizers. He plans to sow potatoes, onions and tomatoes. He hopes that fertilizing will result in an increased volume of harvested vegetables and fruits and that the family’s income will increase. One part of the profit will be reinvested and the other part will be used for satisfying family needs.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for his tractor and to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Abundia

texts.en:
Abundia is married and runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines. She works hard to support her five children. 

Abundia is requesting a 1,800 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove. She is getting the cookstove to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Abundia is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove she is not only saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit cookstove

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiru

texts.en:
Lucy, age 50, is a farmer. She plants and harvests crops and sells farm produce, and also practices livestock rearing. She has been engaged in this business for eight years and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. Lucy's husband Jackson runs a retail shop, and together they support their two children, ages 15 and 17. 

This is Lucy's fifth loan cycle from KADET Ltd and she has successfully repaid all her previous loans. With her new loan funds, she intends to buy a dairy cow for milk production. She will in turn sell the milk.

Lucy hopes to support the education of her children and plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 50, is a village woman living in Dongkor commune, a part of Phnom Penh. Since 2006 she has been selling a variety of merchandise from home.

Kong is a widow. She has three single children; two are employed, one as a hairdresser and the other as a casual construction worker.

Kong also has a son who is not yet working. She would like to help him get work, but she has no cash to make that possible. So Kong would like to request a loan to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi for him.

loans.use: to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi for her son to begin a service business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 32-year-old businesswoman who is married and has a seven-month-old child. In order to be self-reliant, she established her plastic bowls, buckets and plastic utensil business in 2007. Open 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she sells large quantities of her stock to provincial businessmen and women.

She is now requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to purchase plastic bowls, buckets and other plastic utensils in large quantities in order to reduce the number of trips she must make to neighbouring Guinea, where she gets her supplies. A hardworking woman, she is determined to continue to improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic bowls, buckets and other plastic utensils for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Nancy

texts.en:
Ma. Nancy is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Nancy is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Ma. Nancy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Nancy requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her stall.

Ma. Nancy has been in this business for five years. Ma. Nancy would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Parsalunye

texts.en:
Parsalunye is 33 years old and married with three children. He has been a mixed farmer for the last 10 years.

He was introduced to KADET by a registered client in his abode. This is his third loan with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs, i.e. fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plow back into farming and in part to repay the loan.

His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his kids to higher levels of education.

He an industrious man who struggles to achieve without funding.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha C. es una mujer de 54 años que vive en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas. Ella es  madre de cinco hijos, vive con su esposo en la parroquia de Rio Verde desde hace diez años. Su esposo se llama Flavio Sanchez, tiene 46 años y es chofer de un bus urbano en Santo Domingo. Junto a ellos únicamente viven dos de sus cinco hijos, de 10 y 15 años. 
Bertha es un ejemplo de trabajo y sacrificio, como una anécdota nos cuenta que en una ocasión apresaron por error a uno de sus hijos que trabaja como chofer en un taxi y este hecho lo recuerda con mucho dolor ya que marcó sus vidas.
Desde hace cinco años ella trabaja vendiendo productos cosméticos en oficinas y hogares del cantón, Bertha únicamente ha cursado la primaria y al verse en la necesidad de aportar económicamente a su hogar ingresó como vendedora en una empresa de multinivel de cosméticos
Es una luchadora y cada día se esfuerza por sacar adelante su hogar, su gran sueño es ver a sus hijos profesionales y luego ella quiere arreglar su casa. Actualmente ella recibe ayuda de una de sus hijas que trabaja como secretaria. Ella vende los productos de su madre a sus compañeros de trabajo. Bertha trabaja 8 horas al día y nos comenta que lo más difícil de su actividad es “cobrar” ya que a muchas de sus clientes ella les entrega los productos a crédito por la competencia que existe.
Bertha solicitó a Fundación Alternativa un crédito con el cual podrá comprar más productos cosméticos para la venta y mejorar sus ingresos. Espera así poder cumplir con los gastos en educación para sus dos hijos menores.
texts.en:
Bertha C., age 54, lives in the Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province.  She has five children, and she has lived in the Rio Verde parish for ten years.  Her husand is Flavio Sanchez.  He is 46 years old, and he is an urban bus driver in Santo Domingo.  Only two of her five children, ages 10 and 15, live with them.

Bertha is an example of work and sacrifice.  As an anecdote, she tells us that one time they erroneously arrested one of her sons who works as a taxi drive.  This fact is very painful for her to remember because it marked their lives.

For the last five years Bertha has been selling cosmetics in offices and homes in the canton.  Bertha only has an elementary school education.  Upon seeing the need to financially support her household, she started selling cosmetics for a multilevel company.

She is a tenacious woman who puts forth effort every day in order to get her household ahead.  Her big dream is to see her children become professionals.  Then, she wants to repair her house.  

She currently receives help from one of her daughters who works as a secretary.  This daughter sells her mother’s products to her colleagues at work.  Bertha works eight hours a day.  She tells us that the most difficult part of her business activity is charging.  She gives many of her customers credit because of the existing competition.

Bertha requested a loan from the Fundación Alternativa.  With the loan she would be able to buy more cosmetic products to sell and to improve her income.  She hopes to be able to cover the educational expenses for her two minor children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata est une femme mariée de 53 ans qui gère 5 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 17 et 33 ans. Elle exerce une activité diversifiée de commerce et  s’active dans la vente de pain, de glace et en même temps pratique l’activité de couture chez elle depuis plusieurs années.  C’est son souci de ne pas rester oisive qui l’a poussé à épouser l’activité de commerce. C’est pendant la période de l’année scolaire que la vente de pain et de petit déjeuner marche le plus tandis que pendant la période de chaleur la vente de glace connait une bonne évolution.  Aminata est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2002. Elle  a déjà remboursé 5 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’institution. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat en grande quantité des denrées comme le haricot  et autres ingrédients qui lui permettent de préparer ses repas  et  bénéficier de  prix compétitifs. Les bénéfices que lui génèrent  son activité lui permettent de supporter les frais de paiement de loyer et aussi d’assurer quelques dépenses  liées aux besoins familiaux.
-
texts.en:
Aminata is a 53-year-old married woman with five children ranging from 17 to 33 years old. She runs a diversified trade activity selling bread and ice, and has also worked from her home as a seamstress for several years. She started her trade activities for fear of remaining idle. The sale of bread and breakfast items hits its peak during the school year, whereas the hotter days see a rise in the sale of ice. 

Aminata became a member of the U-IMCEC branch in November 2002. She has already obtained and repaid five previous loans with the institution. She is now seeking a loan of 300,000 francs to stock up on food items such as beans and other ingredients necessary to prepare her meals, and take advantage of competitive pricing. The profits earned through her business allow her to pay her rent and various other family expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on food items needed for her business activities

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 35 years old and married with 2 children, ages 12 and 18. She runs a spare parts store in Waterloo near Freetown. She also takes care of 2 relatives as well as her immediate family.

Kadiatu has owned this business for 5 years and sells engine oil, used tires and wrenches at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is a lack of sufficient capital and inflation. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more engine oil, used tires and wrenches. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to  have capital of 60,000,000 SLL.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil, used tires and wrenches.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 26 years old and single with one child aged four years old. She has been running her grocery store for the last four years, making a monthly profit of KES 6,000. She has been loaned KES 15,000, which she plans to use to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell.

She plans to save the anticipated profit made in order to invest in another business. In the near future, she hopes to venture into the cereals business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y su hijo, es el único que trabaja, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, su padre le enseño este oficio y lo hace desde muchos años, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de fertilizantes para maíz y frijoles, el cual le permitirá tener mejores cosechas y tener más posibilidades de obtener mejores ganancias.
El sueño de José es sacar buena cosecha y de ese modo venderlo al mercado, y que su familia viva bien.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and child. He is the only member of his family who works. José is a farmer who grows basic staples. His father taught him this trade, which he has now engaged in for many years. He does not work on a set schedule.

José will use this loan to buy fertilizers for growing corn and beans. This will enable him to have better crops and greater possibilities to earn more income. His dream is to achieve a good harvest so that he can sell his products at the market and help his family to live well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing corn and beans.

loans.name: Minor

texts.es: Minor, está casado y vive con sus hijos y esposa actualmente que son su mayor prioridad. El lo que va comprar con el crédito son cerdos para su engorde. El comprara cerdos de engorde y todos los insumos necesarios para su posterior mantenimiento. El quiere engordarlos para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad y así obtener de estos los mejores resultados para su bienestar. El quiere ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro y generar  mayores ingresos para su estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Minor is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his main priority.  He plans to use the loan to buy pigs and all the necessary supplies for their maintenance. Once they are fully grown he will sell them at the local market for a good profit for his family's well-being.  He wants to give his family the best lifestyle possible in the future, and generate a greater income for economic stability.  This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan, but FUDECOSUR is giving him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Carolina Rosalia

texts.es:
Carolina de 37 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada  “Isla trinitaria”.
El negocio de ella es la venta de cosméticos como: perfumes, desodorantes, etc.
Ella inicio esta actividad con un capital bajo ya que sus vecinos la motivaron con esta actividad.
El horario de ella es de 8:00am hasta 4:00pm.
La dificultad de ella es el clima ya que es muy variado.
Tiene una hija de 14 años, estudia en colegio público.
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y para la compra de mercadería como: cremas, maquillajes, sostenes.
El sueño de ella es mejorar su vivienda,  ya que su casa está construida a base de caña y cemento.
texts.en: Carolina, 37, lives in a suburban zone called “Isla Trinitaria.”  Her business is selling cosmetics like perfume, deodorants, etc.  She started this activity with little capital; her neighbors motivated her to go into this business.  Her work schedule is 8am to 4pm.  Her difficulty is the changeable weather.  She has a 14-year-old daughter going to public school.  She’s asking for the loan to invest in the business buying merchandise like creams, make-up and bras.  Her dream is to make some home improvements since her house is built from a base of sugar cane stalks and cement.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like creams, make-up and bras.

loans.name: Boboashur

texts.ru: Бобоашур женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка. На иждивении у него находятся родители и младший брат. Для содержания семьи он занимается откормом скота и бойни. Мясо продает сам на рынке. Ему помогает младший брат. Он  хочет получить займ для закупа скота для бойни. Он надеется получить займ и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Boboashur is married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  He also support his parents and younger brother.  In order to provide for his family, Boboashur is involved in fattening up and slaughtering livestock.  He sells the meat at a market.  His younger brother helps him in this business.  Boboashur wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock for slaughter.  He hopes to get this loan and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for slaughter

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
Nagina is an embroidery expert. She is very skillful and produces beautiful embroidered clothes that she sells for a reasonably good profit. She is the mother of 4 sons, all of whom are young and do different kinds of work to financially support the family.

Nagina's husband has a spare parts shop. He offers both repair services and new spare parts to his customers. Nagina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. Her husband will use the loan to buy different types of spare parts and repair tools for the betterment of his business. He started the business last year, and Nagina is hopeful that it will become established after the loan investment.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nagina.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and repair tools

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is an embroidery expert. She started this business to financially assist her husband who sells clothes. He purchases clothes from a wholesale market in his city which is a big city, known for its textile industry, and then sells to his customers.

Shabana is the mother of 2 sons. Both of them stay at home and don’t study. She is a very caring lady and tries to give comfort to her family by her household work.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah because she wants to expand her embroidery business. With the loan she will buy embroidery material such as beads, sketches and coloured threads in bulk. This will allow her to make beautiful-looking embroidered clothes and earn more profit by selling them. She has been operating her business for many years and is confident about the success of her business after this loan investment.
She is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. During her previous loan, she established a good credit behavior and never missed a single meeting.

Note: "In the picture, the lady raising her hand is Shabana".

loans.use: to buy embriodery material such as beads, color threads and sketches.

loans.name: Yagbe Tn1 Group
