texts.fr: YAGBE TN1 est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont la représentante (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Chantal. Les membres du groupement vivent dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement,ce groupement sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Chantal est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Chantal est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Moïse. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à leur charge.Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Chantal subvient ensemble avec son mari aux besoins du ménage. Chantal n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Chantal mène comme activité la vente de charbon de bois et des chaussures de façon secondaire. Chantal achète ses produits au Bénin et au Togo et les revend à son domicile et aussi par le système de distribution. Chantal exerce cette activité depuis seize ans. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à Chantal et aux autres membres du groupement YAGBE TN1, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en: YAGBE TN1 is a group of eleven people whose representative (with her hand raised in the photo) is called Chantal. The group members live in the same neighbourhood. In order to increase their working capital, this group is seeking a second loan with Alidé. Chantal is 39 years old and lives in Benin. Chantal is married to a driver called Moïse. The couple have four children all living at home. All the children are school educated. Chantal, together with her husband, meets the family's basic needs. Chantal never went to school. To meet her needs and those of the children, Chantal is a seller of charcoal and, to a lesser extent, shoes. Chantal buys her products in Benin and Togo and resells them from home, and also via a distribution system. Chantal has been doing this for sixteen years. This second loan will allow Chantal and the other members of the YAGBE TN1 group to grow their business, and to increase their customer base and their income.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal and shoes

loans.name: Johnsen

texts.en:
Johnsen is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past three years, Johnsen has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells food and household supplies to local customers.

To help expand his business, Johnsen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil for resale, and it will help Johnsen to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Johnsen hopes that in the future he will be able to construct more rental houses for extra income. 

Johnsen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Johnsen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Jaime Adalberto

texts.es:
Jaime Adalberto, un hombre de 47 años que vive y trabaja junto a su familia en la ciudad de Ica, caracterizada actualmente por el incremento de inversión, no solo en la agro exportaciones, si no también, en la apertura de nuevos centros comerciales que brindan muchos puestos de trabajo a personas que quedaron sin ellos tras el sismo de 8.0 grados en el año 2007.  

Jaime se dedica a trabajar todo el tiempo para que junto a los ingresos que obtiene su esposa como empleada del hogar puedan ganar el dinero que se necesita para poder  cuidar y alimentar a sus 2 niños, uno de sus menores tiene 3 años y ya se encuentra cursando el nivel inicial, mientras que el mayor  de 8 años se encuentra en el nivel primario, ambos acuden diariamente a la escuela.	
					
El señor Jaime es maestro constructor, él se ha dedico a esta actividad desde muy joven, trabaja en promedio 8 horas diarias, gracias a su padre y la motivación que le brindo él puede dedicarse a este negocio ya que desde muy joven empezó a enseñarle todo lo necesario para que desenvolviera en este rubro. En un día Jaime puede atender sólo a un cliente, debido a la cantidad de trabajo que le demandan y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente S/.60 diarios y en algunas ocasiones cuando tiene mucha suerte y trabajo puede ganar hasta S/.100 lo que le permite pagar algunos gastos que tiene. Su pequeño negocio tiene éxito por la gran cantidad de gente que necesita algunas labores del sector construcción, ya sea porque estos son muy complicados de realizar. Por el momento desea que los prestatarios Kiva puedan ayudarlo para poder realizarse un tratamiento médico en la rodilla debido a que sufrió un accidente en la rodilla y le es muy incomodo para trabajar, también desea poder comprar algunos muebles que son necesarios para sus hijos, él desea poder pagar el total de su crédito en 12 meses.

El piensa que este préstamo lo ayudará mucho a mejorar en la agilidad de su trabajo, debido a que por el momento tarda más de lo normal por el constante movimiento de la rodilla herida, y los muebles que podrá comprar le permitirá darle a sus pequeños una mayor comodidad y así espera que en algunos meses este totalmente recuperado y empiece a mejorar su vivienda lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su sueño de terminar de construir y que sus hijos sean unos grandes profesionales en futuro.
texts.en:
Jaime Alberto, 47, lives with his family in Ica.  Ica has had an increase in investments, not only in agricultural exports but also in the opening of new commercial centers that offer work to people who have been unemployed since the 2007 8.0 earthquake. 
Jaime works full time to put earnings together along with those of his wife, a domestic, so that they can have the money needed to care for and feed their two children.  One of the children is 3 and he is already in pre-school, while the older is 8 and in the first grade.  They both attend school every day.

Jaime has been a master construction worker for the past 8 years and works an average of 8 hours a day.  Thanks to his father and the motivation that he has, he can perform this work since his father started teaching him all he needed to know from the time he was very young.  Jaime can only take care of one customer a day because of the amount of work that he is asked to do, and this lets him earn about 60 sols per day.  Sometimes when he is very lucky and has many jobs, he can earn up to 100 sols.  This allows him to pay some of the expenses that he has.  

His small business is successful because of the great number of people who need construction jobs done, since these are very complicated to do.  Now he wants the loans from Kiva to help him have medical treatment on his knee because he had an accident and it’s hard for him to work.  He also wants to buy some furniture for his children and he would like to be able to pay off the financing in 12 months.
He thinks that this loan will help him improve his agility in his work, because now it takes him longer than normal since he is constantly moving his injured knee.  The furniture that he will buy will be more comfortable for his children and since he expects to be totally recuperated in a few months, he wants to begin improving his house.  The loan will help him fulfill his dream of finishing building and helping his children become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to have medical treatment on his knee and to buy furniture for his children

loans.name: Sila

texts.en:
Sila lives in Changamwe, Kenya. He deals in the taxi transport business which he has been running for three years. He also runs a clothes shop.
He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase clothes. The main challenge Sila faces is competition and few customers during the low seasons. That is why he wants to diversify into the clothes business.
His ambitions include supplying clothes to the area.  Sila will use the extra income obtained from the business to purchase more items for the business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Mentor

texts.es:
Mentor tiene 39 años de edad es casado vive con la esposa y con los 3 hijos en el Cantón Chillanes provincia  de Bolívar.

La ventanilla LUZ Y PROGRESO se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Josè de Guayabal, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz, mora, fréjol.

Mentor  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol, mora desde hace tres años. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Chillanes.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz, fréjol, mora. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es incrementar los sombríos de mora para tener mejores ingresos y así un mejor estilo de vida  Le gusta salir a jugar fútbol  y  que llegue el carnaval.
texts.en:
Mentor is thirty-nine years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolívar.

The loan group Luz y Progreso [Light and Progress] is located in the San José de Guayabal area, in the Chillanes canton. This loan group is devoted to short term agricultural work; i.e. cultivating corn, beans, and peas.

Mentor began working as a farmer cultivating corn, beans, and berries three years ago. He makes his purchases and sales in Chillanes.

He is requesting the loan to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for use in cultivating corn, beans, and berries. The loan has helped him to increase his revenue so as to provide for his family and to invest. His dream is to increase his berry fields so as to have more income, and also a better quality of life. He enjoys playing football [soccer], and is looking forward to the arrival of the Carnival festival.

loans.use: to purchase manure, urea, and liquid fertilizers for use in cultivating corn, beans, and berries.

loans.name: Mirabbas

texts.ru: Mirabbasu 59 let, on jenat i u nego 6 detey kotorie jivut s nim. On master po proizvodstvu okon I dverey. Na danniy moment on polzuetsa starimi aparatami i v budushem on xochet priobresti instrumenti noveyshix texnologiy dla bolshego I luchchego proizvodstva i nanyat 2 rabotnikov dla pomoshi. Mirabbas xochet kredit 300 azn chtobi priobresti materiali dla remonta u seba doma I nadeetsa na pomosh dobrix ludey.
texts.en: Mirabbas is 59 years old, married and has six children, who live with him.  He is a master in making windows and doors.  Currently, he uses old equipment and in the future wants to purchase new tools with the newest technologies in order to significantly increase and improve production and hire two workers to help him.  Mirabbas wants a loan in the sum of 300 AZN to purchase materials for making repairs in his house and relies on the help of kind people.

loans.use: to buy construction materials in order to repair his house

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es:
Martha tiene desde hace 4 años una venta de productos de uso personal a través de catálogo, con la cual genera ingresos para contribuir económicamente en el sostenimiento del hogar donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Gracias a que ofrece un muy buen servicio a sus clientes ha logrado captar una gran cantidad de clientes, lo que le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Por esto, como se avecina la temporada del día de las madres, Martha busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos de uso personal para poder tener un buen surtido para la temporada del día de las madres.

De esta manera podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes gran variedad de productos lo que le garantizará tener muy buenas ventas. Su sueño es que su pequeña venta de productos se convierta en un gran almacén donde pueda generar empleo para las demás personas. También espera que con su negocio se siga mejorando la calidad de vida en su hogar y también tener mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.

loans.use: Comprar productos de uso personal para poder tener un buen surtido para la temporada del día de las madres.

loans.name: Osinatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Osinatu. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 15. In 1994, Osinatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to generate enough funds to support her children. Her business is located at a city center, and her main customers are mostly women. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 780,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Osinatu has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy window curtain, wax Cotton, simple lace, and dry cotton material. 

She hopes that this loan shall increase her stock and profit level. In the future, Osinatu plans to educate her children, develop her plot of land, and rent a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy window curtain, wax Cotton, simple lace, and dry cotton material

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Analiza is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Gabriela Stefani

texts.es:
Gabriela con 21 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su hija, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral(patos y pollos) y cuyes. Adicionalmente prepara alimentos para venta al público. Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de cerdos para su negocio y otros gastos personales. De esta manera atenderá la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar.

Gabriela es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: para invertir en la compra de cerdos para su negocio y otros gastos personales.

loans.name: Ipu

texts.en: Ipu is a married woman with 10 children. She runs a family business which cuts lawns in Samoa. She has had two loans from SPBD and is now seeking a third. With her first $100 loan she was able to renovate a shed which houses the business. This enabled the business to be moved from her house. With her second loan she was able to buy a new weed eater and she wishes to use her third loan for the same. At the moment the business owns 4 second hand weed eaters. At the moment the business has five regular customers whose lawns are mown once a fortnight. The business also does many non regular jobs and is looking to expand.

loans.use: Purchase a “weed eater”

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the range of foods, to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation, a local NGO based in Ghana, has been assisting women, especially in business, for quite a number of years now. Agnes N. O. is a client of this organization. She operates a retail shop where she sells various items. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her improve upon her sales.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the amount of pigs for sale.

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu K. is twenty-seven years old, married with one child. He buys baskets of fish and supplies them to retailers in Magburaka Market. Since he is an elder son in his father's family, he takes care of his brothers, sisters, and mother in addition to his own family. As a breadwinner, he works hard to see that he makes enough income to meet household expenses.

With his previous loan, K. was able to make a $20 profit weekly. With additional loans of $200, Abu will increase his profit. He is also planning to save some money to enable his wife to develop another business to further increase family income.

loans.use: Expansion of fish-selling business

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mui is 35 year old, married and a mother of six. Her business is selling vegetables everyday from her house. She takes the vegetables to the new market once a month and earns $150.00-$200.00 a week.

loans.use: To buy weed killing chemicals, knives, and other supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Benta

texts.en: Benta is a 59-year-old mother of 8 living children. She lives with her husband in Nyamasaria Kisumu, Kenya. She is a poultry farmer, a venture she initiated in 2006. She keeps broilers, which grows fast (6 weeks) and are in high demand. She started her business with 100 chicks and now has 450. She sells mature broilers to hotels in town at US $4 a piece. She plans to expand the capacity of her poultry business by building an additional structure that can accommodate more chicks, buy chicken feed, and also employ 1 person to help her run the business. She has applied for US $800.

loans.use: Expand poultry business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is 34 years old, married and the mother of four children, three girls and one boy.  For the last five years, she has run a small restaurant in the local public market, where she serves traditional Dominican meals and juices.  Her business is doing well, with many customers stopping by daily for her specialties, such manioc with boiled or fried eggs for breakfast, or rice with beans and chicken or spaghetti with salami for lunch. On Dec. 31, she plans to prepare a ‘sancocho’ – a traditional meal maD. with chicken, pork chops, sausage, plantain bananas and other ingredients -- to serve at 11 p.m. She has done this for the last five years, and it has been hugely popular in her town. Juana has applied for a loan to buy the items she needs to run her restaurant, such as food and disposable plastic plates, and hopes that continued success will help her care for her children.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and other items for a small restaurant.

loans.name: Rahel

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Rahel D.. She is married with two children, ages 3 and 4. In 2003 Rahel established a business selling fish, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

loans.name: Satuni

texts.en: Satuni is 62 years old and married to A.. Her husband doesn't work anymore so she must work by herself to earn income for the family and her children's education. She sells vegetables at her house, earning $10.00 a day. She is asking for a loan of $150.00 to expand her business. As a member of MBK, she is willing to repay this loan within twelve months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Adelmith

texts.es:
Señora Adelmith Marín Gonzáles is a member of the communal bank called "Los Angeles". She lives in the region of San Martin in the city of Picota. She sells ice-cream such as candy bars, lollipops, melts, gelatin, snow-cones, and candy from the region. She sells her products by the river port in the city of Picota.

She started this business when she was very young. She loves to interact with people. She likes to support herself and to grow as a person/woman.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase ingredients to maker her ice-cream such as gelatin in bulk, sugar, flour, butter and eggs, seasonal fruit and other ingredients.

She is 31 years old and she has 3 children to support. With her good customer service and perseverance, she would like to be able to increase her earnings and her inventory for a better and stable financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Adelmith Marín Gonzáles es socia del Banco Comunal “Los Ángeles”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Picota y distrito de Picota, se dedica a la venta de refrigerios: como gelatinas, chupetes, refrescos, kekes, humitas , juanes y dulces de la región, en el puerto fluvial de la ciudad de Picota. Se inicio en su negocio desde muy joven por que le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, así mismo generar sus propios ingresos y crecer como persona y mujer. El crédito recibido de S/. 1000.00 el cual pagara en 6 meses comprará los ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de los refrigerios como: gelatina a granel, azúcar en kilos humitas, harina de trigo preparada, mantequilla, huevos, leche, frutas de la estación y otros ingredientes que empleara para que salga agradable sus preparados. Actualmente tiene 31 años, y tres hijos por quienes velar y luchar, con su amabilidad y encanto que le caracteriza y su perseverancia piensa incrementar un negocio con abarrotes que le de en el futuro una estabilidad económica.

loans.use: To purchase basic ingredients to make ice-cream

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Encarnación Group

texts.es:
This committee from the barrio San Miguel Centro, of the district of Cambyreta got started thanks to another group of a near by neighborhood, where one of the women invited one of the ladies to contact Fundacion Paraguaya to start their own group.

After having the required meetings the group "Mujeres Unidas de Encarnación" is formed. Nowadays they work with the loans in a responsible and punctual manner.

Currently the committee is formed by 17 hard working women. They work in different areas such as small general stores, dressmaking, hair salons, clothings sales, merchandise sales, food sales, among others. Each member receives an average of Gs. 800.000. The loans will be used to expand their businesses, in other words, to purchase more merchandise and materials such as: fabric, thread, buttons, elastics, zippers, flour, breads, canned goods, drinks, clothing, haircare products, cosmetics, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Este comité del Barrio San Miguel Centro del distrito de Cambyreta ha surgido por contacto de otro grupo formado en un barrio cercano, donde una de las mujeres invito a una de las señoras a contactar con la Fundación Paraguaya y formar su propio comité.

Luego de realizar las reuniones requeridas de presentación surge el grupo “Mujeres Unidas de Encarnación” que hoy día ya trabajan con el crédito solidario de forma responsable y puntual.

Actualmente el comité esta integrado por 17 mujeres trabajadoras. Las actividades de estas señoras consisten en: despensas, costura de prendas, peluquería, venta de ropas, venta de mercaderías, venta de comestibles, y otros. Cada integrante recibe en promedio la suma de Gs. 800.000. El destino de estos créditos será para la expansión de sus negocios, es decir para la compra de mas mercaderías e insumos como ser: telas, hilos, botones, elásticos, cierres, harinas, panificados, productos enlatados, bebidas, prendas de vestir, artículos para el cabello, productos cosméticos, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, haircare products, materials to prepare food, flour, breads, canned goods, rice, noodles, varied drinks, fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, elastic, lace, cosmetics, shoes and others.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba K., a married woman with 4 children, sells maize, yam and other food items. She travels to a distant town to buy food supplies in large quantities that she then resells to her customers. Business is going very well but the cost of transportation is a big problem.

She is asking for a loan to reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital, freeing up more capital per trip to purchase food items.

loans.use: To reduce the burden of transportation cost on her limited capital
